Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but great choice based on price, location and character”
Reviews.Author: Takalansi
Reviews.Content: Generally hotels in Singapore are not cheap so the Scarlet is great value for money in a very nice part of Singapore. From the outside it looks like a beautiful unique boutique hotel. Inside it is nicely decorated in a traditional (trying to be chic) manner. Rooms was quite small (but this is common in Singapore). As the hotel is a long thin building it does lose some of its boutique feeling if you have a room at the far end and have to walk down the long corridors. Almost no natural light in the room (no windows but a small light vent in corner of ceiling). Did not really spend much time in the hotel but it definitely is a good choice for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil retreat in the city.”
Reviews.Author: Mifil42
Reviews.Content: A beautiful boutique hotel with friendly and helpful staff - especially the concierges- who knew our names even though we were only there for two nights. The rest areas and the bars are very intimate and rich in decor. Our room was very clean, tastefully decorated and had lots of individual touches like the fresh flowers in the bathroom. The bed was comfortable and even though our room faced out onto the street noise was minimal. Breakfast was a delight, take time, go down early and enjoy!! This hotel is on the edge of chinatown, the market is at the end of the street and there is a streetfood market on the next street adjacent to the hotel every evening both well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Air conditioning noisy - even when turned off”
Reviews.Author: TravelEverwhere
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on two occasions whilst transiting Singapore. Unfortunately on both occasions I found the rooms to be noisy in terms of the noise coming from the air conditioning. This would not worry most people but I turn off the aircon at night but there is still this constant mechanical noise which is louder than expected, which for me is quite disruptive and on both occasions had a very resless sleep night. So..if you like a quiet room in which to sleep, you may think twice about the Scarlet. This is a personal thing that will not concern most people. The beds are also very hard. The rest of the hotel is nice and the location good. As I said this is review is based on a personal preference and not intended to be a negative against the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Initial Confusion”
Reviews.Author: lodgen
Reviews.Content: When booking the hotel several months ago, went to great effort to reserve twin beds. Arrived to find that this had been ignored and we were allocated a king bed. Stated that this was incorrect - had to "prove" by showing the confirmation email. After a number of phone calls to discuss, finally upgraded to suite - which was excellent and spacious, with a great balcony. The hotel is in a great location, and the bar and restaurant were good - breakfast was excellent. We will be returning in about a month - hopefully the check in will be smoother this time! Staff, after the initial issue, were extremely pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Must stay boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nejolla
Reviews.Content: The Scarlet is a perfect boutique hotel with a lot of charm in the heart of Singapore. Each of the rooms has a different design and are just a perfect size. The hotel is located just down the block from Chinatown and also the hop on, hop off tourist bus. One block over travelers can find quaint streets full of fantastic restaurants and small boutique shops. The Scarlet is also easily accessible to Singapore's business district being only a ten minute walk. Don't hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Best Boutique Hotel In Singapore”
Reviews.Author: thephuketinsider
Reviews.Content: Excellent is all I can say. Service was tops in a city not known for it, room worked well and very posh, restaurant was quality. Overall a top stay in a small but beautiful hotel, the location is good of business but lots of local flavor.

Reviews.Title: “Still My Favourite In The World”
Reviews.Author: glassviolin
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Scarlett a few times back in 2005/2006. It's still my favourite hotel I've ever stayed at. Ever. It's 5-star in a beautiful-unique-different-than-every-other-5-star-big-city-hotel. If you're wanting luxurious this is it! It's romantic, so business conferences should go elsewhere. Best Parts- the toiletries! I know, an unusual thing to list first. But they are amazing! The fabrics used all over the hotel are rich, luxurious, and just utterly beautiful. Rooms are huge and all unique, so if you don't like the layout of the first one you see ask for another. So-So parts- if you want a bathtub you have to go above the basic room. I love this place....every 5-star I've stayed at since all over the world has been compared to the Scarlett. So far, nothing has beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but tiny dark rooms..”
Reviews.Author: MattFletcher
Reviews.Content: Overall this isn't a bad hotel at all. Good location in Chinatown close to Boat Quay, Club Street and the City. The staff a pleasant, the decor is a little over the top but not unpleasant. Room rates are reasonable for Singapore. But the rooms are so small, you can really only sleep in them. Don't expect to lounge about and relax in your room! Plus you must make sure that you ask for a room with a window, there are a few without which are hideously dark.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quality/Price”
Reviews.Author: macavigo
Reviews.Content: We doubted a lot before booking a hotel in Singapore... It was only for two nights and we didn't want to spend all our budget for Singapore in a hotel... So after searching a lot, we booked in the Scarlet, as the price was not cheap (nothing is cheap in Singapore) but it was one of the cheapest and it looked great!!! The room was a Deluxe room. AS the price was the same in booking.com as booking directly with the hotel, we booked with them (i always think you can have a better room if you avoid booking by third party companies...). Our room only have windows in the upper part of the wall, so we couldn't see the street, but I have to say, didn't miss them too much. The decoration is really nice, with a touch of "rococo" style, if you get what I mean... Nice bed and beautiful bathroom... Facilites for tea&coffee, amenities... Room was not big, but perhaps cause I'm used to european standards I have to say that it wasn't small. Of course not as big as they are normally in Asia... Had dinner the first night in the roof restaurant, was a nice experience. Good communication by taxi or metro to anywhere in the city. If you are a party person, just in the road in the back there are lots of bars and some restaurants. So, I liked the Scarlett cause I liked staying in Chinatown instead in the new area of Singapore (which is similar to many other cities and doesn't have any character!). A room with a view would have given 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant place to stay and convinient to move around the city”
Reviews.Author: Hisham6828
Reviews.Content: Stayed there from 7th March 2012 to 9th March 2012. It was my first time staying there as I was looking for hotel with daily rate of not more than SGD250. Upon arrival at the hotel, I was greeted by the friendly staff. After finished with the registration, they showed my room. I found that there is food court about 2mins walk from the hotel (the Maxwell Road Food Court) they served various Chinese food and lucky for me there is a stall selling Muslim food. Would like to thank all the staff for their friendly approached and would sure recommending this hotel to anyone wish to stay right in the town centre.

Reviews.Title: “Classy And Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Jasonstevens
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love The Scarlet Hotel. The staff were nothing short of amazing. The hotel is convenient to transport, China town and the Maxwell hawker markets are just across the road for inexpensive dining. The room size is not huge but they're extremely well appointed and very clean. A huge recommendation from us if you are staying in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “All in all, a nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: NYC_UpperWestsiders
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Scarlet Hotel for 8 nights on business. The area, near Chinatown, Club St and the CBD was ideal and convenient for me. Hotel itself would be best described trendy and boutique like. Staff are very nice and polite in general. The ramp to the hotel entrance is a bit out of the way so getting a cab could take quite awhile. You’re better off walking down to the main roads to hail a cab. Here are some pros and cons based on my experience. Rooms: I had to switch the room during my stay as the original room 207 was extremely loud from the club next door and the hotel’s bar right downstairs. In addition, the jacuzzi is right outside the room so the noise level from guests using it can be heard very clearly. Room itself was also very small and the balcony looked over the parking garage so not very appealing. Staff at first agreed to move my room but wanted to charge me a higher rate for the ‘upgrade’. When I did not agree they offered to move me to a room that would be a ‘downgrade’ as that is all they had available. When asked if they would refund me the difference, the answer was a ‘no’. Ultimately, we settled on a room change to another room categorized lower but they threw in breakfast for free. The second room, 235 was much better. The room itself was bigger, better functional layout. It didn’t have a balcony but it actually had a door leading outside to a small roof top. The best thing… it was quiet. Room amenities: Well stocked with necessities – bath robe, slippers, shoe shining sponge, qtips, cotton balls, soap, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, lotion, tooth paste/brush, mouth wash, hair comb and even a nail file. On the down side, especially for women in my opinion, is the hair dryer. It’s one of those low air hotel dryers mounted to the bathroom sink and the worst is you had to press and hold the button the entire time you are using the hair dryer. Room comes with complimentary bottled waters and a welcome sparkling citrus drink. The in-room safe is easy to use and the mini bar is well stocked. Note, there is no alcohol in the mini bar, just sodas and snacks. Food: For the days I had free breakfast…..Breakfast bar had decent selection of fruit, yogurts, salmon and some Asian selections like dumplings. It wasn’t bad but nothing to rave about. You can also order one item from the menu which is quite nice. I tried the eggs benedict which was okay, seafood congee – delicious and the noodle soup. The wait staff was a mixed experience. They were pleasant one morning and then quite indifferent the next. Surrounding area: As many posts have indicated, the hotel is near Chinatown where you can do some shopping and have a fun cultural experience. If you long for western bars and pub scenery, go around the corner from the hotel to Club street where you will have no shortage of bars to patronize. The MRT stations are within walking distance but not few minute walk, you’ll need good 10 minutes walking time to get to nearest one. One of the best thing about staying here is the proximity to the Maxwell hawker/food center, literally a minute walk. Really good, cheap food with lots of options~ average $2-5 USD for a nice meal. All in all, it was a pleasant stay and well located for where I needed to be.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, unique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pyxxydust
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Singapore but my first staying in this hotel. It's not part of a chain, that I'm aware of, so it was just so beautiful and unique! The theme is black and scarlet red, and it's in everything, from the decor, the uniforms, even their computers are red! It's gorgeous! The service is unbelievable. Instead of just handing us a key and sending us to our room, the lady (her name is Yna, wonderful lady!), walked us all the way there, opened up the room, showed us everything in the room that we probably wouldn't have known about if she hadn't told us, and other services offered in the hotel. We had a Premium Room and the computer desk was actually a few steps up, which was cute, but helpful if someone is sleeping and you want to be on the computer, so you don't disturb them. The bathroom has a completely see through shower, which was interesting. Nice big flat screen TV, free bottles of juice, comfy bed. The room wasn't huge but we didn't really care. It was very nice and very clean. The lobby is decorated so beautifully, little alcoves with couches and things, all in the scarlet and black theme. My fave was this "poodle" statue thing with a lipstick leash and necklace and Chinese slippers. It was all beautifully decorated but with a sense of humor - just so unique. I loved it. And it's a block from Chinatown, so it was easy to get to all of that shopping. The closest MRT is about a 5 minute walk, not too bad, but I would suggest a taxi if you have luggage. Anyway, the prices are very reasonable - especially for Singapore which is notoriously expensive. So we were pleasantly suprised at how great the property and service was. Totally recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “make sure u r not in 106”
Reviews.Author: worktravellerglobal
Reviews.Content: so the start was not good. put in what can only be explained as a concrete bunker. no windows! we wr staying for 5 ngts!!! complained and the next day got quite a nice room...... with a window. [note: this may be because we booked through expedia, i am starting to find u r guaranteed the WORST room in the hose if you book with them]. The location is fantastic if u want to get a different feel for Singapore. opposite to marina sands! Don/\t bother with the bar or breakfast. especially breakfast - yuck. plenty of good bars close by. best place is the PS cafe - less than 1 minute walk. the spa is also very grotty.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, good location.”
Reviews.Author: xsimx
Reviews.Content: The staff we dealt with we are very courteous, and happy to help as much as they good. We were taken to our room upon check-in and given a free drink from the mini bar, and shown around the room by the receptionist. Our room was quite small, but we used it only for sleeping so this didn't really concern us. The room was clean and tidy, and had all the usual necessities. The hotel also has a rooftop bar where you can sit out and eat dinner, or just have a drink. Our package also included breakfast which was a good spread and included Asian and western food. The Scarlet is a little bit out of the main city, but is within walk of numerous train stops, and the harbourside. Overall we really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Dark, atmospheric and deep in the heart of Chinatown.”
Reviews.Author: jollyrobert
Reviews.Content: My wife loves this place, largely because of its location, hard by the wonders and smells of Chinatown. This was our second stay in 2 years and will be again as we transit Singapore onto Oz and NZ. Although there were some signs of tiredness with the decor, after we asked for a room change,(too small for what we paid-deluxe rate) the reception staff were very helpful, and moved us as soon as another became available. Avoid room 220 and ask for 227,............ quite a different experience. After booking out 3 days later, our flight was some 5 hours away back to the UK, but the staff gave us the use of a courtesy room on the 4th floor, and this is where all the best apartments are! Singapore is a revelation, and this is my 5th visit over 40 years. The people are very proud of their island state and English is widely and beautifully spoken. Little India, Harbourside, River Godowns, Orchid Road and Chinatown itself provide a feast for the eyes (and stomach). Try the delights of Lau Tau market, Suntech or Maxwell for culinary treats, but don't miss the chilli crab in Smith Street (also known as Cook Street) for a goumet experience! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Staycation successful”
Reviews.Author: DallasFlysolofemme
Reviews.Content: We were jonesing to get out of town, but had basically no time--so we did a Saturday night at the Scarlett. We got a great rate on Agoda--I think $157SGD/night, with breakfast included. We had a great dinner up at the alfresco restaurant, which is also where breakfast was served. Our room had a lot of personality, which is what we expected from this boutique hotel. Before they remodeled the downstairs, we were walking by and saw some very erotic paintings in the former restaurant...we were shocked they were hanging in public in Singapore! The bed was really comfortable, the toiletries were fashionable, and TV was good. There were some nifty unique touches in the room, such as books about the hotel, slippers, bathrobes, etc. The service was lacking--I thought the lady up front was rude when we checked in, and they didn't allow wiggle-room on late checkout at all, but whatever. The other downside is there's no pool--just a little dip pool, which was ok. But, you are right near Maxwell Food Center and Club Street--our intention was to go out on the town but we were so tired after dinner, we just retired to our comfortable room. This is definitely a couples hotel. I wouldn't really want to stay there if I were on business or single and not with family either. It just puts off a sexy vibe that isn't for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “A cozy luxury retreat from the bustle of Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: HollyB_oz
Reviews.Content: Whlle the rooms are small, they are well-equipped, and quiet sufficient. I like the decor and the 'luxury' elements. I have stayed here twice, and enjoy the retreat from the bustle of the city. The roof top restaurant offers a peaceful location for drinks or dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Twice not bitten therefore we're not shy!”
Reviews.Author: MarinaJohaness
Reviews.Content: It was our 2nd stay in Scarlet. On both occassions, it was to celebrate my husband's birthday. I guess this hotel is not for everyone. If you are very particular about room size, surroundings, nice view from the windows, convenient parking, pool and facilities then Scarlet is not for you. On both occassions, the front desk staff brought us up to the room and even carried our bags. After unlocking the door, they navigated us around the room. Being a boutique hotel, the hotel have compensated by providing a great service and a comfy room perfect for a romantic night stay. The beddings, the furnishings and the lightings definitely adds to the mood. On both stays, we received a personal-size complimentary birthday cake. We were definitely not twice bitten therefore not twice shy. Will look forward to staying there again for a romantic night's stay. Cheers, Marina + Johaness

Reviews.Title: “Good small hotel”
Reviews.Author: SunnyFukuoka
Reviews.Content: The hotel is so unique and could enjoy good stay with my wife. The food court is available from the hotel within 1 min, was so good for breakfast. the way to the nearest subway station is also highly recommended for shopping, you can feel real china town there.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky place to stay, just off the 'boring' orchid street”
Reviews.Author: gsbawa
Reviews.Content: We went there for the New Year's and booked this because I was looking for a "non-chain" hotel. Loved it. The staff is wonderful and the experience is personal. There suites are to die for but if they are not in your budget, try the rooms with balcony on 2nd and 3rd floor. They also have an open air Jacuzzi next to the "Soda". The restaurant serves very tasty food and the breakfast is great too with all the choices of cheeses. Basically it's a buffet + 1 dish from the a la carte. The bar is chic. The neighbourhood is really cool. It's where the hip locals hangout. Reminds me of the uptown Notthing hill.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique and different”
Reviews.Author: Dcmc1234
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel many times and I agree with all the reviews. The rooms are small and many have no windows and the hotel could do with a facelift. All that said I continue to come back time and time again. It's a quirky hotel with a lot of character. All the rooms are different (some much better than others) the food from both restaurants is very nice and the location is close to the CBD and trendy club street. The gym s small and limited but it does exist and the pool is kind of a small spa which should be located in the roof whre it would get more sun but instead it's down in a shady part of the hotel so not really very inviting. The rooftop restaurant is very pleasant, DVD player in room and lots of tv channels. All in all it's not a bad hotel, it's got a bit of character so much nicer than staying in a big sterile hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dissatisfied”
Reviews.Author: Happyholidaytime01
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for 4/5 star avoid this hotel, first room so called delux was what can only be described as dingy/dirty shoebox. Refused room and was allocated another albeit larger but still not good. The hotel is in need of refurbishment in the rooms we had, the public area is by far of a better standard. The staff were always polite and obliging and breakfast was good although on second morning was not offered menu only buffet, had to ask if menu available. The area in which the hotel is located is near china town but roads to and leading from we're very dirty and not what I had expected from Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good - but not that good!”
Reviews.Author: MeltonJerry
Reviews.Content: The public spaces in this hotel are really good fun and exciting. However the bedrooms an be a bit of a let down. Ours was one of the many without a window. That wasn't so bad, however it was still quite small. Breakfast was less than great and the breakfast staff seemed uninterested. We enjoyed our dinner in the rooftop Breeze Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Princessipia
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night, and had no complaints. The room was small but clean. The location was good. The staff were friendly and helpful. Overall it was average, probably let down by the big price for the small room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: SiuLoong
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights as a stopover between Australia and UK. Booked through SLH, and chose the largest numbered room (the suites are named), which was the right decision as we saw into some of the other rooms as they were being serviced and they were very compact! Our room was perfect, spacious with lovely bathroom, large tv, desk etc.. and the bed was super comfortable, the pillows amazing. No problems at all sleeping, we had windows onto the street but heard no noise and the air con kept the room very comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful, booking transfers to the airport and arranging complimentary late checkout as part of our SLH club membership. Our flight was delayed, so it was after midnight when we arrived, but we were still greeted with a smile. The location is great, we'd recommend the airport shuttle bus service at $9 per person to get you dropped off at the door (for a larger group a private hire may work out better), as although there are MRT stations close by they would still be a bit of a walk with bags in tow. For exploring the city however, they are ideal. We loved Chinatown, the food was delicious and we bought loads of souvenirs and gifts. It was also walking distance to the other attractions of Raffles Hotel/City, Merlion, Fullerton Hotel etc... although its less effort to use the very efficient public transport system. We loved our two days in Singapore, we highly recommend a visit (and if you have an awkwardly timed flight out don't worry about getting to the airport early there is a huge amount to do!), and we also loved The Scarlet!

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel near CBD with great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: mjj11
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in Singapore - beautiful interior design with choice of bars and restaurants. Would recommend room with balcony as these are slightly larger than standard rooms. Has small but functional gym and free wifi in the rooms

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel - Shabby room”
Reviews.Author: Park-n-Rove
Reviews.Content: Scarlet itself is a charming hotel in a great location in Chinatown with easy access to downtown. Our room in particular was a little worse for ware in need of a paint job and a shower refurbishment. We paid for the smallest room available so while the room was teeny- they really made efficient use of the space. I was impressed! We had a cute balcony that opened up the room a bit so it didn't feel as enclosed. The bedding is wonderful and you will get a deep and restful sleep - guaranteed. The bar/restaurant are very hip and happening as is Club street nearby. We spent 2 nights in Singapore and 2 nights on Sentosa and paid the same price for both hotels. The Scarlet was definitely the loser in the value for the price. That being said, I did poke my head into other rooms as they were being cleaned and they looked NOTHING like ours. They were spacious and beautifully appointed. So when staying here, make sure you know what room you are selecting:)

Reviews.Title: “Beware of possible fraud”
Reviews.Author: sandro c
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a number of rooms without windows. They sell it at the same price of the rooms with windows, which is a very bad behaviour, and they do not let you know, until you enter your room and find it out yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Worrybee
Reviews.Content: I visited in August, they come across as a boutique hotel. However, the rooms are really tiny. We had a room with no windows. What a dingy room! The staff are really helpful though. The station is a good 10 minutes walk. The food hall opposite serves some smelly food. A bit overwhelming for a vegetarian like me. This hotel is pricey and best avoided. Choose another hotel for the same price any day!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place for vacation”
Reviews.Author: Max_hkxx2001
Reviews.Content: We know this hotel from traveling books so we decided to try it. It is indeed a special boutique hotel like the SAFF but even better! When we get in, we feel so relaxing. The lobby is like a night club where you think you will have a great time. The club street is just behind the hotel so we feel the vibration of the music and kind of worried about our sleep quality. Luckily our room is very far away from the front desk so we didn't feel anything at all. The soundproof is really good. Our room is facing the elevator but I can't hear any noise at all. The room is small but we spent whole day outside and get good sleep at night. The location is perfect. The famous Maxwell Food Center is just less than 5 minutes walk. There are plenty of Asian food for us to try and the price is surprisingly low! We will come back to this hotel next time if we have chance.

Reviews.Title: “A stylish city break”
Reviews.Author: suziwong02
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an 8 night break in Singapore. My husband had stayed a few times at the Scarlet on business from 2009,and always said it was a hotel i would enjoy to stay in. We booked it for Oct 2011 as part of my birthday treat. The hotel is situated in chinatown and 5mins walk to MRT so getting around the city was really easy, even getting to the zoo using MRT and public transport buses was stress free. The hotel has a lovely relaxed air about it the staff were polite and made us feel welcome from the moment we arrived ( we looked anxious i am sure as our luggage had not arrived on the same flight as us ) they had our room ready for us at 9.30 am and not 2pm as quoted in the tarriff. We had opted for a premium room and we were not disappointed , it was spacious and light and decorated to a high standard. The bed was very comfortable . Hope we get the chance to travel to Singapore again and stay in the beautiful Scarlet

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Stay in heart of Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: monstu
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in October and thoroughly emjoyed our stay. The hotel is very stylish with great interiors. Located close to excellent food, we had a very pleasurable stay. We would stay there are when next visiting Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, boutique hotel, amazing location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravellingLady01
Reviews.Content: This place was really lovely! My boyfriend and I booked a room at The Scarlet for two nights before going on to Bali and I was so glad we did. The hotel is small, but the staff are really competent and the attention to detail excellent. The plus points: breakfast is great! The location is excellent; right in a really pretty area of Chinatown with lots of interesting places to eat and shop within walking distance. The rooms were very clean and furnished beautifully, and the staff were attentive and nothing was too much truble. The prices were reasonable and the free internet in the room was a big plus. The bad points: The only bad point really was that the room was very small, and after reading other reviews I think this is the case throughout the hotel. However, the space was really well designed, our room had a lovely balcony and it didn't feel cramped; just compact. However, it was not really any smaller than the average hotel room in London. My advice is to give The Scarlet a go!

Reviews.Title: “A decent low cost alternative”
Reviews.Author: Scott1734
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a low cost alternative to the nice hotels in Singapore and don't mind a small room, this is it. It is a good place to sleep but that is about all. The rooms are so small that you don't want to spend any time in them. PROs: * Fast internet * Clean room * Nice Shower Cons: * Very Very Small Room (12 sqm) * Not the greatest location for activities in Marina Bay * Dreary Lobby

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Shaun D
Reviews.Content: When I first arrived, the room wasn't ready but would be in 15 minutes. It turned out it took 50 minutes which I wasn't impressed by. However, despite that, I had an excellent stay during the course of my holiday. The rooms are a little small but that's fine for me. The amenities are more than suitable. Would have been nice if there were computers with internet access available for guests to use. They do provide free WiFi and there is a broadband connection available in each room. The location is excellent with Maxwell Food Centre just a minute away and Chinatown on your doorstep. Other restaurants behind the hotel are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Distinctive, and Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: WilliamGodley
Reviews.Content: This is a distinctive hotel, and not at all bad, but I think many travelers will not be entirely satisfied with its offerings. The rooms are comfortable, but small; the location is near Chinatown, but not all that exclusive; the lobby is dreary, and not welcoming; etc. The staff does appear professional and the restaurant is excellent. There are several other good restaurants within walking distance. I don't plan to return and I certainly don't agree with another reviewer that the hotel is "one of the best in this city."

Reviews.Title: “A unique experience in the heart of Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: Gilles88
Reviews.Content: I spend 3 days/nights in the Scarlet hotel during the F1 GP and I must say that I only felt pleasure. From the beginning to the end I have been taken in charge by the very friendly and professional staff with a high class standard. The rooms have a lot of character and are amazing.Top class bedding, TV and internet. The location of the Scarlet is really nice in the heart of the very pretty Chinatown. We have tried the top roof bar and the restaurant which are of very high quality. Really a great and unique hotel with a high standard which should absolutely be recommended to anybody who goes to Singapore. Not easy to find a hotel like the Scarlet.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and a very good location”
Reviews.Author: Nicolas B
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Scarlet boutique hotel couple times as I pass through in Singapore... For me this hotel is one of the best in this city, nice restaurant with very tasty food, staff and services are excellent, beautiful view and cocktails on the roof top... I recommend this hotel to everyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, pretty little hotel. Tiny rooms.”
Reviews.Author: krisc2000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business with my other half for a week in August. Was not greeted on arrival and concierge staff were not at door so poor receptionist dragged my bags from the door. I'd have carried them myself but she was insistent bless her, very kind. No record of our booking on arrival despite earlier emails. Took some time to get this sorted and also get the rate agreed previously. This was disappointing. Rejected the first room as there was no room to fit all of our luggage in nevermind us for one week! I am not exhaggerating. The concierge delivered the luggage to our room, wheeled our bags in and we had to sit on the bed to make room. He closed the door and we had to move the bags up against the door to stand up! The second room we upgraded though this was still relatively small. The message loud and clear in these reviews obviously is, if you don't like a small room, don't stay here, you won't like it! The second room was noisier (road side) and did wake us up, due to people walking by and chatting outside, and the rubbish truck emptying the bins at Maxwell Food Centre every morning about 4:30am. Aside from that, our stay was generally OK, the food and drinks on the roof bar were good and the location is good, right near China Town and the nice little Duxton Hill/Ann Siang Hill area.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Lou B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Scarlet for 3 nights at the start of our honeymoon and we were immediately impressed by the gorgeous lobby. Check-in was a little shaky, but we were taken to our room and shown around by a really great member of staff whose name we unfortunately didn't get. We stayed in a premium room which was a good size, clean and good-looking with a good sized bathroom. The bed deserves a mention, it was extremely comfortable and wasn't bettered through our entire honeymoon! The bar and restaurant on the top floor (where breakfast is served) was lovely, we dinner there on the first night and the food was very good (if a little steep, but Singapore is a very expensive city). the cocktails were lovely. Breakfast too was very good, with a good selection of continental and imaginatively cooked breakfasts. The location is pretty good, China Town is lovely but the hotel isn't particularly close to any underground stops so we ended up getting a lot of taxis. All in all we enjoyed our stay, I think the service could be brought up a notch so you feel more like you're in a boutique hotel rather than a stylish business hotel. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: udaya H
Reviews.Content: Travel to this hotel on my travels on business having been recommended by friends found it to be a very good.

Reviews.Title: “The Scarlet Hotel --- flirtatious and teasing”
Reviews.Author: tambalyn
Reviews.Content: I have always been intrigued by the Scarlet Hotel from its flirtatious website design, so I finally decided to try it. We booked directly with the hotel and got a better deal than other internet sites. Location wise, it is very good, just a few minutes to Chinatown station. Nearby are also good restaurants including the popular Maxwell Hawker Centre or the other several eateries near the station. There are also souvenir shops for those last-minute shopping, you just need to bargain. In general, Chinatown is a good base in Singapore for its unique feel and accessibility. The hotel is a converted shophouse, so its layout is not the usual hotel’s. It’s a bit of a maze going to the rooms, but I think it adds to its charm. The rooms are very good, in fact, we had a fairly-sized bedroom and it didn’t feel cramped. Rooms are well-appointed and I particularly liked the bathrooms with its Victorian-era fixtures. Some rooms don’t have windows so make sure you specify this when booking. On our arrival, I was particularly amused with the hotel’s flirtatious furniture pieces, dark reds, velvet and black --- exactly the “ambience” its website suggests. Check-in was fast and front desk staff was courteous. Somebody guided us through the narrow hallways to our rooms, which is good coz otherwise we won’t find our rooms!  Our package didn’t include breakfast but this is not an issue coz we can easily find restaurants around the hotel. The hotel also has a rooftop restaurant which is good for a night cap, prices are a bit on the high side though. I highly recommend the Scarlet hotel for the different experience and for its reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Nice traditional hotel in the China Town district”
Reviews.Author: lee_bear
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Scarlet for nine nights on a business trip recently in an Executive Room, the room was fine, not huge but very clean and it had a couple of small windows with a view of the rooftops from the second floor. The air conditioning was reasonably noisy so I tended to get the room cool and then turn it off over night so the noise didn’t disturb me. The bed was very comfortable and there were some English language channels available on the TV. The main restaurant on the ground floor was closed for refurbishment so I didn’t bother paying 26 Sing Dollars for breakfast offered in the outside roof restaurant in that heat. The bars were very expensive, 13 sing dollars for a small bottle of beer so no wonder there seemed to be few takers. The hotel is right in china town so great for wandering round to find food and drink. I did have three days off whilst there to explore the city, taxi’s were very cheap compared to European standards, only 20 dollars for the 20 mile trip to the zoo each way for example. The hotel is in a very good location to wander round the city centre, 10 minutes to the harbour past temples and interesting sights..

Reviews.Title: “Unique and lovely”
Reviews.Author: JennyTravel33
Reviews.Content: Very nice small boutique hotel. Stayed in room with balcony, not very spacious but comfortable and quiet. Great location. Friendly service. Like the decoration and atmosphere. Really appreciate the free unlimited Wifi access in the room. The only negative points were the small and dirty outdoor jaccuzzi, and the breakfast not included is quite expensive. But overall was a good experience

Reviews.Title: “small room”
Reviews.Author: swelgus
Reviews.Content: We were in one of their windowless basement rooms. The room and bath were very small, but it had what we wanted in our price range. The bed was comfortabe and the room clean and modern. Good AC Flat screen TV with english channels The internet was hard wired, worked well and was free. Wifi in the lobby Good location. Windowless sounds bad, but it makes the room very quiet and you don't have to worry about the sun waking you up in the morning. We did not buy the expensive breakfast, but there were not any good options close by the hotel for breakfast which was inconvenient. Friendly, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “A Second Visit”
Reviews.Author: countryretreat
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Scarlet and it still as unique as ever, rooms small but we had learned from the visit last year and put one suitcase in storage at the hotel, building works going on at the hotel on our visit and the only in conveinence we had throughout the 6 night stay was the air conditioning went down two days on run but staff did everything to try and right this, exellent positioning of hotel to see the sights of chinatown and mrt station close by, breakfast excellent i recommend the eggs benedict and excellent array of food on self service. We enjoy at the Scarlet as it is a good base to get out and see singapore and will be returning there next year

Reviews.Title: “Unique boutique hotel. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: RonaldInBangkok
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this a few times now and never did I regret it. The hotel offers a unique experience and ambiance. The hotel occupies a number of older houses that now are internally connected. Don't think of old being bad. Here it means stylish. The decoration of the hotel, the room interior give you a feeling you won't find easily in any other hotel in Singapore. Staff is very helpful and always was friendly. From the hotel it is easy to walk to China town were great food can be enjoyed. But the hotel also has a hood restaurant on the roof top of the hotel itself. The restaurant is called Breeze. I can also recommend to try this.

Reviews.Title: “Noise, noise, noise”
Reviews.Author: Smile92
Reviews.Content: We spent our 5 last nights in Singapore at this hotel, as we wanted to treat ourselves in an exclusive place. Being part of the SLH group, we could only have expected luxury and sensual delight.... Well, despite the fact that this is a beautiful boutique hotel and that it has a great central location in Chinatown (right across from the Buddha tooth relic temple), we left disappointed. Nothing to say about the staff, absolutely charming and attentive as one would expect in a 4-5 stars. Sadly, the hotel was undergoing some major renovation at the time (their main dining room on the street was closed for redo, and the main lobby entrance too), so we had to use the "Bold" bar's entrance lower along Erskine rd and could hear noise all day in the lobby. Quiet unpleasant. As for the room, we were made a nice offer for an executive that we had the opportunity to visit a few days before. Upon booking, we had requested a quiet room. When we checked-in, we were given room 229, which looked really fine besides the fact we expected not to be on the street. Of course the first night was horrible as we could barely sleep: - no double-glazed window reducing the noise from Erskine rd and the parking area on its side - no dark shades in the bathroom so the daylight would enter the bedroom though its glassdoor - no possibility to open/close the windows (no handles) to renew the air - no possibility to open/close the outdoor wooden shutters (one cannot open the windows) - terrible noise from the AC, even when we turned it off Next morning, we reported our discomfort to a staff member, but no special effort was offered, as we were told all the executive rooms were on the street. Too sad for us. We spent the 4 other nights with earplugs & eye night-shades. The room itself was small by very well decored and equipped (nice king size bed, a desk, a closet with plenty of gadgets umbrella, bathrobes, sleepers etc., a safe). We lacked of space for our 2 large suitcases. The bathroom was cute & with a large italian shower and plenty of toiletries. The service & turn down was nicely made every day. As for the facilities, it took us a while to find the jacuzzi and the fitness room, simply because we could not figure out what "Soda" and "Flaunt" meant. The "Flaunt" room was OK with a few machines, a stereo, good AC, a toilet, fresh towels. The "Soda" did not appeal us at all. The "Breeze" bar & restaurant on the top floor looked really cool for an al-fresco meal and it was packed every evening of our stay... but there was too many other tempting restaurants in the city. Another disappointment was the laundry service. We gave out a bag of clothes to be washed & pressed. It all returned nice and fresh the next day. We were just surprised upon reading the laundry bill that we were charged several extras for... stains! It looked weird and inappropriate for a yet costly service. Overall, we were glad we were offered promotional rates as we were not impressed. We would not return, and would not recommend this place to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Unique boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ok_xin
Reviews.Content: Been staying in Scarlet for 2 times. It is a very unique designed hotel with good service from portal to manager. stayed in lavish and splendid suite and these suites are gorgeous! If you want, you can request the hotel restaurant to set up a private dinner in your suite with extra charge. The location is near China town and within walking distance. Easy to get local food. There is a food court opposite the hotel. At the back of the hotel, Ann Siang Road, there are boutiques and shops selling some very special designer items, pastries shop, bars and lounges. Short distance by taxi to Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie T
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights during our honeymoon and were slightly dissapointed with the size of the rooms. The room we had was beautifully decorated, but had very large furniture and the room felt very dark as everything was black, gold and red. The location was great and it was only a short walk to Chinatown, where there was lots to do and see.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room and very overpriced”
Reviews.Author: HowardToh
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here for our anniversary in March. It was very expensive as I paid over $300 including taxes for just a night's stay there. The room was so small that the bed had taken up at least 85% of the floor space available. There was a window that had no view (opens to the roof of the next building and all we can see are the ventilation exhausts, boilers and antennas. There was no bathtub - only a standing shower. We borrowed some DVDs and spent the whole afternoon watching them after getting food from the nearby Maxwell Food Centre. Staff were polite but that's it. I'm not sure if that's because we are locals. Breakfast was included but the spread was rather disappointing. Sort of regretted spending this amount of money as we could have stayed in a much better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure about this place...”
Reviews.Author: tedtheredUk
Reviews.Content: The big advantage of Scarlet is its location close to China Town for the restaurants and other entertainment. Its quite trendy being built into what looks like a row of traditional houses. But there's a 'but'. We had a so called premium room. Quite nicely appointed but with no windows. Like being in a cell. This cost around $230 per night. Far too expensive. No wifi as well. This did not include breakfast which I tried one day and for $35 you get a rather poor buffet. I think Scarlet is well over-priced. There are much better options close by

Reviews.Title: “Good (but not amazing) quirky boutique hotel in colonial part of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: girlfromipanema13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Scarlet Hotel twice in December as we went through Singapore to go the Koh Samui for a change (rather than Bangkok). First time we stayed in a suite for a couple of nights which was lovely - decent sized room with separate lounge and long balcony with outdoor fans - boutique style decor (our room was slightly over the top) with veiws over the hawkers market opposite and terracotta roofs which is very different from staying down on Orchard Rd and for this reason we would stay here again. On the fringe of China Town and not far from Orchard Rd if thats where your heading. The hotel is lovely and kind of quirky with a lovely roof top bar. Breakfast is good - nothing amazing but nothing to complain about. The gym is tiny (think home gym) and the staff are friendly (although I must say they messed up our booking). Second time we stayed for only 8 hours and took their most basic rooml which I feel I should warn you about. This room was under ground and didn't have any windows . The door only just opened to clear the bed. The room was very small and just functional but difficult if there are two of you with a suit case each (forget it if you are a heavy packer!) - the most space was in the shower! I really wouldn't choose one of these basic rooms if you like space and fresh air - I am not claustrophobic at all but I kept wanting to open the door to the hallway (where there are also no windows on the basement floor). I would recommend this hotel if you are staying for a couple of nights only in a room with a balcony and if you like boutique hotels only - lots of cute little one of local designer shops around and cute little bars - very nice area but not in the modern part of Singapore. Good if you are a young couple or a bit of a fashionista, but not if you like space and service and if you want to be in the heart of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Beauty in China Town. Pluses and Minuses”
Reviews.Author: ringinthenewyear
Reviews.Content: Came to Sing on business for a few days and read about this place in Trip Advisor. Would stay here again for the following reasons: 1. China town location - you can walk to a lot of great places. There's the food court right across the parking lot called MAXWELL. Of all the independent food vendors I recommend getting the famous chicken rice and the porridge. You will know they are popular based on the number of people waiting to get served. Super cheap, no need to eat hotel food. 2. Decor, Service and level of comfort was all top notch. 3. Happy Hour - 2 for 1 Before you book, if you plan to book a standard room, know the rooms are tiny and could be claustrophobic for some. And yes, if you get a window it will be super tiny. But the rooms are comfortable, designed, and well layed out. No worse than some New York hotels I have stayed in. I had room # 120, tight quarters and it was on the side of the street, I could here people talking in the mornings and the evenings. I would recommend a different room if you need quiet. Thankfully I had ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TiggyLancashire
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on the way to Australia and had a wonderful executive room with balcony. The hotel was very clean and with the lovely jacuzzi proved a welcome break from all the travel. This hotel is close to Chinatown which is really interesting and close to underground rail links. Enjoyed my stay here very much.

Reviews.Title: “something different”
Reviews.Author: explorer1234_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautifully decorated and had an expensive feel to it. The location was nice, right in the heart of china town. Staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were big but the best part was the big comfortable king size bed. There was free internet which worked well, the only downside to the hotel was there are no windows (apart from a small one in the roof). Would recommend if you are willing to spend a little more money for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel with a difference”
Reviews.Author: GeoffBShepparton
Reviews.Content: This hotel stay was the result of a search for a hotel in Singapore that was not a concrete tower but also was reasonably priced. The search resulted in a booking that was well priced and at an establishment that was a little out of the way, in a quiet area and had very good facilities. We arrived after a long flight from Barcelona early morning (0700hrs) and our room was not available. After a few hours wait during which we had breakfast and a walk around the area we returned dead tired and were offered a superior room to that booked. This room was very well appointed and very quiet. We found the staff most attentive, the hotel facilities excellent and the location very good being near to Chinatown and other attractions on that side of the city. It is close to some boutique restuarants in nearby streets that are quite expensive and a fair walk to Clarke Quay where the resturants are also very pricey and charge for the most trivial items that are gratus at most others eg. serviettes etc. I would stay there again and enjoy the surrounding shopping and local street resuarants where great food and beer is available at low prices.

Reviews.Title: “The Scarlet - Great business stop over in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: nrmoz
Reviews.Content: This great little boutiquer hotel has had a slight makeover since I last visited a couple of years ago... but has lost none of it's unique flavour or colours... I originally used the Scarlet as a business base in Singapore but drifted away as pricing became too high. Times have changed and so has the Scarlet with affordable room pricing now a standard. (But check the bar pricing as $16SGD is a bit much for a small beer and reduced the value for me...) Rooms have a variety of colours and fitouts so it's possible to try many over a few stays. The current room for me was well lit, spotless, had a great bed, mattress and a choice of pillows and had free internet in the room through a Cat 5 connection and free WiFi in the foyer. Bathrooms and showers (and supplies) were a good size. There's an attached gym (not used on this visit) and a roof top bar and spa are good value. F&B pricing is on the pricey side given this property is a short walk to 'food' street in Chinatown, Singapore Its Erskine Road address is close to the eateries in Chinatown, Club Street etc and indeed there's a wealth of unique Singapore experiences within half a km of the front door as well as some great smaller shops! The Scarlet has always had great staff and the tradition continues with excellent service in all areas! Summation: Great place to stay in Singapore for a business or pleasure stay!

Reviews.Title: “Valentines Day very special”
Reviews.Author: Nsingapore
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this amazing boutique hotel Valentines Day. It was a surprise planned by my husband. The hotel is situated in an amazing part of Singapore on the outskirts of Chinatown. It has interesting decor and furniture in its reception. The rooms are dotted along long corridors which is maze like. Room is small with not a great view but the decor and the amenities are excellent. Everything you would need is in the room, you just have to look hard. Dinner was awesome at their rooftop restaurant with an amazing view over the Singapore Skyline, Breakfast the following morning in the downstairs restaurant again did not disappoint. Service here was a little stand off ish I thought but the food was excellent with Fresh Juice also on offer. I would stay at this hotel again, its not cheap but worth a visit

Reviews.Title: “great location but mega overpriced”
Reviews.Author: satori99
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night. I think the location is amazing. The hotel room is so small you almost cannot open your bag. It's clearly not a hotel you'd like to spend more than one night. Staff was very professional and courteous. rooms cleaned. But not sure I'd stay there again, it's quite expensive for what you get. I am not in favour of big chains, but in Singapore you can certainly find better. I repeat, the location, near Chinatown, Ann Siang Hill and the markets is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, really welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: LondonDonald
Reviews.Content: Another great stay at this hotel created from a Chinese heritage building right in the heart of Chinatown and close to countless fantastic restaurants and bars galore. I'm a regular here and the reason I keep coming back is the warm welcome you always receive at this hotel, the great service and the wonderful location. Now, some of the rooms are pretty small (this is a heritage building) but you trade this for the location and an affordable price for this standard of hotel. Free broadband in rooms and wifi in reception. I was feeling very unwell during this trip following a visit to India, and the staff could not have been kinder. And I damaged a shoe on the pavement and the hotel engineer fixed it! How's that for service? The hotel has recently redesigned its breakfast offering. All the continental buffet is still there, although better range but the hot buffet is replaced by an upscale breakfast menu- I had poached eggs on onion brioche, bacon strips, poached spinach with hollandaise drizzle. There was also poached fish, etc. They're really making the effort to make it a special experience. Of course, you can still have straight bacon eggs etc if you want! Do not hesitate to book this lovely hotel either for business, leisure or a layover between flights. You will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with this botique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andy H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week based on a recommendation from a friend; and I have to honestly say I was quite disappointed. For the price of the room I possibly expected too much. I arrived while it was raining, and had to remove, then carry my bags from the taxi to the front desk; and then if that wasn’t enough had to twice ask the reception if someone could bring them to the room. I suspect they want you to bring them up yourself. The room was exceptionally small, so small that the desk chair could not be pulled from the desk; not good, since I had to work two of the four mornings I was registered. So small, that when I was packing to leave, I continually hit my legs on the bed and the desk. No wireless for this hotel, so had to use the internet wall jack which was too far from the desk causing the room supplied cable about 40 cm short of the desk. I had to sit on the bed and hold my PC on my lap. I brought this to the attention of the front desk, and was told all PC cables are the same size! The room air conditioning did not work, and Singapore is not exactly the best city to be in under those circumstances. Unique Quality: On the plus side is location is convenient for those wanting to stay in or near city centre.

Reviews.Title: “My girlfriend loved it and so did I.”
Reviews.Author: limmatthew
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an exquisite posh touch to its furnish and I was really looking forward to staying at scarlet.... The room that we had was on the second floor and the bellman was the first person who warmly greeted us.. checking in was hassle free and the front desk staff brought us to our room, she asked us if it is our first time at the scarlet and introduced us to some of the nightlife places around their hotel. The room was not extremely big but it was spacious and with window as requested, clean room with comfortable bed. Our room was very clean and neat, really liked the interior of our room as it was very quaint & stylish. The hotel had complimentary wired internet in the room which my girlfriend used her laptop.. We asked for some cutlery as we brought some supper back and the staff delivered to our doorstep within a short time. We went up to the roof top bar for a drink after our supper before midnight. It was a lovely view and not too crowded on a weekday. The waiters were responsive and friendly. My girlfriend told me that she felt home at scarlet. It was a very enjoyable stay and I would definitely recommend my friends to stay here.. just because the location is fantastic, service is commendable and my requests for my room was met... Can't wait to come back to the scarlet again.

Reviews.Title: “A chic boutique hotel in the heart of Chinatown - we loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Xen_Paul
Reviews.Content: The Scarlet Hotel has a lot gong for it - the location is fabulous, the staff are friendly and the design is nothing if not oddly compelling. True, the rooms are perhaps a little small - and yes some are internal so do not have windows (skylights and loft ceilings make up for this) but frankly, we were in Singapore to get out and about - so the Scarlet offered us a great base from which to do just that. With so much of the old Singapore gone, The Scarlet is one of the last bastions of history and charm. A short stroll from the door and you are in the middle of the wonderful Chinatown markets or the very trendy Ann Siang Hill and all its bars and eateries. We loved The Scarlet - for all it was not and everything is was. Would highly recommend it and can't wait to get back again.

Reviews.Title: “never come back again”
Reviews.Author: eatloveparty
Reviews.Content: We were really disappointed with the hotel stay. It is our 6th yr anniversary and my hubby decided to check in the premium room as a surprise for me. He even brought his camera hoping to take some photos for us. In the end, we did not even bother to take any pic. 1) The toliet door was damaged. 2) there was a dead crockache in the toilet. In the morning, I spoke to the housekeeper. She came in, saw the crockache and went on saying like hey there is a crockache. Then she left the room and went ahead with other room service without doing anything. I was so disappointed. And my hubby commented that the crockache is still alive. There were ants all ard it. I wanted to take a photo and post it online but i realise that there is seriously no need to do that. Because who will wanna take such photo !!! 3) we also order room service. Seriously, it is overpriced and the food is only so-so. Overall, the celebration was spoilt by the bad stay in scarlet

Reviews.Title: “Quirky hotel great location spoilt by noisy neighbors.”
Reviews.Author: Lyn086
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on way through to Bangkok. Nicely themed old world charm hotel. Well decorated rooms. However my stay was spoilt by the very noisy restaurant behind the hotel. Noise did not stop until early in the morning. Also in terms of value I did not see it in the small poorly mixed gin and tonic in the front bar at $17 SGD!

Reviews.Title: “Why $240??? It is so overrated.”
Reviews.Author: lagrita
Reviews.Content: In my opinion this boutique hotel is too expensive for what it really delivers. Beware the rooms are very small (at least ours for $240!), between the tiny desk, the closet, the full size bed and the mini bar there is hardly space to walk. Clean small bathroom with a tiny shower, old style tv no flat screen, NO wi-fi but cable plugged internet, walls with drywall repairs and paint poorly finished. No windows, it is a small bunker.

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious, swanky, ostentatious - I LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeRedDot
Reviews.Content: This is one of those hotels that you are either going to love - because it looks so stylish and chic or hate because it's overpriced and pretentious. If you are honest, when you look at the website and other reviews of this hotel you probably know which camp you are going to fall into before you even get there. I love this kind of boutique hotel and would much prefer to stay in something like this with a bit of character and style than a big name chain hotel or a small bland hotel just because it represents better 'value'. You've probably read most of the reviews about the small rooms and the lack of windows so if this bothers you then don't stay here. There is no denying that the rooms are very small and the lack of natural light is a bit off-putting but, let's face it, you really shouldn't be sitting around in your room in the day whilst you are visiting Singapore. If this is something you are planning on doing though, then dig deeper in your pockets and pay for a bigger room or look elsewhere. Whilst the rooms may be small they are very pretty with chic fixtures and fittings. The bathroom is a decent size though. Also don't moan about the lack of pool or outside space - again, the website makes this clear as do the other reviews on TA. This isn't a huge sprawling resort hotel. We used the hot tub practically everyday after our days out and it made for a very relaxing way to start our evening. There was never anyone else using it either which was a bonus. There are also chairs/loungers around the hot tub area if you want to sit outside during the day. It's very secluded and peaceful. The 'gym' is a bit rubbish though - it's really just a room with some floor to ceiling mirrors in it and the odd hand weight lying around. There a couple of exercise machines but neither worked whilst I was there. There are fridges in there with bottles of water you can steal though should you have drank the ones provided in your room. The roof terrace is brilliant and be warned - expensive - but what do you expect? This is Singapore where drinks are never cheap. Great way to spend a chilled out evening though overlooking the city with cocktail in hand. Ann Siang Hill (where the hotel is located) is a very cool area. You are literally round the corner from some lovely bars and restaurants. And across the road from the hotel is the Maxwell Food Centre, where you can balance out all those SGD$16 bottles of Tiger Beer with a tasty authentic meal for SGD$5. Chinatown is a 5 minute walk too so you are close to street markets for more bargain hunting and cheap tasty food. The MRT station is around there too. I might like super stylish design hotels (which generally I'm sure I over pay for) but I still expect good service and good manners. The staff were pretty faultless in this respect. Friendly and helpful so have no complaints here. The Scarlet has obviously seen better days and could do with a lick of paint here and there but it's still pretty impressive if that's your thing. Of course, there will be better value and more centrally located hotels but for me and my husband (early 30s) who want decent nightlife and access to MRT station then this was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Average, aging design hotel, and quite overpriced. Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: reviewer-intl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night and were not very impressed. The hotel is a design, boutique hotel, but it is dark, seems already a bit worn and does not feel very welcoming. We stayed in one of their window-less rooms, which felt a bit like being in someone's basement and was quite overpriced for a small room that felt very tight and did not offer much comfort. Besides the fact that Singapore is quite humid, the lack of windows in the room and the bathroom might explain the smell of humidity in the room. The hotel was recommended to us by friends who stayed there some years ago, but I have the impression it might have been hip at the time and now it just looks worn. The 7-Eleven and the food court that are right next door turned out to be quite convenient, but for a short stay in Singapore, I would choose a more central location closer to Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive looks, good location”
Reviews.Author: scancat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Scarlet in March 2011 for two nights. The location is quite good, little walk (5-10 minutes) to the train stations and on the edge of the Ann Siang Hill which is a home to great little wine bars and trendy restaurants. There is also Maxwell Rd Hawker Centre just on the next block which had great, cheap eats. The room was average size with tastefully decorated, impressive furniture. During the day there was barely any natural light as the massive, beautiful curtains only had two small square windows behind them. Bed was firm but fine. Bathroom ok in size and amenities but light fixtures etc were very dusty and just didnt give a crips clean feeling off. The hallways had ambience music which was a nice touch and rooms were quite quiet. The staff was very friendly at times (especially at the front door) and other times seemed to do its best to ignore you. The lobby had free wifi that wasnt terrible fast and I think it would have been nice to be able to access this from rooms as well. We had breakfast here the first morning as we were starving and exhausted. service was upmarket, but food seletion was odd and in my opinion no valued for money. All in all it was a ok stay, but I did not think it was great value for money. on our way back we stayed at The Saff which I found to be a lot more of a 'find' and better value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Option”
Reviews.Author: eustajoh
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable rooms and friendly helpful staff. Free Internet and good breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: sgee21
Reviews.Content: Very quaint hotel, close to Chinatown...lovely, ornate rooms...large and done up in an elaborate fashion.Clean and crisp linen. Great location, easy to hail cabs from here with help from the Concierge. If you want to avoid the big % star hotels in Orchard Road, Scarlet is a good option.Nice bar with exotic cocktails!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay !”
Reviews.Author: SunilKishanchand
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our stay in Singapore mainly based on feedback we received from our friends. We have stayed at many hotels over the years and we felt that the location of this hotel is very good . Price-wise this is reasonable and it has Charming interiors and the staff is caring and they go to great length to make you feel at home. This hotel although does not have a swimming pool it scores on many other points. . The room we had was spacious and pretty, the breakfast is good and the distance to the MRT is a few minutes away. The bathroom is kept very clean by the staff of the hotel and the Internet facility which is provided in few categories is extremely useful for the Guests staying with the hotel. This is a hotel which we would certainly recommend to your friends. Thank you Hotel Scarlet for making our stay so pleasant !

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Kezzles
Reviews.Content: we only stayed one night in Singapore and this hotel was great. Its just like the photos on the internet. Reception were very good and friendly. Our room was lovely if a little small but for one or two nights it was great. We stayed in the executive room with a balcony. Bathroom great nice shower and the bath robes were a nice touch, plus all the toiletries. we loved singapore and will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “So much potential but customer service worst ever”
Reviews.Author: Joey95
Reviews.Content: +ve Location - right next to Chinatown which is a must see with Hawker centres offering great food Terrace Bar - Some great views over singapore -ve Customer service - a small dispute over a relatively low amount was able to escalate and ended up taking over an hour to resolve. Other instances of it not being what it once was (I booked based on some of the old reviews). Prices - On drinks and food they are displayed without the 10% service charge and GST (VAT equivalent). Room space - If there are 2 of you in a room you'll need to take it in turns to do anything, no facilities for in room dining!! Well equipped though and several nice touches but can't get over the fact it was so small.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: mirkodxb
Reviews.Content: Short brief: Fantastic design very classy and cosy....but that's all....an Hotel is more than that... Front Office service...impolite and not efficient... they would charge you 200 $ for an hour late check out... after 5 days stay...unacceptable Terrace Bar service ... awful..after 2 bts of Champagne ... the only nibbles we got were 2 small bowls with outdated crisps.... The positive note the Concierge ... very friendly... polite and helpful... room 168 ( if i am not mistaken ) no windows on the wall... tiny room ...i mean 25 square metres... with a small ceiling window... were the blind was smaller than the window and in the morning the light coming through would wake you up at 6 am.... don't like to write bad reviews but this Hotel is far to be even a 4 star Hotel for their services in a very competitive city like Singapore... Get in touch with me if you like to have more details about my stay Regards

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Yaz73
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed at the Scarlet hotel, due to the great location in the trendier part of Chinatown. The service we received at both occasions was very welcoming and service-minded, always ready to assist. Especially a girl named Yna (if I remember correctly) did her utmost to make our stay memorable. Also the door man was most helpful. There is a very nice roof top terrace with the Breeze restaurant, I recommend having a relaxing drink up there in the evening. However, for food there are plenty of options nearby, which are both cheaper and at least as good (or better). The Maxwell hawkers stall is very close for local ambience. The rooms are quite small (we had an executive room with balcony), but comfortable and quite elegant. We did find the room not quite as clean the second time compared to the first, but there were no major flaws in this regard. Only complaint is that the toiletries were not refilled the second night of our stay, so did not have sufficient body lotion and shower gel. Due to the great location, value for money and the great service, I would choose to stay here again at my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel - rooms can be very small”
Reviews.Author: BoBoMaMa
Reviews.Content: No doubt the Scarlet is a neat boutique hotel. However, please make sure you check the room size first before booking. I paid extra for a room with balcony but the room was so small that I couldn't open the door because the only place to open my suitcase was behind the door. Needless to say, there was hardly any space to move around my room. Ultimately I requested to change to another room and it was a bit better. However,the room still remained to be small. Having said that, there are less expensive rooms in larger sizes. My recommendation is, don't pick the room with balcony! It's not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “The best choice around Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: MBWorldTraveller
Reviews.Content: Pros/Likes: - Fast effective check-in; I had my keys in less than 5 minutes - Nice helpful staff; service usually with a smile - Hotel areas were decorated very chic with shades of scarlet (red) - Executive room was a good size, clean, and nicely done with a desk, decent-size closets, and in-room safe (I understand the hotel used to be a row of shop-houses; they did a nice job at converting/remodeling) - Minibar that I used as a refrigerator since it had available space inside - Complimentary bottle of Sanpellegrino juice in the room - Daily complimentary bottle of water - In-room coffee/coffee-maker - Daily complimentary newspaper - Umbrella in the closet, which was nice because it rained some days - In-room DVD player with on-site movie library - Complimentary wired internet in-room and wireless in the lobby - Two dual Singapore/USA electrical sockets/outlets (others were just Singapore) Cons/Dislikes: Nothing major but... - No window (I understand this is an issue for a lot of people but I got over it quickly so if you want a room with a window, reserve/pay for one) - No clock radio - Only 16 TV channels - Slow drain in bathroom sink - It was occasionally noisy out in the hallway, which was felt in the room partly because the room has no foyer or little corridor to separate the door further away - The check-out lady could not give me a receipt because this was a prepaid stay through another website (I asked that I wanted to make sure no other charges had been applied but still she refused to give me a receipt/statement) Neutral: - Bed was harder and pillows were bigger than I prefer but I got used to it (I slept fine) - Location is an interesting subject; it's on the outskirts of Chinatown where there are a million places to eat within 5-10 minutes walking distance plus all that shopping for souvenirs but it's not in the more posh modern and shopping area towards Orchard Road...in other words, your choice but consider that the metro system is suberb! Miscellaneous: - Did not try gym - Did not try restaurants/bars, why when there are so many places to eat and clubs in the area? - Bear in mind that this review applies to an Executive Room and other types may vary Impression: The Scarlet is the best choice around Chinatown

Reviews.Title: “better value for money and service elsewhere to be found”
Reviews.Author: Ranjini050
Reviews.Content: I had to provide directions to the taxi driver - travellers take a map. Rooms had no windows - dark and the lighting not very good. rooms are small and cramped and if you have more than one piece of luggage be prepared for stubbed toes and the small rooms are neither conducive to a romantic atmosphere or spaciousness - for all the marketing on it being a romantic hide-away. It is anything but. Buildings and carpets do not appear to be well maintained. I have stayed here before and wont be again. Water temperature in the shower varied from luke-warm to luke-warm. If you are after a hot shower after a long flight, this is not the place. The staff need lessons in customer service and manners. I had enquired about a late check-out - I received a terse reply from the customer service manager which told me the check out times, and the charges that will apply if I were to check out late. They did not answer my question and were not helpful. I had only two staff who were friendly, and helpful...the others appeared to be studiously looking at their screens when I approached and appeared to choose to whom they were friendly and helpful to. My previous stay at the Scarlet was different, but I will not be going back. The food is expensive and not of a good standard. The carpets when we entered had a musty smell. Towels and bath robes were old and shabby. Staff made no attempt to understand or resolve the query I had on my bill and were defensive. I paid and left unhappy and disgruntled...I left the hotel early and spent my time in the airport - more than necessary! But it was better than being at the Scarlet.

Reviews.Title: “we love this charming romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: yvakat
Reviews.Content: I 've stayed in this place as well for my business trip as for leisure with my wife, and found it both times having exceeded my expectations, this hotel is a real gem, very romantic, has a very friendly staff, it's convenient located next to china town, it's in a bit more lively neighbourhood, there are some very good restaurants around, and if you want to eat cheap and local, go to the maxwell food court just opposite. This hotel has a lot of charm to offer, is very comfortable (excellent beds), and has a rooftop bar to spend some nice time in the evenings.. This hotel has a 'soul' and if you're tired of those 'big' hotels, you definitely should stay in the scarlet, we will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “The Place I stay in Singapore no questions !”
Reviews.Author: NigelPBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Boutique hotel, I can also describe it as "Sexy", ( You will understand that once you see it) The service is excellent and the rooms are small yet beautiful. Right close to Chinatown, there is a food market accross the road where you can grab a fantastic meal for under $10 Sing Dollars and the French district is right at the back, so there are some wonderful Bars and restaurants nice and close.

Reviews.Title: “Scarlet has lost some of its lustre”
Reviews.Author: scotthumphries
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last month with find memories of my previous visit a couple of years ago. At that time, I rated the Scarlet 5 stars and was very effusive in my praise. It is still quite a nice hotel and I still like the location, but I have to say the hotel has lost some of its lustre and I no longer think it can justify its rather high rates. The minibar is no longer fully stocked. What is in there is outrageiously overpriced. The ornate light fittings in the bathroom have gathered dust. They still have gigantic tube TV sets.
