The rooftop bar seems to have more staff than patrons. Bizarrely, they offer free wi-fi in the public areas of the hotel but not in the rooms - you have to purchase an overpriced broadband connection to use the internet in your room (too bad if you want to use an iPad). The beds are still very comfortable however. Overall, I did not come away with the feeling that the Scarlet represented value for money any more. I think they are resting on their laurels. Next time, I will try one of the many other boutique hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Maccke
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in China Town and very good value. Friendly and helpful staff. Very small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, very average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Merrick17
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that the staff were great at this hotel and responded to every request or issue with charm and efficiency. However, it is a boutique hotel which allows it some leeway when judging it against star rating system. The heritage building and location are fine but if you are used to staying in 4/5 star properties, including heritage hotels, there will be much about the facilities of this hotel which will disappoint. Rooms - we stayed in a deluxe (one step up from their standard rooms) which I chose because previous reviews said that standard rooms could be without natural light - well this room (108) had windows but they were at ceiling level and you would have to be much taller than me to see out of them, which you wouldn't be able to do as they are a) opaque glass and b) permanently covered by ceiling to floor curtains which do not draw (or if they are meant to then mine were broken!). This is probably because they are actually at street level for the alleyway behind the hotel - witnessed by the fact that from early in the morning there is the sound of trolleys being wheeled noisily past the windows. The rooms were adequately furnished, although very small, but this arrangement gave the impression of being housed in a cellar. Perhaps rooms higher up the building would be better - I didn;t get a chance to see. Also checked in late and TV in the room was not working (no sound) - to be fair the hotel fixed this quickly and efficiently but I would have thought they may have checked this. Finally if you are leaving on a late flight as we were and are unable to get a late check out, beware the facilities offered for changing/showering - we were offered a shower facility on the second floor however it turned out to be a shower cubicle alongside the toilet facilities used by guests of the bar/restaurant several floors up - as you are trying to change you are therefore on noddin acquaintance with the many people going in and out of the toilets - not very pleasant end to our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, heritage building and welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: LondonDonald
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth stay at the Scarlet and it won't be my last. It's a heritage building in the heart of Singapore's Chinatown in an unbeatable location, just step out of the door and in seconds you can enjoy the atmosphere, food and welcome in this ultra safe historic district (the whole of Singapore is ultra safe anyway!). Day or night Chinatown has something to offer and the Scarlet is the place to do it from. It's a heritage building so the cheaper rooms are definitely on the small size but you are booking the location here and a funky hotel with lots of great features. And, not once in my stay did I pass a member of staff who failed to greet me, by name if they knew it. One morning i got totally mixed up about what time it was and arrived for breakfast half an hour after it closed. The waiters sat me at a table and organised something for me. That's what they are like at the Scarlet. Broadband in rooms but Wifi only in public areas, but hotel tells me there are in process of getting Wifi into all rooms soon. Try the Scarlet for a non hotel chain experience in a wonderful part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and elegant for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: Riever
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights on our way to Australia. The decor is elegant and plush and although the rooms are small, they are very comfortable and stylish. It is close to China town and we found it convenient for getting about and to and from the airport by public transport. We enjoyed the roof top bar, but we didn't use the restaurant, although it did look very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a weekend in Chinatown!”
Reviews.Author: vague travellers
Reviews.Content: We had two nights in Singapore and loved it here. We had previously stayed at a couple of large comfortable 5 star chain hotels -- and they were fine. But we loved this one for being right at Chinatown which we thought was a good place for venturing in and out. The hotel itself was smaller than the big chains, and we found the service friendly and personal the whole time. We stayed one level up from the basic room -- it was actually big and very comfortable. It did not have a window but for us here, that didnt matter -- and staying in Chinatown meant that we werent looking for a river view or staying in the room anyway. So I understand the problems of some of the other reviews if you do find yourself in small windowless rooms -- all that we can say is that we found we had a very good room in a great location at a good discount price.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, very happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: Uptownerd
Reviews.Content: We went into staying at the hotel with a grain of salt after reading a few reviews about how some of the rooms were a tad small. We were pleased when we were given a decent sized room with windows (we had booked an executive room). We arrived in the wee hours of the morning and the staff were helpful, so we begun with a good impression. The room itself was lovely. I loved the decor and as we had arrived early in the morning (6am!) we immediately went to bed and found it easy to sleep with the black out curtains. The bathroom was also lovely! The location was great, right in the middle of Chinatown. We found ourselves wandering around each day and always found something to entertain us. Food was always available, yummy and very cheap. The hotel was also close to temples so it was easy to do the "tourist thing". The hotel also had free adsl which was good as we had brought our laptop. The free net is not wireless though. I could not fault the hotel whatsoever. I'd recommend it to friends/family (and advise to book the bigger room) and I would stay there myself again. I travelled and stayed there when I was 22 weeks pregnant and it was extremely comfortable for me.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: splitbulb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the New Year. Room had no windows and I suspect that the majority of the rooms in the hotel are similar - as far as I could see the main body of the hotel is within one narrow block on ground level and as the street facing sides of the block are occupied by shops and other commercial premises it means that the rooms on the interior are windowless. That said the room was spacious and quiet and the bathroom well appointed. The downstairs bar lacked any atmosphere but the roof bar was a pleasant place to have a drink and a meal. Breakfast was really awful - similar to what you would get in a middle European Motel. Totally forgettable. Location is handy for Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kiwichic13
Reviews.Content: The Scarlet Hotel is a fantastic Boutique Hotel. From the minute we arrived we were made to feel extremely welcome. The staff were highly professional, helpful & friendly. It was my birthday while we stayed and I was surprised by a small chocolate cake courtesy of the hotel. The rooms were clean and comfortable. For sundowners and an evening meal we visited the rooftop restaurant. A great hotel for a couple for a romantic get away

Reviews.Title: “very good boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: youyoucc
Reviews.Content: I went to Singapore last year and stayed here for 2 nights. Location is good and you can go to the night market nearby very conveniently. Also, you can find some bars here and enjoy yourself at night. Great hotel design and good service. But, some rooms are really small and without windows in it. Fortunately we have the big one.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden Jewel that needs to be unearthed!”
Reviews.Author: jpflies
Reviews.Content: I stayed in teh Scarlet Hotel for 2 nights and found my stay fantastic!!! The hotel is luxurious and welcoming at the same time, not overwhelming like the BIG 5 star hotels but with all the needs you need. The reception and Conceirge was very helpful and the location was excellent, a short stroll down the street and you are in the middle of Chinatown, just in the back is fanatastic cafes and small boutique stores and across the road is a great hawker centre! Getting a taxi is quite easy as there is 3 to many always coming up the street and with a 7/11 only a short stroll away why would you need to touch the mini bar? The room that i stayed was quite large with ample space to walk around, the bed was amazing and so comfortable with plush pillows. The only let down was the TV - an old CRT style TV that took a bit of space.... but at the end of teh day it did the job. The toilet and amenities were excellent. This place rocks!!! For the price it is definately worth it!!! The thing i like most about this hotel is the after sales service, i call the hotel a few times now to make sure i didnt leave anything and they alway call me back.... I dont get this from other hotels.... EXCELLENT CHOICE if you get the chance to stay in Scarlet!!!

Reviews.Title: “too much boutique”
Reviews.Author: permanentvacationist
Reviews.Content: very well located big boutique hotel with very very small rooms. unfortunately, you can stay in a room without any window, but beside this you would be lucky if you can walk around your bed without hitting any object. the concept and the design seem nice and catchy in the lobby, there is even nice bar. but i can not say the same about room since the furnitures seem kitch and tacky.

Reviews.Title: “It all seemed a bit 'try-hard'”
Reviews.Author: PerthJackson
Reviews.Content: The furnishings and general ambiance of the hotel all seemed a bit tacky to me. The dim lighting, muddy paint colours and plush curtains just felt dingy rather than opulent. When we arrived we were given a very small room with a queen size bed even though I had specifically booked an Executive room with twin beds. We were given the option of staying in the room for 2 nights (and my 16yo daughter and I sharing the bed) or moving to a room without a window until they could then move us to our requested room. We chose to share but the room was exceptionally small and there was a lot of noise from the street particularly in the middle of the night when the rubbish trucks emptied the bins from the food court across the road. We were not offered anything in compensation our inconvenience. When we moved to the larger room with twin beds we were much more comfortable and had a lot more space around us for luggage etc. The bathroom was of a good size and consisted of large shower, vanity and toilet. Unfortunately our room was sometimes not cleaned until 4.30 in the afternoon which was frustrating on returning from a long day out and wanting to shower and relax before dinner, we had to go and sit in the lobby until the room was finished. The staff were pleasant and helpful and the location was good for access to Chinatown and either the purple Chinatown MRT line or the Green line from Tanjong Pagar. Both about 5 minutes walk away. Would I stay here again? No.

Reviews.Title: “I am so pleased I booked this hotel, thanks to Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: JWalkerDorset
Reviews.Content: A truly lovely hotel, with bags of character. The reception staff were amazingly helpfull and nothing was too much trouble for them. Our room was delightful and well equiped, but a little small with limited storage for clothes. The hotel is centrally situated, on the edge of Chinatown, near the Indian section for a good curry, Orchard Road for posh shops and Clarkes Quay. We did not experience the noise at night, that other Tripadvisors had The food in the hotel is pricey, but good, however there are an abundance of restaurants of every nationality near by and at all prices

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: indigogrl
Reviews.Content: All the staff at the Scarlet were very helpful, friendly and professional. The room we had was a good size and beautifully decorated/furnished and the outdoor jacuzzi was right outside our door. Bathroom was a good size too. Roof top bar was pleasant and reasonably priced, staff very helpful too. Hotel is an old building so does not have the benefit of double glazing, can get very noisy with a nearby club, bin men and general noise from surrounding streets, though. 10 minute walk from Tanjong Pagar MRT station, a few minutes from Chinatown and a pleasant 15 minute stroll from Boat and Clarke Quays.

Reviews.Title: “Damp rooms and defects”
Reviews.Author: Antfly
Reviews.Content: Was shown 5 rooms which all issues, from marks on the walls, to mould, and they even tried to pit me into a disabled access room - not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “A True Lady in Red”
Reviews.Author: TripletBen
Reviews.Content: I must say this is one of the best boutique hotel I've stayed in. I was here with a few friends for 3 nights to eat, shop and party till we drop! We booked this hotel due to recommendations from friends' who've stayed here previously and thru few featured articles in conde nast and other vacation magazines. We were attended promptly by the friendly array of staff. The room we booked was a deluxe and it was clean, comfortable and equipped with a selection of amenities. The rooftop lounge, Breeze, was awesome to hang out and this hotel is only a step away from Singapore's yummiest food court and Chinatown! Will definitely come back and recommend ! Thanx Scarlet !!

Reviews.Title: “Good service and a good location!”
Reviews.Author: RogerdB
Reviews.Content: pros: -Nice ambiance -The location of the hotel is very good to explore Singapore -The hotel is conveniently located in China town just of a main road next to a foodcourt. -De staf is friendly and helpfull Cons: -The deluxe rooms are small but well equiped and comfortable. -The beds are not very large (so tall people should be aware of that).

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: Eat_pray_love2010
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to stay away from the multinational hotel chains and the overcrowded and overrated Orchard Street chaos, yet still be in a great location, then the Scarlet hotel is for you. This hotel is located on a quiet street one block away from Chinese Buddhist temple and takes up nearly the whole block. Definitely spend the nominal extra amount for an Executive room or a suite. Don't let the small room sizes turn you away. They are quaint but rich with character. Mine had vaulted, wood beamed ceilings and tasteful, modern decorations with an Asian flair The bathrooms were modern and the room was complete with 5 star amenities including bathrobes and slippers and an array of essential toiletries and minibar items. The staff were very friendly and went out of there way to make me feel at home. This is the perfect spot to begin your tour of Singapore as Chinatown - unlike any I've experienced before, is just steps away. Unwind at the hotel bar or go a block away and visit several small pubs and restaurants. The tour buses stop about 4 blocks from the hotel, where you can buy a pass that will take you to the various hotspots of the city. Also as a side note for those of you interested, this hotel is gay friendly and there are several gay night spots close by.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location not worth poor service and unclean, cramped room”
Reviews.Author: jdpoker
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on 7-8 October, and whilst the location was excellent afraid every other aspect was poor at best. In wanting to convey my feedback to the hotel, I completed the feedback form when I checked out and detailed my experience. It is in fact the first time, I have never received even an acknowledgement for completing the feedback form from a hotel, let alone an explanation as to the hotel's shortcomings. Guess this is a reflection of how important this hotel views its customers. The hotel's concept is unique, sort of a boudoir, and I thought the boutique nature would be a welcomed change from the usual business hotels in Singapore. However, the rooms are very small and with the hotel's concept, feel cluttered. I had paid extra from a room with a balcony, which I would not recommend as it was more of a ledge than somewhere to sit out with a view (I have confirmed all of the rooms with a balcony are like this). Upon being shown to the room, I called reception if I could change to a room with some view, even if it was without a balcony, and was flatly told 'no' (most hotels would at least check and see if there was no availability). The general cleanliness of the room, I found below average and I would imagine this is due to their cramped size, making it difficult to clean down both sides of the bed. I also noted the duvet smelt damp and requested that house-keeping change it before I returned from dinner. Unfortunately, they didn't and I couldn't get anyone to do so before I had an early night before an important business meeting. Given Singapore's excellent public transport, I wouldn't even recommend this hotel on the basis of its location. The lack of even an acknowledgement after providing feedback to hotel just shows their apparent lack of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FulhamTom
Reviews.Content: I research hotels on Trip Advisor as you are doing and found some great reviews and some not so good. We had a great experience. The staff were very helpful and accomodating. The location was just right for us near to Chinatown and about a 6-7 minute walk to the underground railway. We were lucky to get a balcony room which was lovely but had a view of a car park - that's about teh only negative pint in my view (well maybe a beer in the bar was ridiculously exensive as well!) . The pool outside ws lovely to lay in and cool down as it really is very humid for a Brit in Singpaore. If we go back to Singapore we will definately book back in - Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Staff were great”
Reviews.Author: bruce2NewYork
Reviews.Content: If you are not here for business this is a good central location. the staff is great!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service, Bad Attitude”
Reviews.Author: greengobe
Reviews.Content: The nightmare started with the checked in. Staff's mind was somewhere else. I asked the reception staff "Can I checked in now?" as I had arrived at 11am and you know the staff were not listening to you when he say "sure, let me check you in" and after the checked in, they tell you "sorry, your checked is done but you can't have the room yet, as we were running full last night" This is a time wasting, as if the reception staff had said the room were not available, we would have went off after getting to luggage stored. Went to the room, and realized the shower area was bad. The soap holder was spoilt, tilted to the floor, waiting to drop off anytime and the holder for the shower head is spoilt, and as a result, the water would splash out into the toilet area. The hotel pride itself to be sleek and chic, with taglines like passion, desire and romance, but the housekeeping threw my partner's bear on the floor. How romance and passion can there be, when the staff are so poorly trained with their own hotel culture. I wasn't expecting them to tuck the bear in like one of the bay area hotel, but at least not throwing the bear on the floor. I borrowed a pair of scissors from the front desk, and upon check out I told the front desk that the scissors are in the room. Most proper hotel will just ignore it, but this hotel was too poor and too free, and the front desk staff took 10minutes to go into the room, come back and said, he can't find the scissors. They also look v sad and miserable when they realize they had to refund you some money if you had paid by cash. I just told the frontdesk staff, its in the room as I wasn't going to wait for him to go back into the room and find it again. The television set is tiny by today's standard, and looks recycled from another hotel chain. I can hardly see anything with the bright reflection from the spotlight in the room, and there aren't many people who want to watch CNN in pitch dark. I recommend this room for anyone one who has inexhaustable energy dealing with ineffective people

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned, stylish but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: NG-Traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip to Singapore. The hotel is one of the smaller ones though very nicely done inside. The staff were very helpful and welcoming with a painless check in. The room was a little small though perfectly acceptable with good amenities. Breakfast was fine and the restaurant looked nice but given it was 4 minutes walk from Chinatown and a vibrant night market and street food, why eat there? It was also a pleasant 15 minutes walk to Clark Quay with lots of nightlife, riverside eateries and attractions. I would stay again (and am about to do so!). For around £100 a night I thought this was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Murderwen
Reviews.Content: The Scarlet was really suited what we looked for by reading those review. Here are some good points about this hotel : - Service : Top notch ! On arrival, staff welcomed us by very friendly smiles and helpful service. - Room : Really impressed with the room. We asked for a quiet room as stated on our booking requirement. And i think it is good tip that you should always do that in any other hotel as well. Our sleep was comfortable and the room were cleaned and tidied up every day. This is like 10* furniture compared to what i usually get from European hotel - Location : opposite Chinatown, ~$18 cab to the Singapore Zoo. I am happy with this hotel and i am sure others agree.

Reviews.Title: “I miss Scarlet hotel”
Reviews.Author: InspectorTH
Reviews.Content: More than I year ago that I experienced The Scarlet hotel Singapore. It's still fresh in my mind of its bold character, attentive staff, the narrow hallway with great work on the details, the small but well equipped room. Only negative was a missing window which gave a feeling that it's unsafe if there was fire. I was arriving late and was a bit tired to ask for other room. All and all, I miss The Scarlet hotel and I will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: countryretreat
Reviews.Content: Had doubts as i had heard good and bad reports but found a lovely hotel in a very convient location for getting around staff extremely helpful would return here any day

Reviews.Title: “Compact rooms but otherwise superb boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: brawford
Reviews.Content: The Scarlet exemplifies everything a 4 star boutique should be; top end service and beautiful rooms yet with a more relaxed atmosphere than the typical 5 star would present. The Scarlet has several restaurants and a nice little outdoor pool (don't expect anything lap-worthy though!) although it is very much an urban hotel and as such space is at a premium; the rooms are relatively small (think typical top end New York room). Despite it's diminutive size our room had a nice balcony and the fittings could only be described as luxurious; the shower was very powerful! I can thoroughly recommend the Scarlet; it is very much a 5 star establishment in everything but facilities and services and it is a beautiful building to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice one”
Reviews.Author: Road777
Reviews.Content: The room was a bit small but quite clean and nice. We could use internet access with a cable in our room. The staff was helpful and friendly. Good overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great character, excellent service, only the best memories.”
Reviews.Author: SylphideMla
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this a year late, but I still have only the best memories of our stay at the Scarlet. Service was prompt and cheerful. The food was lovely - those bread rolls, our set menu at lunch, room service steak and nasi goreng! Our room was tiny, but we hardly found it inconvenient as the bed was comfortable and everything was clean. I loved the ambience and the little touches that tied in with the Scarlet persona, from cheeky word play to warm red interiors. It was great coming home after a day of sightseeing or shopping to a drink or two at the rooftop. Never felt cheap, always classy, and worth it all the way! ;)

Reviews.Title: “boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: vivyoun
Reviews.Content: I had originally booked a standard room with no window for a short two night stay but got upgraded to a suite ( you can imagine my excitement). It was beautifully decorated, comfortable and enough space to spread out your luggage and belongings. The service was great, staff were always polite and helpful. The hotel is in a very convenient location, close to China Town and the business district and a short walk to Chinatown MRT station. It is also next to what is arguably one of the best hawker centres I've visited in Singapore- Maxwell Food Centre. You must try the Hainanese Chicken rice! The hotel is also situated right next to Ann Siang Rd & Ann Siang Hill where you will find funky boutiques and a great cafe called Shots. Have a wonder around- there are also lots of a cute little restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “nice – will come back!”
Reviews.Author: HelmutNassauer
Reviews.Content: The Scarlet is in every term perfect. Its located in a nice neighborhood, the service is perfect, friendly, international and very obliging, the rooms are well decorated and – though a bit small – very charming and cozy. The hotel has a scale which is very non-Singapore, its a small only one to two storey high snake like structure winding down a little hill. The perfect hotel for a experience of Singapore to remember. And all that for a perfect value for money. Will stay there again…

Reviews.Title: “Actual rooms are different from the photos!”
Reviews.Author: acyy
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of the reviews here and the photos on their website. We request a room with a queen size bed. When we arrived, we were given a room on the ground floor with no window, and two single beds pushed together. The room was dark, stuffy, and had a smell of old carpets. We requested to change rooms but they refused to unless we pay additional fee to upgrade to deluxe. At the end we had to pay for the premium because the room was just unacceptable. The carpet was dirty and we did not enjoy our stay at the hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and good value”
Reviews.Author: fulhamtomUk
Reviews.Content: Having read the other reviews I wasn't 100% certain but we were lucky and had a good room with a balcony. The room was very nice if a little compact but it had a lovely big shower and bathroom. The staff were extremely helpful and accommodating. They helped locate a guidebook I'd left at the airport and when we left they volunteered the fact that we could leave cases and use the shower and Jacuzzi facilities on floor 2B. The area was very close to the Chinese area and the MRT station which was five minutes walk. The taxis were vey cheap and air-conditioned because in case you don't know it always seems to be humid and around 28-32 degrees! Good places to visit was Sentosa by cable car, Raffles which was much larger than we expected the Hawker markets for food. The Chinese area and Little India. The Hippo cruise from Clarke Quay was also good and that area is very busy at night with loads of cars and restaurants. If we return to Singapore I will go back to The Scarlet Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel. Accomodating Staff. Safe, fun location.”
Reviews.Author: Pezman2005
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights and this boutique hotel is in a great location with plenty to do nearby. There are a number of boutique shops just down the road, a temple, market area, restaurants, and more. If you haven't been to Singapore before the Scarlet is a great place to stay. Regarding the rooms. Be prepared - they are tight. The bathroom is actually about the size of the living space, but honestly the rooms are comfortable so you really don't notice. The staff is amazing. From flagging down a taxi, to luggage, or just assisting you with the day-to-day they do a great job. The hotel is also in tip top shape - prestine condition. The breakfast in the AM is fantastic and the bar is fun and mod. There's even a jacuzzi on the roof - it's pretty cool. The gym is very small but gets the job done. It's kind of crazy actually because the gym has glass panels so people walking by can watch you workout! Would definitely recommend and stay @ again.

Reviews.Title: “If you're a fan of windows - be careful!”
Reviews.Author: griergg
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at the Scarlet - I like the location, I like the staff. BUT I've ended up both times in a room without windows. The first time a made such a song and dance about it that I noticed they've made it a policy on Agoda for example, that they make mention of the fact that some rooms are without windows and there-fore offered at a slightly lower rate. Knowing what I know from the first time I stayed I deliberately booked a "deluxe" room. Of course it DOES have a window. The window is about 6 feet off the floor, 1 foot high and has frosted glass and it cant be opened . Not cool.

Reviews.Title: “Style but unfortunately doesn't quite hit the mark”
Reviews.Author: BecPerth
Reviews.Content: Just got back from SIngapore and stayed at the Scarlet for three nights. We had room 126 which is the room furtherest from the reception. Unfortunately that happens to be a 120+ step walk down a tight corridor to your room. I knew about the window situation before going which didn't worry me but admittedly the rooms are small - very little room to move around, and even harder if you have more than one large suitcase (we had two and it was tough finding room for the second one). The main restaurant upstairs was fabulous for dinner but VERY pricey ($50++ for mains); the bar downstairs was nice and intimate but sometimes there was noone at the bar? Same at the restaurant when we first went in - took five minutes to find someone to tell us it was actually open for dinner (completely empty???) In saying that, it was a very stylish place, classy with great service at reception. Clearly a lot of effort has gone into the decor which was appreciated. If you are using the hotel as a base and dont plan to spend too much time there - perfect. Chinatown is right there and the MRT is five minutes away. But if you are looking for something to spoil yourself with or plan to spend more time in your room then just for sleeping, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Room! Ideal place for business travel!”
Reviews.Author: PetrifyRose
Reviews.Content: Our company had reserved a room at Scarlet hotel for me - just the only reason that it is closed to my company I work for. Great location! Only 2 minutes to get the night market (for looking around and shopping). A lot of complex and restaurant around the hotel to have lunch or dinner. They gave me a cozy, comfort & quiet room - with standing shower. However, the room does not have a window - but not a trouble to me. Internet access is available in room but it is not a wifi one, you must use the cable plug-in to access to the internet. Breakfast is not included. but I usually have breakfast at a foodcourt at Hong Lim complex - only 5 minutes walk away from the hotel. There are a lot of breakfast menu to choose. The staff is helpful, but only a few of them are friendly. The MRT is only 3 minutes away! Easy to access and travel around Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Serene experience”
Reviews.Author: Tony_Lombardo
Reviews.Content: The Scarlet Hotel is aesthetically a joyous experience. The entrance alone is wonderfully unique, and the staff are impeccably mannered, as seemingly most people in Singapore are. The executive room (303) with a balcony was quirky, beautiful, clean and romantic, with a colonial and homely ambience. The lighting was warm and cosy. The shower was hot and powerful. I couldn't have liked it more. Perhaps the only 'cons' were related to the small size of the hotel, rather than a deficiency in it as an organisation - Namely, the lack of a pool (there is a rather cold outdoor jacuzzi) and the tiny size of the gym (very limited free weights or racks for serious training). Overall: Highly recommended - I can only speak for the balcony room I had, but it is a serene, 'value-for-money' experience in a hotel that successfully attempts to be sensual and luxurious in an entirely unique fashion (unlike most standard 4 or 5 star 'chain' hotels). The staff were courteous and helpful. The location 'out of town' in the southern Chinatown area is much more authentic than I imagined, and the local food markets are simply the best place to dine in the warm open air at affordable prices.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay at the...”
Reviews.Author: AliPatch
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Scarlet. The rooms were small but comfortable and the staff friendly and helpful. The location was also great. There's a hawker market across the road where we ate everyday and bus and trains within a short walk. The 'hippo' tourist bus also stops just nearby. My only critism is that the housekeeping was inconsistent - we stayed for 5 nights and some days the glasses were refreshed, other days they weren't, some days the bathroom toiletries were refreshed other days they weren't. Overall a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: Ric-Gill
Reviews.Content: Excellent boutique hotel right on the edge of chinatown that's perfect if you want something with more character and value than the big 5-star places. We booked an executive room which was lovely and furnished with everything from large shower and bathroom to comfy robe (the standard rooms looked a little small). Location was great ... 50-metres from the bustling food hawkers' centre with a colourful array of terrific, cheap food, and only a minute or two from the other main restaurant streets of chinatown. It's an easy 20-minute stroll to the more upmarket Clarke Quay and riverfront area. Don't bother with the rooftop bar unless you're into expensive drinks and bar staff who are too cool for school.

Reviews.Title: “CHARACTER, CHARM & COMFORT”
Reviews.Author: traveller-writer
Reviews.Content: Well positioned near Chinatown and in walking distance of a MRT station this is a great little boutique hotel. You get a super-friendly welcome from seriously accommodating staff. The room we stayed in was not large but it was truly comfortable, although the street noise was a little high if the windows are opened. Maybe you can request a room away from the street. There is an excellent restaurant on the roof (but it's perhaps more fun to eat in Chinatown) and the breakfast menu is excellent. Will we go back - certainly, every time we visit Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly room and inflexible/ confrontational staff. A very disappointing (and over-priced) stay.”
Reviews.Author: chezzz88
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Scarlet with 4 other friends for one night in late May 2010. I was in a Standard single room, two of my friends were in a Deluxe double room and the other two were in an Executive room. First of all there are good points about this hotel. It is housed in a row of restored old buildings so from the outside it looked very stylish and charismatic. The evening concierge (a Mr. Azan(sp?)) was also very helpful and efficient in giving advice about restaurants and aranging transport. However, the bad points far outweight the few good points that this hotel had:- 1. Firstly, check-in took an inordinately long time (almost half an hour). Even more ridiculous was that despite check in taking so long they still had to stop us on our way to dinner to ask for our credit card details because they had forgotten to do so at check-in. 2. The staff were also strangely inflexible about their processes. It appears that staff are instructed to give an standard introductory speech to all guests while they wait for check-in. 3 of my friends arrived first and heard it first. When me and my other friend arrived later we were sat down and they started repeating the speech from the top. Seeing as my other 3 friends have already listened to most of it could they not have demonstrated some flexibility in not repeating it or at least just subjected us to an abridged version (especially as it did not contain any critical information)? We actually said this to the staff halfway through but were totally ignored. Perhaps this lengthy introduction was to (unsuccessfully) hide the fact that check-in at this place somehow takes very long. 3. When I entered my room I was hit by the strong smell of mildew. When I asked reception for a room spray, the receptionist reacted before I had even before I had finished and I was quickly offered an ioniser which makes me suspect that smells are not an uncommon problem at this hotel (it may have something to the lack of windows and hence sunlight/ fresh air in many of the rooms). 4. There was also a smell of bad eggs which came and went. I think the smell came from the toilet. Given the tiny size of the Standard room the smell permeated through the room very quickly (despite the ioniser) 5. It appears that a lot of the rooms do not have windows at this hotel. The staff rather defensively mentioned as part of the introductory speech (even though we did not say anything) that this was set out in the room description. However, I had checked out the website of the hotel before our stay and do not remember seeing this fact (it may have been mentioned in some obscure corner of the website which I missed). The Standard single room was windowless. The Deluxe room had a slither of a skylight (hidden behind a beam) which might as well not have been there. Even the Executive room's skylight was just a tiny window on the ceiling which reminded me of an oubliette. 6. Before we left we were once again subjected to the inflexibility and even borderline rudeness of the staff. When we arranged our morning call the night before we were informed that it would come with complimentary tea and coffee the next morning. We responded along the lines of "Excellent. Thanks". The next morning the morning call came as promised but when we asked for our tea and coffee in the lobby afterwards the staff member we spoke to first looked at us as if we were aliens who have just landed from outer space and then repeatedly asked whether we had ordered the tea and coffee the night before. We told him we had been offered it when we arranged the morning call the night before. After a bit of a kerfuffle tea and coffee was finally brought to us. However, that member of staff came back and told us rather sanctimoniously that we should have asked for tea and coffee the night before. By this point we were all fed up. What precisely is the difference between us proactively ordering tea and coffee the night before and us being offered tea and coffee and accepting that offer the night before?! It was such a stupid little non-point over what was only tea and coffee but that member of staff simply wouldn't let it go and we had to have a second round of explanation/ argument with him. There may have been a breakdown in the chain of communication in the hotel but it was not our fault and there was certainly no reason for the staff to be so confrontational. 7. As an aside, I overheard two girls complaining to the reception (around early evening) that their room was too noisy (although I am not sure whether this was due to the rooftop bar or the bars behind the hotel). In summary it was unpleasant stay due to the poor quality of both the room and the staff. I was lucky to have only stayed one night. The hotel very much wants to be a trendy, luxury boutique hotel but has fallen very, very short. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the hype...good location but pretentious with the smallest room imaginable”
Reviews.Author: Nicolafb
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on trip advisor I was fairly confident about this hotel but I must have missed something because having just come back from a 1 night stay I certainly wouldn't be going back. I don't want to be too negative. It certainly wasn't awful and the location is pretty good as it is so near Chinatown although the street that it is on is pretty lively at night ( including the hotel itself) and so you will get lots of noise outside - and we stayed on a Monday night so I dread to think what it would be like on a Saturday night! We may have been unlucky with our room but it was the tiniest room imaginable. I upgraded to an executive room with a balcony as I had read some of the reviews about size of rooms but our room was absolutely tiny. I don't remember the last time I stayed in a room so small! The balcony overlooked a car park so whilst it was large it was too hot and depressing to use it. I would sooner have had the space that the balcony took up added to the room. We both had large suitcases as we had just come back from 8 days in Bali and we could hardly fit them in the room. The room itself was OK but nothing special - trying hard to be stylish but with such a small room simpler might have been better. However the bed was very comfortable, the airconditioning was good and the internet access for free was excellent. We didn't use the bar, restaurant or have breakfast so I can't comment on those which a lot of people seem to really rate so maybe if we had used those it would have improved my experience. The staff were good although a bit overily fussy and check in took forever for some reason. All in all I think this hotel is very overrated. It is all style and no substance but if you like that kind of thing I am sure you will enjoy it. I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique-style hotel meets expectations for a birthday trip”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline J
Reviews.Content: After travelling round some of south-east Asia on an extended trip, we were ready for a treat in time for my husband's birthday. I chose the Scarlet after he was smitten by their photo's on the website, and we weren't disappointed. The building is a gem, both outside and in, with generous use of swagging and draping of lux furnishings to create the boudoir chic that is the hotel's theme. Our room was the farthest located from reception down a series of corridors, but it does guarantee no passing traffic to wake you in the night. The room itself was lovely, less vivid than the main reception areas so much more restful. Be warned that some of the rooms (ours included) don't have proper windows, so although they are lit well enough, if you get claustrophobic you may wish to let the staff know at check-in so they can assign the room you are best suited to. Check in was quick and easy, served by welcoming staff, and this welcome set the tone for all of our dealings with the staff. Upon mentioning to the desk clerk that it was a special occasion, my husband was wished a happy birthday and when we returned from our dinner, we found a piece of birthday cake and a card awaiting him from the guest relations manager. We had cocktails in the rooftop bar one evening, and the range and price is what you might expect from a hotel, but the bar is lovely - views over the rooftops across chinatown. We had breakfast in the hotel one morning, and this is the only area I felt was disappointing. It would be hard for anyone to justify the value for money, but as the price is on par with hotels of it's standard, maybe I'm just not a hotel breakfast person. My personal recommendation would be to eat out of the hotel as much as possible simply to ensure you taste all the diverse food options this amazing city offers. The Maxwell food court is opposite the hotel, and is a great option for meals throughout the day and for beers in the evening. Location in chinatown is great - right on the doorstep for one of the most old-world atmospheric areas of the city. All in all, if you're in the market for a bit of luxury, this is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly hit, a little miss for boutique hotel lovers”
Reviews.Author: grrlfrommars
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay in this hotel but I think that could have differed if we stayed in 231. We booked an Executive Room after all the helpful reviews advised they were better options than the Standard and Deluxe Rooms. We were checked into 231 and when we straight away attempted to put waters in the mini fridge realised that it didn't work - it was piping hot! After flying in on a red eye, arriving in Singapore at 5am and not being able to check in until 2pm we really needed to grab a few hours sleep before going on a walking tour. Staff attempted to faff about to fix the fridge but we asked if we could change rooms so we could check in straight away and get to bed. We were moved to room 224 which was also an Executive but it was a much better room. It had more space either side and at the foot of the bed and the bathroom was twice the size, but was still very small. The previous inconvenience was a blessing in disguise as spending 3 nights in that tiny room would have been awful. The room, and the hotel itself, were very nicely gorgeously decorated and had all the facilities we needed. It also had a very very comfortable bed! The facilities at the hotel such as the bar, restaurant and rooftop bar were all great but it would have been good to have the spa open later (after a long day of touring) , or even have a swimming pool to cool down in. We loved the location of the hotel; walking distance to all the Chinatown eateries and market stalls, across the road from the Maxwell Food Centre, and a short stroll to the Chinatown MRT Station. We ate so much great food, which was very cheap, and loved being in the centre of a more 'authentic' experience. All the tourist sights are a mere train ride away. We had a few minor hiccups, such as the hotel accidentally checking us out after the first night but thankfully the only impact was standing around in the foyer with all our shopping bags for a while. Staff also messed up our airport shuttle booking and didn't think to phone and tell us, but we were able to get a taxi at the last-minute. There were a few minor problem during our stay but they were outweighed by the positives so we would certainly come back.

Reviews.Title: “ideal for a romantic break”
Reviews.Author: JohnSFleet_Hants_UK
Reviews.Content: centrally located in chinatown and with individual style, unlike the chain hotels. very helpful staff, good restaurant. classed as boutique hotel as rooms are small but we got an upgrade to a suite, all red and gold.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere different.”
Reviews.Author: jareynolds
Reviews.Content: When travelling for 6 weeks from the UK to New Zealand it seems crazy to look forward so much to the last hotel on the homeward leg. We did and despite all the warnings of small rooms my husband and I found this hotel to be a jewel. Fantastic location, warm exotic ambience, especially if arriving after nightfall. Delightful jacuzzi/ sundeck area on the 2nd floor and a great reasonably priced restaurant on the roof. Our room on the 3rd floor had an intriguing view across the rooftops with just a glimpse of one of the many temples. We loved it. Breakfast is slightly expensive but 10 mins walk down Neil Road you'll find the something Frog does western style breakfast. Don't try the local restaurants with pictures of food for breakfast unless you like sweet toast and undercooked watery poached eggs and ghastly coffee. Great cake shop 2 minutes along South Bridge road. Only criticism of the hotel is they don't promote their own facilities enough. The room info books although nicely presented do not explain all that is offered in the hotel. Go and ask or explore for yourself. We nearly missed it all. Hotel is within walking distance to everywhere of interest or the easy simple underground system [get a dollar back when returning your ticket at the end of your journey]. Anyone wanting sun and beach head for Sentosa. History buffs look for the Battle Box in Fort Canning Park, the Fort Siloso tour on Sentosa and the emotionally charged quietness of the War Grave cemetery at Kranji. Biggest disappointment was the 'changed' Raffles. The new location of the Longbar on the 2nd floor condems it to being an ordinary characterless bar albeit with peanut shells all over the floor. No mention it being of the home of the Singapore sling and the characters who made the place famous. All that is tucked away in the new in-house museum. We're glad we saw it 24 years ago with all the original character and atmosphere of a true colonial bar. Singapore is still one of the great stopovers and we'd come back to the Scarlet Hotel every time.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: missdeuxmont
Reviews.Content: We generally like to avoid larger, chain hotels and prefer smaller boutique hotels such as the Scarlet. It has a jacuzzi, a couple of bars/restaurants, and a gym. So the Scarlet was really suited. What a great first impression of Singapore - on arrival at the Scarlet Hotel we received genuine, friendly, helpful service, and were really impressed with the room. We asked for a quiet room on booking, so they put us right at the end of the hotel - had a great sleep, the bed was super comfortable. The rooms are actually quite luxe, and I have to rate the shower as the best I've ever experiened at a hotel. The previous review to mine is really accurate. Free high speed internet = bonus. The Scarlet is opposite Chinatown, and next to the Maxwell Foodcourt - pop over there for authentic Asian food, we paid less than $15 for dinner for two, and picked up some beers for the Jacuzzi later. ~$18 cab to the Singapore Zoo. The rooms are smaller, but we we expected this, we booked a room with a balcony so the size is not so noticeably. Overall an excellent experience that I would recommend - business or couples.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE, this hotel doesnt allowed anything with DSLR camera to take any picture.”
Reviews.Author: redshappire
Reviews.Content: means, you only allowed to use that small tiny little camera, that I wont use it ever since I buy my self a professional camera, and its a small onee. I asked them why? they simply say it, anything with professional camera is not allowed, even if I have a photo with a family member for memory. they even added this, MODELS IS STRICTLY NOT ALLOWED as well.. hellooowww???? too much. these days most of everyone has dslr camera. and the funny thing, what if a models going there for aholiday or trip??? gee. none want to take a photo of your hotel. oh please c'mon. too proudd

Reviews.Title: “A Sophisticated Boutique Hotel for Non-tourists”
Reviews.Author: gitravel
Reviews.Content: The Scarlet is a sophisticated boutique hotel for non-tourists. It is everything I expect in a world-class boutique hotel: location reflecting the character of the city, small number of rooms (not a corporate compound), personalized service, interesting architecture, intentional interior design and unique feel, useful luxurious amenities, attention to detail. The service was personalized. There was someone to open the doors for us, smiled and greeted us as we walked in. They were courteous at the front desk and whenever we called from our room. They offered us to walk in front of them and insisted that we always leave the elevator first. The location was perfect for us, within easy walking distance to two MRT rail stations (Chinatown or Raffles Place) and also convenient for taxis or buses. Also across the street was the legendary Maxwell Food Centre which had the best (and cheapest) "street food" in the entire country. Pros: VERY comfortable beds, Free fast interenet access (other hotels charged $10 or more per day), very nice slippers (see photo), close to MRT and Maxwell Food Centre, free newspaper daily, complementary water and Limonata drinks on our first day, hardwood floors in the entry. Cons: rooms a bit small (but no smaller than average rooms in Singapore)

Reviews.Title: “very good choice”
Reviews.Author: salvete2000
Reviews.Content: perfect located in Chinatown, especially if you are gay, many bars and sauna. very clean, super nice stuff, very helpful and nice, internet for free in the room, very good food in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but rooms way too small for more than a short stay”
Reviews.Author: MollyColly
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an executive room with balcony for 2 nights on our way to Vietnam which even though it is considered to be one of the larger rooms in the hotel, we found it was extremely small and found it difficult to maneouvre around the room and almost impossible to do so with 2 large suitcases ....... could only open the suitcases on the bed as there wasnt enough room to do so anywhere else. The decor was very nice and opulent looking (sort of Moulin Rouge meets Dracula with plush red velvets, gold brocade curtains and black surfaces) and the staff were very efficient, although a little disappointing in the bar/restaurant where they took our order and then promptly forgot about us, which if they were busy might have been acceptable but there were few people there. We booked this hotel due to its proximity to Chinatown which we found a little disappointing in comparison to Chinatown in KL. If we were to find ourselves in Singapore again, I would book one of the larger hotels in and around Clarke Quay as we found this area had more to offer visitors who were there for a short time only.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,”
Reviews.Author: seabass747
Reviews.Content: Before booking, I was looking for location first and foremost. I knew I wanted to avoid the generic big hotel chains of the Orchard Road area since I'm not interested in shopping. I usually don't lend much credence to self-assigned star ratings I was looking for and expecting something more spartan, but in fact the Scarlett hotel is very luxurious. It is truly boutique hotel I would recommend it most for couples on romantic getaways. Since Expedia was selling the "Executive room" at a discount, it was cheaper than the lesser "deluxe". The room was huge and had a little desk, fridge, and all the amenities (and DVD player with free rentals at the front desk). The room was absolutely spotless (how very 'Singapore'!) and very quiet. I remember a traveller review lamenting the long walk to the lobby (as the hotel is built length-wise). Well I got the very last room at the end of the last corridor on the second floor! It is not that bad, but because the hallway is not in a straigh tline, you may get the impression that you are stuck in a maze. But the distance from the room wasn't a concern to me I since I spent all my time in Singapore walking and using the SMRT transit. And the hotel's location is perfect for the MRT as it sits right between Chinatown MRT and Tanjong Pagar MRT (the one to Changi Airport). A 5 minute walk either way. Since they are on different lines, you get more options. Staff were extremely courteous and very efficient (very short wait at checkout).

Reviews.Title: “Scarlet Starlit”
Reviews.Author: Polter
Reviews.Content: The Scarlet Hotel is located in Chinatown on a quiet street one block off the main drag. The staff is super helpful with touring advice, restaurants and local attractions. The hotel is one block from Club Street, which is a chic restaurant and club venue. The MRT subway entry is nearby giving you ready access to the whole city. Our room was ample size, free TV, modern bath (shower, no tub). A breakfast buffet is extra at US$20. The ride from the airport is about 30 mins and about US$20. The rooftop restaurant is pretty but a bit pricey. There is a fitness center and outdoor hot tub. A daily newspaper (The Straight Times) appears each morning. Hotel decor is sumptuous.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but...”
Reviews.Author: Newsuitcase
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Scarlet. Were given a room that was so small we couldn't both walk around the bed at the same time. No window and only a skylight. Frustratingly, on our final day we saw some of the other rooms which looked nice and much bigger. So if you get Room 228, ask to change. Breakfast unimpressive. Bathroom a bit mouldy. Location excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable beds and excellent servie”
Reviews.Author: pulmonator
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in Hotels about 75% of the time for the last year, and the beds at the scarlet are by far the most comfortable i have slept on! (unless you like soft beds). Stayed here twice in March 10, once in a Standard room, once in a premium. It is a 4 star "Boutique" hotel, and has quite a quirky feel to it, but for a business traveler who wants something different from the modern, sleek and boring norm, it's quite nice. the service is excellent, the rooms are comfortable and very well appointed, and the choice of pillows is quite entertaining. I didn't eat at the Hotel, but understood that the food is not bad at all, though the breakfast is way overpriced and not something to write home about. The lack of a wireless infrastructure is annoying, and so is the connection itself which isn't great, but on the other hand it's free, which in Singapore actually drops the room price by an average of 25$. the location is great and the choice of cafe's, restaurants and food stalls within walking distance is quite impressive. would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small Comfortable Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wizsup
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at this hotel and I know you have heard this before - location, location, location. This hotel is on the edge of Chinatown in Singapore. It is also an easy walk to Clark Quay. The rooms are a bit small but they are quite and comfortable and always clean. The bathrooms are very nice. The staff is always helpful and courteous. Breakfast can be expensive but worth doing until you get you bearings and find other places for your morning meal. Don't miss out on the roof bar for that cool evening breeze with a friend and a cold drink. Priced right I will stay here again. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: NomadicBangalore
Reviews.Content: I stayed there recently with a bunch of female friends - we were there to celebrate a bachelorette. The hotel staff was incredibly accommodative to all unusual requests, including hosting a party in one of our rooms, providing us with music options, cleaning up the room two or three times in the same day and so on. The standard rooms are small and basic, but the deluxe rooms were good sized and well done up in a plush, almost kitschy way. The hotel location was also great, right next to chinatown and the very picturesque Ann Siang Road. All in all, it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “A standout!”
Reviews.Author: highlander10
Reviews.Content: we have stayed in numerous locations and hotels in Singapore,but The Scarlet is now where we would return.Atmospheric in a modern setting-the service was faultless-the restaurant excellent-it was agreat experience

Reviews.Title: “An experience.”
Reviews.Author: tembo
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on rave reviews on TA, the location was very good, we loved being so near the night market and the temple. The hotel was a bit different, it emphasized it's "sensual" element which to me seemed to make it a bit tacky. I was prepared for the small room, the staff were very helpful, we had a reasonable room service meal, breakfast was nice. They took payments from our CC which they should not have and we are still trying to recover this from them. That apart, I doubt if I'd stay there again but neither would I advise people not to go - it's an experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: soho75
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March to attend the Singapore Restaurant Week (http://www.restaurantweek.sg), which was recommanded by the hotel conceirge. Staff here is really friendly, rooms are not big but okay. If like you nice & small boutique hotels you will for sure loves this one.

Reviews.Title: “The smallest bed you can find”
Reviews.Author: dissatisfied041
Reviews.Content: My room was located just next to the emergency exit and I couldn't sleep because of the noise the staff who used it made.(The room is not soundproof at all) The bed was the smallest one I have ever seen. It was about 90 cm wide. If you can sleep anywhere in any circumstance, this hotel is not too bad since the location is good, But I won't use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: la_speranza
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time I stayed at this hotel, and it never disappointed me. I booked the executive room with verendah directly, they offered a great price. The room is decorated beautifully, although a bit small. Facilites in the room are of high standard. They even offered me a tempur pillow for improving the sleep quality. Internet in the room is high seppd and very reliable, and is FREE. The location of this hotel is simply excellent! Right next to the famous Maxwell food market, where u can get some of Singapore's best Hainan chicken rice and laska. The location in Chinatown is alsop very ideal too, just a short walk to the MRT station, and also quite near the Ang Siang Hill where all the trendy night spots are.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: MRGLondon
Reviews.Content: i have just spent 3 nights at The Scarlet as i was in between apartments and it has been a massive disappointment. i left the hotel early in the morning both days (by 9 am) only to find that by the time i got back to the hotel (4 and 5pm) my room hadn't been cleaned, the room next door to mine had a dirty tray of room service sitting outside for nearly 24 hours and it only got picked up because i mentioned it to the front desk. The rooms are tiny, and the furniture is far too big for such a small space which means you can barely move around, the room hadnt been properly cleaned for a while judging by the layer of dust on the windowsill . After reading some of the reviews i do however consider myself lucky to have managed to get a room with a window, even if the noise from a nearby cliub made it impossible to sleep on Friday and Saturday nights. A complete waste of money and effort..

Reviews.Title: “This is my new base hotel for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: alessiman
Reviews.Content: I come to Singapore 4-5 times a year for work and previously would stay near or around Bugis Junction as most of my business was done nearby at Suntec Towers. I only stumbled onto this hotel in 2008 when most of Singapore was booked out and this was one of the few hotels that still had rooms left (albeit expensive rooms on that particular trip) so this was where I headed Things didn't exactly go well the 1st trip. A late night checkin of around 10:30pm was compounded by a staff member checking me into an already occupied room. It was not a pleasant experience for neither she nor I when I walked in with the rooms occupant in a state of undress. Anyway after that drama everything else during my subsequent stays have been just fine The good: - Free High Speed internet is a big bonus. Other hotels in Singapore charge upwards of $30 a night so count this inclusion into the rate. As a business traveler this is brilliant - Beds are super comfortable. - Rooms are spotless - Maxwell Food Centre is directly across the road. The famous chicken rice shop ($3) is located in the food court. - The fixed price lunch (3 courses) is a bargain! Especially considering that a buffet breakfast is $28 and this is not much more - Concierge are exceptional - Close to 2 MTR stations and Chinatown - 7/11 is 50 metres away for drinks are snacks The Bad: - I am not a big fan of the 2nd wakeup call, yes I know why they do it but its always at the worse time (loo or shower) - The standard rooms are small, but adequate. Get premium or higher if you want some space - Desk Chairs are uncomfortable for long periods. As a business traveller I would prefer an ergonomic chair not a a luxe furniture piece - Some rooms are very far away from front desk - A/C is loud. but I'm a heavy sleeper so not a big deal for me Overall this is my new favorite hotel in Singapore. As a business traveller it has everything you need. As a Leisure Traveller I would book here with no hesitation

Reviews.Title: “In surprisingly good nick”
Reviews.Author: TheQueenslander
Reviews.Content: In 2005, we were brought by a local to have a drink at their bar, Bold. At that time, it was THE new, hip place to check out in Chinatown and its striking luxe decor was unexpected, considering the original Chinese shopfront architecture. Fast forward five years and now looking for a different area to stay in Singapore, we found ourselves taking a punt on the Scarlet. Thanks to the previous reviewers, we avoided booking small rooms without windows. Opting instead for an Executive with balcony, we found ourselves upgraded to a Premium room on arrival. Thanks to a previous poor experience reported by a reviewer here, we emailed to confirm our online booking had been received and had no problems on check-in. Mind you, our check-in was mid-day, not midnight as our previous poor unfortunate. Judging from the fire escape floor plans, this Premium room has more space than many of the surrounding rooms and we found it adequate, with a small balcony overlooking a roofline, just enough space around the King bed to walk around, a desk area with 2 chairs and an adequate wardrobe. Our bathroom was marble tiled and had a shower, bath and frosted glass door. Considering how timber furniture usually wears, these lush furnishings were in surprisingly good nick. The velvet on the main desk seat was worn but everything else was well maintained. The entertainment cupboard contained a DVD unit, which had a Scarlet-branded Chillout CD in it ready to play and an iPod dock that charged, but didn't appear connected to sound despite some remote fiddling. The door staff, front desk and concierge were attentive and friendly. The hotel only has a cold outdoor jacuzzi/spa but that was a nice enough nook if you wanted to cool off. The gym is functional for a stretch, has a limited multi-function weights machine and a treadmill. As the hotel comprises several previous shop buildings going down a slope, we found our corridor heading downhill a long way before we got to the room, but the hike up and down the corridor helped burn off the Singapore noodles from the Maxwell food centre located across a car park, next door. This food centre serves pretty good local offerings from the extremely popular chicken rice to reasonable fried oyster pancake and radish cake. Chinatown nightlife and more traditional eateries are close by, as is Club street, lined with evening restaurants and bars. Not much shopping nearby but taxis to those areas are easy. The hotel is hardly conventional - there are plenty of tiny rooms as warned in previous reviews, it's stuck in Chinatown and definitely not your usual international luxury chain offering. It is however, well furnished and funky for a small space, close to good local food, a short walk to more alternative nightlife and shows you a side of Singapore that is not Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the coolest place I have ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: larryvan
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Singapore and I spend 2 weeks traveling between three hotels. First of all, Singapore is not a cheap place. A normal room costs $100. I stayed at Robertson Quay and would never go back. The Scarlett Hotel was the same price and SUCH a difference. The people were so friendly and helpful. They let me check in early and gave me a free upgrate to an executive room bc they were overbooked. The room was so clean and cozy, I literally spent the first day in the hotel room! The internet was free in the rooms (most other places charge $30-40 per day). It was a great location in Chinatown and you really got an authentic feel for Singapore. You could walk easily to attractions or take a very cheap taxi. I couldn't decide between staying in the city or going to Sentosa so I did a few days in each. I'm not a city person, so I thought I would like to be near the beach, but I MUCH prefered being in the city. I moved from the Scarlett to the Amara Resort, which was double the price, but I would have gone back to the Scarlett if I could. The Scarlett has this hip cool feel to it. There is a small gym, a jacuzzi (which is actually cold, so go in the day!), and I nice place to eat on the roof. I didn't know what to expect bc their website it pretty weird, but it is the coolest place I have ever stayed!

Reviews.Title: “Sassy Scarlet”
Reviews.Author: leatours
Reviews.Content: We chose the Scarlet Hotel as we wanted an alternative to the large soulless American Chain Hotels that are everywhere in Singapore, and it proved to be a great choice. Located in the heart of Chinatown you are immersed into the culture of Singapore as it existed prior to the dominance of the retail culture exemplified by the huge number of large shopping malls located everywhere in the City State. We had organised Hotel / Airport car transfers through the Scarlet for a very reasonable S$60 each way and were pleasantly surprised to be collected by an S Class Mercedes complete with chilled hand towels and bottled water. This exemplified the level of service offered throughout our stay which was excellent. We had booked a theme suite, and the Swank Suite was decorated in very dark opulent fabrics as expected. As other reviewers have commented, the rooms are small, and even in this suite there was no extra space to store our suitcases. The funky decor and vibe of the Hotel compensated for this however, and we enjoyed a very comfortable 4 night stay. The Scarlet is in the middle of a Culinary Oasis, offering everything from traditional Hawkers stalls one block away at the Maxwell Food Centre (open from late morning onwards), numerous stalls and small restaurants across the road in Smith Street (mostly lunch trade onwards), the basement fresh food markets just behind the Buddhist temple on Sago lane at the end of the street, more western oriented bars, clubs and restaurants around the corner in Club Street. And that’s without even considering the excellent bar and two restaurants within the Scarlett itself, or the other quality restaurants contained in similar converted shop-house boutique Hotels such as 1929 and the New Majestic within easy walking distance. For authentic Chinese cuisine we breakfasted every morning on Yum Cha at Tak Po in Smith Street, fast friendly service with picture menus clearly identifying the food and price, a very cheap meal. We also tried a noodle restaurant Lan Zhou La Mian (19 Smith Street), renown as much for the showy hand noodle making display as for the cheap and tasty food. A small trap to be aware of, bowls of nuts or other condiments such as refresher towels served to you after you are seated are charged to your bill, so refuse them if you don’t want them, although the cost is generally insignificant. For a more upmarket alternative Asian meal, Blue Ginger Restaurant (97 Tanjong Pagar Road) specialises in Peranakan cuisine, a mix of Chinese and Malay influences. We dined at Desire, The Scarlet’s ground level fine dining restaurant, for lunch on the day of our arrival. The food was excellent, and the service good, although the French Maitre d’ came across as typically arrogant and self important, which spoilt the ambience somewhat. We didn’t get to experience Breeze, the rooftop eatery (open only in the evenings) due to the intermittent monsoon rains. Bold, the lobby bar offered a good selection of cocktails, and a fabulously eccentric selection of high backed lounge chairs suited perfectly to the Scarlet’s style. Chinatown is also a cultural haven with numerous temples and shrines reflecting the rich cultural mix of Singapore. The Chinatown Cultural Museum is worth visiting to gain an appreciation for the hardships faced by many of the early migrants who settled in Singapore and contributed to its prosperity.

Reviews.Title: “good boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Singazulu
Reviews.Content: Not all the rooms are nice. Don`t let you frame with one of the tiny rooms or the ones with skylight !!!and no windows. The hotel is well run by a good manager, when he is not there,one notices it as it turns kwickly to desaster. Breackfast is a rape at $ 28 + vat + service, for froozen pastry and a dull buffet.

Reviews.Title: “just fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Pirrot27
Reviews.Content: small unique boutique hotel with splendid rooftop restaurant&bar , outstanding service and nice cosy rooms...additionally great located in restyled china town

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveler2000
Reviews.Content: This is being sold as a boutique property and meets most expectations. The bar and the overall look is pretty edgy. The service was prompt and efficient. Front desk was keen to assist us in planning our day out. Neat clean interiors fitted with most commonly expected amenities including a DVD player. They also have a set of DVDs available which you can rent for free. The only issue being the room size. Though comfortable ... its small. Do not plan if you are traveling with your family (2+). It’s a bit cramped. It is located in Chinatown area. Well located and connected (but then nothing's really far in Singapore). Food court and Chinese eating joints are very close by. China town market is v good for bargian hunters.

Reviews.Title: “Easy and Breezy”
Reviews.Author: buddhamind
Reviews.Content: I booked the Executive Room online and received a room on the second floor almost towards the end of the hotel. OK, a long walk, but I guess I could have asked for one closer. No big deal. The picture from online showed an Executive room with a balcony, or large window. Ours did not have this, only two small windows, so the room appeared a bit dark, as it looked out over a tiled rooftop. No problem for us, since we were sleeping alot and not in the room much. I also kinda like the feel of an enclosed room. Call me crazy, but it feels like a den, all comfy cozy for the Lion. Anyway, the best part about this room was the bed. OH MY GOSH, it was so comfortable. I can't tell you exactly what it was, but it was soft, the cover was light but warm, and the abundant pillows made me want to hibernate. The Lion theme again? The bathroom was also excellent, with a large shower and all the amenities. It looked cool too. The only downside, for me, was that the sliding door to the bathroom had a frosted glass panel in it. And not that you could see anything clearly, you could definitely see the outline of your partner going to the restroom. I like a bit more privacy than that. I assume that other rooms have this door as well, but maybe it is pointed another way and not towards the bed. The staff seemed friendly and helpful, and then ofcourse, as everyone says, the place looks really good. The only other downside for me was the seating in the lobby area. And though it looks cool, it's not the type of furniture you want to sit for a few hours and read, hangout, etc. But such is the look. Didn't try the food and room service, but had a drink on the roof at a place called Breeze. It was very lovely, though expensive. But what hotel is not expensive in these countries? We ate at the Maxwell Hawker Center across the street. Amazing. We were close to so many things and not bored in the least. Great location. All and all, an easy breezy time. But you'll pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints!”
Reviews.Author: Chicagojo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was exactly what I expected. A small, but very stylish and clean room. Good service and a good location. I have no complaints and am happy I stayed here. Thought the bedding was comfortable. Good access to two MRT stations and right across from the fun Maxwell Street Hawker Center.

Reviews.Title: “Great Looks, but thats as far as it goes...”
Reviews.Author: Nabeel_S
Reviews.Content: Best described by a previous reviewer as "really want to love this hotel, but just can't" and I would echo the sentiment. On the facade it's a sleek, sexy looking hotel, with bundles of character on the exterior, funky lobby, and some very quirky touches. The deep reds, blacks and gold give a very ornate true boutique feel, which is lightly transferred to the bedrooms. The rooms are small...expect it. If you reckon you'll be lucky enough to get a good sized room, forget about it. We had the Premier Executive and the Executive on our two visits, and they were both pretty small. Anything more than two suitcases and a hand luggage and you will be climbing over the suitcases to get around. The rooms are tastefully decorated, with average mod cons. The bed however is as good as the concrete on the side road below the balcony - possibly the hardest bed I've ever slept on, but if it takes your fancy, you're in luck. The bathrooms are very nicely decorated, however only had a bathtub in the Premier Executive Room, and the sliding door is somewhat see-through. Be wary : Some of the rooms do not have a window, but only a skylight. We were lucky enough to get a balcony on both occasions. The staff are generally ok, however we were unfortunate to have what seemed to be a new starter, who couldn't find our room at 11.30pm. The breakfast selection is average however with the Maxwell food centre opposite the hotel it may well be worth sacrificing the hotel breakfast for a roti canai ! Overall good location in Chinatown, a clean and unique hotel - just dont expect a comfortable room is you are taller than 5ft 5"

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Parky14
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in November 09. We had booked a deluxe room. The member of staff who took us/suitcases to our room pre-warned us that having a deluxe room meant you had a window, but the down-side was the room was small - he wasn't wrong!! It is the smallest room I have ever stayed in, however, it was decorated to a very high standard with a lovely bathroom. The hotel itself is full of charachter and if you are looking for something a little bit different, this is it. It is described as a boutique hotel and you can see why. The decor is lovely and attention to detail is extraordinary. The breakfasts were lovely and it was a very nice atmosphere in the restaurant. Although it is a help yourself buffet breakfast, it is as far away from 'canteen buffet-style breakfast' as you can get.
