Throughout the hotel there is piped relaxing music and the whole place makes you feel totally chilled out. The staff are excellent and they will re-confirm your flights by online check-in and printing out your boarding cards for you. The roof-top bar has a lovely atmosphere, but the restaurant was quite pricey for the quality of the food. The location of this hotel is great - 5 mins walk from the MRT and right near china town and not too far from Clarke Quay. All in all it was a lovely classy hotel and I would certainly stop here again if I ever returned to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel in Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: Foodtrail
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in Chinatown. Really over the top. A bit pricey for its class. Be careful with the standard room. I booked and paid for a standard over the internet. But when I checked in and saw the room - I was quite surprise - there is no natural lighting - no window. For a claustrophobic person - this room is not a good idea. I asked to change, which the reception was most helpful and gave me an executive room, which I have to pay a bit extra. I checked into the new room and was very happy to see that there is a window and balcony. It is a beautiful room. What I didn't know was it was directly across from a multi storey car park! It was very noisy late at night with cars driving down the carpark. Other than the noisy carpark late at night - the room is exquisite and staff professional. The location is great too - across from Maxwell Food Court. It is also within walking distance to Chinatown MRT. When I check out in the morning, the hotel delivered a complimentary cup of hot tea to my room! I would recommend this hotel if someone is looking for an alternative away from the main tourist areas, like Orchard Road or Clarke Quay. But, be prepared to pay a bit extra for the style and boutique quality of of the place.

Reviews.Title: “fab boutique hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: sweetytours
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Scarlet for 3 nights and just loved it ! The staff were very smart, welcoming, helpful & even paid our taxi fare when we arrived as we had no change ! The hotel has a very nice ambiance and very individual compared to chain hotels The room ..as mentioned in other reviews was lacking windows (only skylights) but the room was elegantly furnished and extremley spacious and comfortable. The hotel is a easy 10-15 minute walk to the river front area, the hotel is on the edge of china town - with quite a few bars/cafe's & restauarants very close by, the hotel has a great roof top bar and terrace serving snacks late at night. We would not hesitate staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Has the X factor”
Reviews.Author: jambo38
Reviews.Content: A superb and quirky hotel, bigger than I expected. The reception area was so opulent and cozy. The chap who checked us in was incredible, we were staying one night and had an early start in the morning, he arranged for us to have breakfast at 6am instead of the usual 7am start, he also advised us that the trains to the airport would not run at that time and said that they could arrange a taxi for us...at least we did not waste our time walking to the station to find that we couldnt get a train. The receptionist in the evening even helped us check in for our flight and print off our boarding cards..excellent customer service. She also advised that prebooking a taxi would be more expensive than just calling for one in the morning of departure - which the morning receptionist did for us without any bother. We had an executive room number 215, it had a window and the room was fairly roomy. People mention that the rooms are small but this one was fine. Beautifully decorated, lots of little extras to make the stay perfect. The room had a room safe, umbrella, slippers, drinking water, tv. The bathroom had lovely toiletries, hairdryer, even a loofah...the only thing missing was hand towels, we had bath towels but no hand towels which seemed strange. The drinks in the bar were expensive but there is a 7/11 shop down the road if you wanted to take them back to your room instead... On the whole a fabulous hotel, great location by chinatown and excellent helpful staff...would definately stay here again, wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel, great location with rooftop cocktail bar”
Reviews.Author: CarolineBaker74
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in great location, we loved our room, even though we booked one without a window. It was really funky, a boutique hotel. Fab rooftop bar where you can enjoy a cocktail or food. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel - one of a kind”
Reviews.Author: mfs1011
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of high rise corporate boxes you can stay in or you can try to stay somewhere more unique: Raffles, the Fullerton and you can add the Scarlet to that list of distinctive hotels that offer something special. The Scarlet has an added attraction compared to Raffles or the Fullerton - its affordable, has style without being pretentious and provides impeccable service. So what's the downside? Well the location could be better and yes, the rooms are a tad small. But if you are looking for something special on a budget or off the expense account the Scarlet should be top of your list.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjbsteven
Reviews.Content: The Scarlet is a nice small hotel with good service and in a good location. We had an executive room with a window, however, the room is small and not well suited for a stay over 2 to 3 days (or with more than 1 to 2 adults). The hotel is very close to food street in China town and the subway is not far away. Our room had a stale smell from the carpet and we felt the cleaning could improve. Our room whilst good was starting to show the signs of wear. We were on the 3rd floor and there was some traffic noise which was a little sleep disturbing.

Reviews.Title: “glam and fun”
Reviews.Author: CambodiaGina
Reviews.Content: Very cute, glamerous lobby and bar areas, lovely room furnishings and nice touches, and great location at heart of Chinatown. Beautiful old building that's been done up extremely well. Staff accomodating and rooftop bar a lovely spot. The only negative is the standard room (no window) is small - but it's fine for a one night stay. Longer than that may require upgrading to a larger room. Would definitely recommend, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Amesx
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, just 2 minutes walk away from the buzz of Smith St (food street) & Sago St (night market) so that you get some quiet but still just next to the heart of Chinatown. Just across the hotel is the Maxwell foodcourt where locals have their meals. Lots of choices. We stayed in the standard room, which was just basic but enough for our needs. Everything was clean and lovely. The over-the-top quirkiness of the hotel lives up to the website branding it portrayed. We loved it. Staff was very friendly. We initially wanted to stay in 1929 but was fully booked. It was a blessing in disguise. We checked it out and wasn't as nice or as cozy as The Scarlet. Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, fun and friendly”
Reviews.Author: paulosussex
Reviews.Content: Just enjoyed a very nice stay at the Scarlet, very welcoming reception, good room, perhaps a bit on the small side, but comfortable with good bathroom amenities and very comfortable bed. Small raised work area a nice touch and easy and fast internet access. Location is great, just around the corner from bar st and close by Maxwell food court and Chinatown means you never go hungry. Roof-top bar is a fun place to have a few drinks and the restaurant is very good. It's really nice to stay in a heritage building and the conversion has been done very well. Some of the corridors are a bit tight for space and some of the rooms are a fair walk from reception, so make it know if you have any mobility issues. I booked direct with the hotel which was easy and I got a good rate and check in was quick and effecient. I will definately return to the Scarlet as I prefer smaller intimate hotels to larger corporate places Restaurant Tip : Maxwell food court, right on the doorstep, has some great local food and is very cheap

Reviews.Title: “funky and trendy in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Peewee74
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. We were mindful of comments left that some of the rooms had no windows. We were given a room with skylight in the room and in the loo. The room was elegantly furnished with lots of lovely touches - umbrellas, robes, slippers. On check in were given a complimentary cold drink (much appreciated as so hot outside) and a tray of chocolate dipped fruit! We went to roof bar for a cocktail which was lovely and relaxing. Also had breakfast each morning - perfect range available. All staff made you feel very welcome. Ideal location in China Town and for MTR Singapore itself was great although too hot for us! Lots of shopping malls if that is your thing. Went to sentosa where the highlight was the luge and the dip in the pool at Cafe del Mar. Also the Zoo and the night safari is a must see. A very clean city indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Best choice in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: kathywestmids
Reviews.Content: A fabulous, quirky hotel in the best location. Smallest hotel room we have ever stayed in and next time will definitley pay to up-grade to a bigger room. However, the quality and location more than compensate. Would much rather stay here than the big, souless Orchard Road hotels (where we made the mistake of staying on our way back through Singapore). A few minutes walk to heart of Chinatown with night market and Smith Street food stalls. Also, opposite the Maxwell Road hawker centre - best place to eat in whole of Singapore for cheap, good quality, fresh food and spotlessly clean. Rooftop bar is a must for pre and post dinner drinks. A great start to our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: PQ1
Reviews.Content: Great location for Chinatown and getting around. Room was fine, very small considering but typical of a boutique inner city hotel. No window which was a little odd but not there to sit in a room! Staff were professional and helpful, really enjoyed rooftop bar area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully designed, chic and sexy!”
Reviews.Author: LucyDiamonda
Reviews.Content: Smacked in the middle of Singapore's historical area, near Chinatown, a row of old shophouses are restored and cleverly transformed into a swanky boutique hotel. Stepping into the lobby and reception area, it is hard not to notice the use of rich colours, & bold mix of textures & materials. From the velvety lounge chairs with lavish upholstery, fancy wallpaper and elaborate chandeliers, The Scarlet spells OPULENCE. Everything is carefully chosen to seduce our senses. It's warm and dim ambient light creates a sensual and mysterious atmosphere, making The Scarlet ultra-sexy. The same luxurious feel is extended to the bedroom which features a sloping roof. My Deluxe room has a big comfortable double bed, dark wood wardrobe, big sturdy writing table complete with a high back chair. But what I loved most is the small double doors that open up to the balcony. The balcony offers a view unique to Singapore – the back view of a row of old shophouses with spiral staircases that forms an interesting arrangement. The hotel has 5 suites, each uniquely designed to carry a different personality, namely, Splendour, Passion, Opulent, Lavish and Swank. It also offers facilities like a Jacuzzi named Soda, a Gym named Flaunt, a bar named Bold, and restaurants named Desire and Breeze. Breeze is an alfresco dining area on the rooftop, perfect for an evening of chilling under the stars with the paranamic view of Chinatown spread below you. The scarlet is also the perfect place to stay if you want to get lost in the trendy old streets of Club Street and And Siang Hill. A stone's throw away is Maxwell Food Centre, which is a Singapore food galore. For photos, click http://www.lucia-haven.blogspot.com/

Reviews.Title: “No value & disappointing experience.”
Reviews.Author: chezong
Reviews.Content: Upon checking out, I stood in front of the concierge with my suitcase for a full 5 minutes waiting for him to get off the phone & help me find a taxi to airport but he did not acknowledge me nor make any indication to help despite seeing me standing there. I had to resort to going outside & hailing my own taxi. I then proceeded to carry my suitcase outside to the taxi. The concierge continued to ignore me. I wld say this is unacceptable for any hotel. I perceived no value for the high room rate charged for the very small room given, and a real lack of any kind of service to look after their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: masingha
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Scarlet for in June, while a nice looking hotel as you walk in, however all is lost when you walk into your room...i was extremley dissappionted with the size and the decor. The rooms are not as nicely designed as the reception. Planned to stay here for 3 nights but moved to another hotel for 1 night. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The only reason i would not reccomend this hotel is because of the size of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic find”
Reviews.Author: orrj020
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights as part of an extended layover on way back to UK from NZ. The hotel is in a great location right next to all the amenities of Chinatown but up a quiet side street so rooms are quiet and no bustle. Hotel is boutique-esque, small and quirky and the interior design is unusual with a red and black theme, could be very romantic choice for couples. Rooms are not huge but are nicely decorated, very modern and clean with all the amenities you need, lovely bathrooms, minibar, air conditioning etc. Make sure you book one with a window though as there are rooms on the ground floor without. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the service was impeccable. The restaurant does great food if a little pricey. Both bars are nice especially the rooftop one although service there can be a little slow. The rooms were amazingly cheap given the five star standards here and the location is much nicer than any of the big hotels on Orchard Rd. I loved my stay here and would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Excellent Hotel - Great Service, Great Decor, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ComoxValleyGirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at The Scarlet Hotel in Singapore. This is a boutique hotel set in Singapore's Chinatown. We could not fault this hotel. Absolutely excellent service - the staff were very friendly and went over and above to make our stay memorable. The hotel is very tastefully decorated in a chic boutique hotel style which although hip is very warm and inviting. Our room had high beamed ceilings and a very comfortable and cosy feel. The shower was perfect - tons of pressure and no shortage of water. We did not try the food in the hotel as the Scarlet is located close to an Asian food centre and a myriad of food stalls just across the street on Smith Street. Here we found authentic Asian dishes which were of course much cheaper than eating in the hotel itself. However, the lounge on the roof terrace looked great and would be perfect for sundowners.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service EVER!”
Reviews.Author: UkTravellerb
Reviews.Content: What fabulous staff at this wonderful hotel. Nothing was too much trouble, we stayed overnight on route to Sydney and left a mobile phone in the room. The staff saved it for us in their safe for 4 weeks until our return journey. There was always a genuine greeting from all the staff when we got back to the hotel from our days out. The reception staff, porters and bar staff were so helpful, we were sorry to leave. The rooms are small, but the decor is lovely and the breakfast was very tasty. I have stayed in Hotels all over the world and the service in this one was head and shoulders above any where else. Thank you for a lovely stay - we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with its restrictions”
Reviews.Author: warren_tw
Reviews.Content: The Scarlet first came to my attention because of its beautiful décor. The façade, entrance and lobby all look extremely stylish, and the color palette (red and black) just adds a sense of nostalgia and elegance to it. My room is also classically styled. You really have nothing to complain but its size. Apart from physical layouts, it is also worth mentioning that the staff there provide good services. It is so obvious that they want to make everything right for you, and that kind of attitude makes all the difference. One example I can share is that I had to check out early due to my flight. And before I even asked, the Receptionist found out which terminal I should head to already. I found that very thoughtful and useful. Now, move on to the not so positive side. Like what I said earlier, it is true that the rooms are not spacious. And it is not guaranteed that there will be a window in your room, which makes it somewhat claustrophobic. The air-con can be VERY loud sometimes. I consider myself very easy to fall asleep, but even I found the noise quite disturbing. When I visited Soda, (the alias for their jacuzzi, I love they give names to their facilities) I was shocked that there were no clean towels around. It is fair to say that this hotel has some charming traits as well as minor flaws. However, with its reasonable tariff, I still think it is a good choice for people who plan on visiting Chinatown with a reasonable budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not your average hotel”
Reviews.Author: dazandlucy
Reviews.Content: The Scarlet is in a great location just across the road from Chinatown and about 5 mins walk to the station. The hotel staff were welcoming, very helpful and were keen for us to enjoy our stay. The service isn't the same as you get in the big hotels and that helps make the Scarlet that bit different. The rooms are small and as per a previous post we requested a room with a window and were not disappointed as the small window let in an enormous amount of daylight. The late checkout (2 pm) was perfect with our evening flight and prior to heading to the airport were able to freshen up at the hotel with the use of a shower room, which after a day walking around Singapore is very nice!. The surrounding area with Chinatown and the narrow streets (Club St) with great bars, restaurants and shops is the perfect antidote to the shiny efficiency of the MTR and downtown Singapore. With a downstairs bar and roof top open air bar, the Scarlet will not be to everyone’s liking, but if you want something different rather than the formulaic big hotel chains, would recommend giving the Scarlet a go.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent romantic getaway hotel!”
Reviews.Author: johno.franklin
Reviews.Content: We booked the Scarlett based on tripadvisor reviews and a special offer the hotel was giving for our dates of travel. We stayed for a single night, as part of a two-day city trip in Singapore. The hotel's location is excellent, right in the heart of chinatown, within 5 minutes walk of MRT stations, close to the bus, and next door to an excellent food court with loads of hawker food stalls. The hotel itself is built within a row of old peranankan style townhouses, giving an amazing look on the outside, aswell as a quirky yet beautifully dressed up corrider inside. It gave an amazing feeling of staying in something of the Raffles hotel, with a seductive twist. Reception was very helpful with our check-in, and we were in our room no more than 2 minutes later. The rooms are a little on the small side, yet the hotel has used the space very smartly, meaning you have all the typical 4-star amenities plus some tucked away smartly. The dressing and style of the room is just as the name suggests - very burlesque with loads of deep velvets and reds, but all very very stylishly. There's plenty of space to get rid of your stuff, and the bathroom is of a good size also. The hotel goes out of it's way to tick the boxes here too - our room was also decked out with complimentary fruit flavoured sparkling water, and a bowl of dried tropical fruit slices. The toiletries in the bathroom are very extensively stocked and should fulfill most of your needs. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel the next morning, as we were kicking to go out and get a morning bowl of noodle soup (nothing better than a breakfast of champions) from the foodcourt next door, but we did see the spread and it looked very well stocked with many items available a-la-carte to ensure freshness. Checkout was also very easy, and the reception was kind enough to take care of our bags for a few hours. They also helped print out our departure boarding cards as we had left ours home by accident. All in all the hotel is spectacular. The staff are very friendly, the place is very clean, and the location is fantastic. If you want to stay someplace in Singapore, this is the place. Ideal for city breaks with your loved one.

Reviews.Title: “Waste of money, tiny room next to noisy street, small hotel”
Reviews.Author: god4aday
Reviews.Content: Arrived as honeymoon couple after trailfinders recommended them as one of the best 5* hotels in Singapore. Wasnt allowed into room until 10am even though they knew our arrival time. Hotel was small and located near Chinatown. Hotel on side road that motorists use as short cut and was noisy all through day and night. Paid £200 for single night for Honeymoon couple. Extremely unhappy with size of room and location looking over side road. No double glazed windows. Would compare hotel to a 3* in UK.

Reviews.Title: “Scarlet Hotel - Business Related Trip Three days in May 2009”
Reviews.Author: Sullykerry
Reviews.Content: My company had booked me into the Scarlet Hotel as it is close to our offices and offered a very good promotional rate of Sing dollar 175 per night (USD 121.5) excluding taxes (GST and 10% service charge). I had read the earlier reviews posted on Trip Advisor and was frankly concerned about the earlier reviewer who did not like the hotel. I e-mailed the hotel ahead to prepare them for an early arrival (1000hrs - local time) and to request a room with a window. Be aware that the three hotels I checked out have a 1400 hrs check-in time and will charge you extra if you check-in earlier than that. The Scarlet Hotel is an exception. Perhaps it was so because I e-mailed them ahead of time. BTW, all my e-mails were answered promptly. I have to admit little put off upon entering the hotel. It is small and a bit quirky. I thought the scarlet (red upholstery and walls) was a bit garish. It rather reminded me of a Japanese "love" hotel. You just have to get used to it if you are traveling on business and don't have anything other than business in mind. The staff reception is top quality unlike the experience another reviewer wrote. (Perhaps the management read the review and made changes!) I was immediately checked and taken to my room on the second floor. Certain floors have rather "too cute" names, again reminding you that this hotel is best suited for couples. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL FOR FAMILIES. My room was small yet suitable. I have stayed in hotels throughout Asia and this one had all the amenities. The room and bathroom facilities were very clean. In order to add to the ambiance, the hotel has a CD of romantic music left by your bedside. I took this all in stride. What was my company thinking??? I did not have breakfast or any other meal at the hotel. For breakfast, walk out the main entrance turn left, walk up the hill a little ways to the cross-road and then turn left again for the Maxwell Road Food Gallery. Join the locals for breakfast. If you like fruit and fruit juices made with soy milk (does not taste bland at all) you have found your spot. Be aware that the food gallery is an outside covered area with no A/C. The food is great and cheap. I think I got out ever morning with spending less than Sing dollar 10! The hotel has a very small gym. It is not particularly well lighted. You have to turn on the A/C in order to get air flowing. It can be a bit difficult at first. There is a small "hot-tube" type pool between the second and third floor. I think it is there purely for show and that romantic interlude. On the roof there is a bar. The bar overlooks the Financial District. At night the view is excellent. It also seems to be a gathering place for the ex-pat community. There were a two groups of women the night I was there. One was a book club group and the other was a farewell party. It is quiet up there unlike the bars on the Quay. Again, it is the perfect place for a quiet conversation or a romantic interlude. This hotel is very suitable for the young or even middle age couple visiting Singapore for a romantic time. There are not many places for romance in Singapore. Most people I ecountered are coming from China (shopping), Britain, OZ and the U.S. (for business). Be aware that Singapore is hot and humid. Subways are very efficient. The variety of food is excellent. The hotel is within the confines of Chinatown. Several taxi cab drivers I used did not know the hotel. However if you ask to go to Chinatown and then Erskine Road you can easily direct them. All in all, I would go back to the hotel but not on business!

Reviews.Title: “Well located and great service”
Reviews.Author: whenwecan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only one night but in that time received some very attentive and friendly service. Nothing was too much trouble and everyone was very friendly. The room was well appointed but small and as we had a window, it was very light. We didn't have breakfast as I thought $28 each was much too expensive. The hotel does seem overpriced for the room but the location would be hard to beat. The internet was very fast (cable not wireless). They minded our luggage in the afternoon and offered us a room for a shower etc as we had a late flight. The room (unlike other hotels that offer this) was the shower up at the outside pool (which is a small jacuzzi size pool) which meant there was nowhere to put anything and it was hot because it was outside. My husband didn't bother and had a shower at the airport instead. Nice idea to offer but not very practical. Had a great stay and would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: iheartbangkok
Reviews.Content: The Scarlet is a fantastic small hotel. We booked an executive room through Expedia and asked for a room on the second floor to guarantee a window as apparently some rooms dont.The staff were friendly, the rooms clean and the toiletries options were endless. There is an outdoor jacuzzi pool on one floor which was big enough to cool down after a hard day shopping.The restaurant upstairs had a superb view over Singapore, but the food had a European influence and we wanted the local fare. The bar downstairs was very comfortable and 'cool'. The cocktails were a bit expensive for the quality, but we still managed to sip a few during happy hour.... :-) The location for us couldnt have been better and it was directly across the road from one of the best hawker centres in Singapore.(Queue up with the locals for the chicken rice from Tian Tian stall....) It was also a 4 minute walk to the touristy shopping streets of Chinatown with again more food and great buildings. There is a seven eleven underneath so you can buy anything from shoelaces to instant mashed potato should you need it....We liked it so much we booked it a second time on the way home..

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveller5
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that I really wanted to like but just didn't. I had been to the bar before on a previous visit and liked the look of the hotel so I was excited when we got a reasonably priced room (206 SGD). The staff were good and very friendly which was great but the whole hotel is looking very dated and worn. The room was crowded and small, though we did have a window. The bathroom is in need of regrouting and repairs but it was clean. The bathroom door is glass so all the light from outside comes in to the bathroom and then into your room. If you are jetlagged this is not good. Also because the room is small the noise from the corridor comes through easily. The whole hotel is very dark and gloomy. I think if my room had been full price then I would have been really annoyed. We won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small Elegance at a Price Discrepancy?”
Reviews.Author: 626resident
Reviews.Content: My initial interaction with the hotel staff was exasperating. I tried to book this hotel while in Bali but the internet connection was slow. So I did a walk in and the hotel staff gave me a different rate than the posted internet price while insisting it was the same price as the one I saw on the internet. I informed them their price was 8 or 9 percent higher than the listed internet price. They insistently responded both prices were the same. I asked them which price would I pay and why do you have two different sets of prices for the same room. The hotel staff responded, by saying their price includes the hotel exchange rate applied to the bank the internet price does not include exchange fee. I told them, "I'm not paying cash so why would you quote me the cash rate in the first place? Don't most customers pay by credit card as well? Then why would you quote me a higher price when most likely I am paying by credit card. You should ask the customer if they plan on paying by cash or credit and then quote them the correct price based on their payment method, not automatically quoting the hotel exchange rate price." They simply responded with a muddled look. I asked to speak to the manager and even he didn't understand their faulty logic pricing. Nonetheless it was too late and I was too tired from Bali to go to another hotel. The rooms were well appointed. Furniture and bedding appeared to be of high quality. The bed offered support and comfort. Crisp, clean sheets with a high thread count kept me warm at night with the AC on blast. Outside of the initial frustration with the hotel pricing, the hotel staff provided accurate and helpful information to a tourist who had left his Singapore itinerary at home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lovely hotel; need more windows and sunshine though”
Reviews.Author: Brianchen
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this nice hotel for more than 4 days in Dec, 2008 Everything is perfect except very few rooms with windows are available. For people need sunshine through the window, you cannot come to this hotel Staff are great, Christina is very friendly and helpful; Breakfast is wonderful; location is OK, Maxwell foodcourt is around, rapid transit system need to go for 10 min to get to. Kind in the center of attractions I will come to this hotel again, if i can get a room with window and sunshine

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful....”
Reviews.Author: exhaustednurse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Scarlet for 3 nights at the start of our honeymoon. We could not fault the service we recieved from the staff at all times. The rooms are on the small side, but they are beautifully designed and for 3 nights or so, the space is fine. The breakfast is wonderful, again with excellent service but also with superb food, with nice touches as some laska, and dim sum served on the side. The rooftop bar is a lovely little oasis, the drinks are pricey, but then this is true of the majority of Singapore, however they did have a happy hour period too. All in all a excellent hotel, great location, personable service and and the most wonderful air conditioned reception area!!

Reviews.Title: “nice boutique hotel, small rooms though”
Reviews.Author: fsba20
Reviews.Content: In a great location in Chinatown. Nice and quiet too. the rooms were lovely but small, so if you have lots of luggage beware there is not a lot of room to put your stuff. We loved it here, breakfast was interesting! A bit too fussy for us but still good food.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend The Scarlet Hotel, Singapore”
Reviews.Author: SJBrownUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Scarlet Hotel in Singapore for 3 days on our way to Australia & 1 day on way back. Bliss after a 13 hour flight from the UK. Staff very friendly & went out of their way to make us feel comfortable - including having our room ready at 8am in the morning. Rooms superb, bed comfortable & room immaculate cleanliness with all the freebie toileteries. Don't forget to have a drink (or dinner if you are feeling extravagant!) on the roof top of the hotel - what a view! Try the Maxwell Hawkers centre just opposite the hotel for brilliant local food. Chinatown a few mins walk away. The MRT (tube train) just around the corner so very convenient for getting about. Local buses quick, cheap & bus drivers happy to let you know where your stop is. One pointer - taxi drivers don't seem to know the Scarlet Hotel that well, so have the address to hand when you hail a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and very memorable stay, loved The Scarlet!”
Reviews.Author: trevostar
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a few hotels in Singapore, and this is by far my favourite one! In a city full of formulaic chain hotels and not-so-great little independent hotels, The Scarlet is the perfect balance of boutique, character, sensuality and plushness. It is small but opulent, sexy but classy, trendy but warm, lavish but understated. Yes, the bedrooms are on the small side but it was very efficient use of space, and most importantly, the bathroom was spacious enough. I never felt that there wasn't enough space to put my luggage or any of my things during my stay. High speed internet was provided in the room free of charge, a big plus for me, as most chain hotels still charge for this amenity that really should be free. Loved loved loved the overall atmosphere of the hotel and the decoration of the room itself. The staff were all wonderful and very pleasant. Location-wise there's a lot in the area and you will never go hungry with Maxwell Food Centre being half a minute's walk away. This a great area with many good high end restaurants and hip bars too. Check out The Screening Room just close by, Neil Road is also not far away. The hotel's rooftop bar is very pretty and has a very nice romantic atmosphere. OK, the hotel could be a little closer to the subway, but a 5 minute's walk is not so bad. Despite being on a smaller road, getting a taxi was never a problem. I cannot say enough good things about The Scarlet, and will definitely return next time I am in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Raffles but a great alternative!”
Reviews.Author: JCLON
Reviews.Content: Really imporessed by this boutique hotel. Staff very polite, smiley, and efficient. We arrived early, (7AM) were asked if we wanted to have breakfact while the room was being prepared. Very good breakfast (not lavish though). Very nice decor, in fantastic shophouse in a quiet street in what is becoming a very trendy neighbourhood. Only downside, some rooms have virtually no window. Be sure to ask for a room on the main street.

Reviews.Title: “A very unique and special hotel”
Reviews.Author: RiaTenburyWells
Reviews.Content: From the reviews it was obvious that this was not a run of the mill, impersonal hotel. We arrived to be greeted by a very friendly doorman who took a genuine interest in where we had come from and what we had been doing (diving in Indonesia). The receptionists were very welcoming and attentive. The room was small, with no proper window (although there were two windows very high up that let in a little natural light), but the fixtures and fittings were totally sumptuous. A good range of tea and coffee, complimentary dried fruit, water and a soft drink. Nothing was forgotten with regard to toiletries, polish, slippers, etc. Even an umbrella in case it rained. A large safe in the wardrobe. A good room service menu. Free internet connection. We wanted for nothing. Breakfast was absolutely superb - a cold buffet with a wide choice of pastries, breads, fruit, yoghurt, cheeses, cold meats, etc. etc. and a wide range of choice from the menu too, from local Singaporean dishes to a full English breakfast. Any combination of the above was no problem. The coffee was freshly prepared by the cup, and tasted wonderful. The cutlery and crockery was really quirky. The restaurant setting was fabulous and the staff were very attentive. We checked out at midday and our cases were held until we left at 9pm. We were offered use of the guest shower room at no extra cost. We would definitely stay at this hotel on our next visit to Singapore and would have absolutely no hesitation in recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely atmosphere, staff and breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: Douglas04
Reviews.Content: Lovely boutique hotel - from the stylish entrance and cosy bar to the chic chairs and lighting. The "Scarlet" welcome drink mat, chocolates and drink on arrival in your room were nice touches. Breakfasts were great - tasty and artistically presented. And the staff were very friendly. Easy access to Chinatown and Singapore's newest and very impressive temple. A mix of being in the heart of the buzz while the hotel was a calm haven. And the staff were very friendly and helpful. Bit of a walk into town (we had a bus tour ticket but the times didn't always suit) but allowed us to see more of the city. The room could have been bigger and didn't have much of a view but it's all the plus points we'll remember. Would definitely stay and enjoy the experience again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great rates, luxurious rooms”
Reviews.Author: jaywallington
Reviews.Content: 8am and a basic taxi with a friendly driver whisked us to the Scarlet hotel. After a long flight from London, entering the hotel was a joy. It is the epitome of boutique, an series of old shops opened up inside to create a long flowing hotel. The elegant entrance with water feature and believe it or not, scarlet coloured decor is a real welcome. The room wasn't quite ready (understandable at 8am) but the staff were very professional, took our bags and we headed up the stairs for breakfast in the restaurant. Breakfast is a small buffet with fresh juices and pastries whilst you can also get cooked dishes also. From what I remember, prices were not overly expensive nor a bargain, just what you pay for a hotel breakfast. Despite the reviews on this hotel that the rooms are interior with no windows, it really doesn't matter. The ceilings are lovely and high with massive sky lights and the bathrooms are great. Fluffy robes and small hospitable touches including many different English language tv channels make this hotel perfect for the stop over to Oz. We grabbed a few hours much needed sleep after checking into the room at about 9.30am. Very comfy beds, sanctuary like environment. The architects have done a great job opening out the space into a flowing, enjoyable hotel. The bathrooms in the lobby were also excellent and I believe, a good indicator of the cleanliness and quality of a hotel in general. The rich, dark decor with heavy coloured floors may have made the space seem confined but clever use of mirrors and windows have played a useful role. Mornings bring a free newspaper and I was sad to leave the place. In a nutshell, for £80, this is the definite place to stay in the oz stop over flight.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Romantic Hotel, We Loved it”
Reviews.Author: KazzyBabe
Reviews.Content: We had 6 nights at The Scarlet while we were in Singapore and should we ever return to Singapore we would definately stay here again and would have no hesitation in recommending it to friends. The hotel itself is very romantic, thestaff were very welcoming and helpful. The food was fantastic in all the restaurants in the hotel. Our stay included breakfast and the choice was fantastic. Our room had a lovely balcony and although quite small, very luxurious. My only complaint (if you could call it one) was that the limited space in the room meant that there was nowhere to place our empty suitcases. We had to place them in front of the doors to the balcony which meant moving them when we wanted to go onto it. The bathroom had a lovely spacious walk in shower and was also very luxurious. The location of The Scarlet in Chinatown is ideal for getting anywhere in Singapore. We never used the bus, we went everywhere on the MRT (Singapores underground system), its fantastic and very cheap. The station is a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel if you dont wander round the shops of Chinatown. From Chinatown Station you can get to Clark Quay (great for nightlife and eating) in a few minutes: Orchard Drive (where all the shops are) in approx 15 mins: Sentosa Island in approx 20.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: becks34
Reviews.Content: 2 nights here en route to New Zealand from the UK - what a treat staying at The Scarlet. The building is interesting and quirky and the rooms, whilst small, are so well appointed, the beds so comfortable, the showers so good, that size ceases to be an issue. Small is beautiful! My job revolves around 5-star hotels throughout Europe, and the service at The Scarlet is practically on a par with these establishments. This hotel is visually more interesting and more beautiful than many 5-star business hotels too. The dim lighting is a cool respite from the tropical heat, and I had the best strawberry mojito on the roof top bar I have ever had. The food is superb, the breakfast is very good indeed, and to be able to step out into Chinatown, and also have interesting bars and restaurants within 2-5 mins walking distance is fab. If you want to deviate from bog-standard tourist hotels, I really recommend The Scarlet. I will be back next time I pass through Singapore - this hotel now represents S'pore to me!

Reviews.Title: “Singapore feels like a small village while staying at the Scarlet”
Reviews.Author: C_Dutch
Reviews.Content: Arriving with a cab into Singapore Centre I was suprised with the intimate Scarlet hotel. Indeed the hotel and the room is dark but it has a nice warmth. The rooms are not so big but convenient enough , especially when your touring around town during the day and come in to get some rest. The food-court is closeby and you can wander around China town which is around the corner. Breakfast is simple but with the a la carte menu you have a good start of the day! Don't forget to visit the roof top bar, spectacular view over Singapore by night and has a good restaurant. The bathroom could use a renewal but was ok. Overall, it was a great start for our 4 weeks Singapore / Malaysia and I'm glad we didn't check in a rather cold an businesslike hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love this boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Micshu
Reviews.Content: A really nice boutique hotel in ChinaTown. Next to a good hawker (food-court). Great acces to all ChinaTown's tourist atractions. Nice clean rooms, very cozy. The bathroom was full of cosmetics and other products. The breakfast was nice - a la carte combined with a buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Stuffy, dark and gloomy hotel with unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SitgesDreams
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner in May 2007. We asked for a room with a window and got the most horrible room with a so-called skylight that was hidden up behind a wall, so the light that came in was barely noticeable (i.e, the room was practically pitch black and you couldn't see where the tiny chink of light was even coming from). The room was horribly claustrophobic and over-dressed. When we stated we had asked for a window, the Reception woman who showed us to our room just wasn't interested. In the morning we complained and spoke to a different Receptionist who moved us with no problems and we had a window this time. Breakfast was nothing special in the over-dressed breakfast room. But on the last day there appeared to be a work conference on and there was a sign at the bottom of the stairs leading to the restaurant indicating it was closed due to the function. When we asked where we were supposed to have breakfast, which we had paid for in our booking, the same unhelpful Reception woman just pointed outside and told us to go and find a restaurant outside somewhere! My other half complained at this point and suddenly we were allowed into the breakfast room and there was no function on inside. But we just felt awkward and that we had to hurry. We would never stay here again. For the most part, things just seemed too much trouble for the staff. The narrow corridors wound on forever and were very claustrophic - if they had a fire in there, goodness knows how you would get out in a hurry, particulary from the 'basement' rooms (where we were put initially). The rooms were over-dressed, gloomy and stuffy as was the hotel and for the most part, its staff. An uncomfortable experience. For the record I have never complained about a hotel before, but this one was not nice, considering it was supposed to be higher up the range.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Getwaway From jakarta”
Reviews.Author: oceanjennifer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel as a treat from our family after conducting research for four months in Sumatra. We arrived from Jakarta late at night, completely bedraggled and with tons of equipment. The staff did not bat an eye at our appearance and showed us to the most delightful room and we immediately relaxed into the the luxury of the Scarlet. Our family had splurged on an executive room for us and it was well worth it. The balcony was so peaceful that I wished we had hours to spend there. The room was small, but elegant and very comfortable. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the shower was one of the best I have experienced in a hotel. The staff was very accommodating and when we requested a 4:30 wake up call to catch our plane, we were greeted with hot tea at our door. In all, it was a very wonderful experience for us and we would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to splurge in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “So sexy, elegant and fun...”
Reviews.Author: Hotelier1970
Reviews.Content: From the website, we were amazed... and looking forward to a stay with a "difference"... and that's what The Scarlet offers...and more! The service is very personalized and smooth... loved the serving of welcome drink in the room - which is indeed on the small size - however it was done with such flair + elegance... As compact as the room is, it does have all that you could wish for... all amenities + compendium + info is very well taken care.. and the feeling throughout the resort, wants you to explore more... it's a teaser! Unfortunately we only stayed for 1 night... but certainly well worth it - despite the small rooms, and we were in an Executive Room with balcony (not necessary to book and pay extra for the balcony...as you won't use it!) and the location + shops around are great as well! Would love to come back!

Reviews.Title: “The sexiest!”
Reviews.Author: Alan-Debbie2008
Reviews.Content: Loved it! Enjoyed every minute of our stay there... - Everything is sensual!! - Full of original details to make your stay veeery sexy - Very hip and trendy (beautiful bar) - Rather small rooms - If you decide to go to the cheaper rooms you better know in advance that they dont have windows - The coolest shops right outside the hotel - Great location in Chinatown, close to the subway and taxis - Staff very friendly and willing to make your stay comfy

Reviews.Title: “Super sexy Scarlet”
Reviews.Author: Mr_GDevon
Reviews.Content: A great hotel on the edge of China Town, a great location as most of the main city areas are in walking distance. The room was excellent, on the small side but we found it very comfortable. The bed was the best in the whole of Asia!! Excellent shower as well as quality toiletries....the free internet connection is also reliable and fast. The hotel staff were all pleasant and happy to help, the decor was as per the web site; fun, quirky but with class...a very boutique hotel The only thing we found was the prices of food and drinks, but this was not exclusive to the Scarlet, it was the whole of Singapore!! All in all a great choice...we will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: Pau109
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an amazing stay at The Scarlet and were very impressed indeed. My wife and I stayed for three nights before moving on to Bali. We paid extra for the 'Swank' suite and this was worth every penny. We had a huge comfy bed with clean white linen and a selection of pillows. The bathroom had a jacuzzi bath, walk in shower and ample light and space. The bedroom was a little small with a large wardrobe and small lounge area. We also had a large balcony and seating area. We were aware of previous comments about how small the rooms were, but this really is part of the character of such a small boutique hotel. The staff were amazing and couldn't do enough for us. They were ever so polite and very knowledgable indeed. The hotel is impeccably clean as is the whole of Singapore. The food in the restaurant is excellent but very expensive. The breakfasts were to die for. I would recommend paying for B&B rather than find out the cost on arrival. In view of the cost, the hotel is ideally situated next to China Town and a short walk round the back of the hotel will take you to a huge undercover food area. Meals here are out of this world and much much cheaper than in the hotel. Other than the cost of food, I would recommend this hotel far more than any of the others in Singapore. Other than Raffles, but if you can afford to stay there then so be it!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Weekend Stay!”
Reviews.Author: hippies
Reviews.Content: Am a Singaporean.Stayed one night at The Scarlet with 2 other couples for the weekend get-away.We were impressed with the welcoming clean rooms.We booked the Deluxe but the staff upgraded us to Premium and Executive.The rooms,indeed stunning!Staff were smart and jovial.Very nice lobby landing floor plan and toilets were sparkling clean. Other than the pool which was a bit small,I would really love to spend more nights here!Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Attention To Detail in The Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Elonii
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Scarlet Hotel for two nights and we thought it was a great alternative to the faceless business hotels in the city centre. I must admit the rooms were small, but we felt they fell into the "perfectly formed" category of that particular descriptive term. We loved all the small touches in the room which are never usually present in a larger establishment. We particularly liked the CD that is left in each room with tunes representing the "feel of the Scarlet Hotel". The inclusion of a DVD player was also a bonus. The staff were incredibly kind and helpful, but what we liked most of all about this hotel was its location. China Town is a great place to be in Singapore. There are loads of dining options and interesting markets to wander around in the evening. The hotel is a 2 min walk from Food Street where you can try out lots of different cuisines at brilliant prices (including German sausages). Also a 2 min walk is the bus stop for the Singapore bus tour. We felt it was a great place to be based, and will definately return on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Love (ly) Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luxurydiva
Reviews.Content: Black, red, gold, silk, velvet, chadeliers, mirrors. What an hotel for a romantic holiday or honeymoon. The staff were extremely helpful and the breakfasts were amazing. Its the little touches like the water melon cut into heart shapes and the bright petals scattered over the eggs benedict. Some one with a real eye for detail has set this place up. The shower was good and the bed comfortable. On the downside when I arrived at midnight I was shown to a pokey room with virtually no wardrobe space and an air conditioning conrtol too high to read but I was just too tired to do anything. The next day I asked for a different room and was moved without argument to a much better room although there was still too little clothes storage for anyone staying longer than a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Sexy boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tiedtheknot
Reviews.Content: I have read some great and some very negative reviews of this hotel so needed to add to them! The hotel is tiny, but I already new it would be as it quite clearly states SO on the website that it is a collection of tiny little shop's. It set just outside the city centre in China town which was for us absolutely perfect. I have also seen that someone said they had to wait after 4pm to check-in. We arrived at 7am and would quickly checked in and helped to our room. The rooms are as small as we had guessed but so well planned and finished to the very highest standard. If you want the size of a big hotel chain, then stay in a big hotel chain. If you want to walk into a truly glamorous, opulent and perfectly designed 'boutique' hotel where people know your name and are able to recommend local restaurants, The Scarlet fits the bill. We stayed for 3 nights as a stop over to Bali on our honeymoon. The size of the rooms means that I wouldn't recommend it to people stying for 2 weeks, but most people don't stop that long in Singapore. We will without question be back to The Scarlet the next time we stop-over in Singapore, if not for the hotel ambience, but for the roof top bar's Singapore Slings and the Eggs Benedict in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice!”
Reviews.Author: Snorrido
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night with my wife. Great! Hip and cool. Small but nice rooms, excellent location. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Changyi
Reviews.Content: It was a nice stay. The receptionists were helpful & friendly. But, if the breakfast can have more options, it will be perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Opulane”
Reviews.Author: lux_chick
Reviews.Content: Due to us being there during the Grand Prix the room rates were extorntionate for the size of the room even after we were upgraded from a Deluxe room. Very expensive restaurant/bar and not worth it. Hopefully this was due to this particular period. However a funky little hotel that ticks all the right boxes for young funky people!

Reviews.Title: “amazing place”
Reviews.Author: chacaldore
Reviews.Content: We had a premium room. Hype place, very nice and clean. staff very professional. bathroom with shower and bath with also shower, incredibly fluffy bathrobes. Bed confortable cd with music 'scarlet', kind of lounge music, very cool. The lobby is gothic chic style. I would definetly recommand this place! Also for our honeymoon, we had a plate with strawberries and chocolate!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: CummingsLJ
Reviews.Content: After reading a number of reviews on trip advisor we checked that our room had a window, which it did, a very big one. when walking in the room we realised what everyone meant we could litrally open the door and flop onto the bed. The bathroom was very small but was very luxurious. We did have a few problems with ants on our first day but after mentioning it to the staff by the time we came back from a spot of shopping they had cleaned the bathroom from top to bottom again (we had only arrived a few hours before) and put down ant killer which then when we went out for dinner they came and sorted again. We ate one night in the restaurant the food was lovely and very special though nothing traditional, if you want it traditional food, go to one of many of the food markets the food is good and exciting. The location is the best in the city for culture and variety no street full of shopping malls but beutiful streets and the buddidst temple at the end of the street is a perfect way to start the day. The front desk were fantastic at helping out suggesting iteneries and sorting out taxi's, even when we came in burdoned with shopping in the pouring rain they were so helpful even taking the shopping up to the room for us! Overall great Hotel, fantastic service though small rooms

Reviews.Title: “Modern Boutique Hotel in heart of CBD”
Reviews.Author: VoyagerBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Scarlet for 7 days. It is ideally located across the road from Chinatown, is in the heart of the Financial CBD and is within 5 min walking distance of two MRT stations (train). The Scarlet is an impressive boutique hotel with very professional and friendly staff. There is no need to dine in for any meals because the famous Maxwell Hawker Centre is literally across the carpark from the hotel where one can sample all the local delights with the locals! The room is very small at The Scarlet so do not overpack. This establishment is ideal for the single traveller or a couple, definitely NOT for the family. Besides the fantastic location, amazing architecture and friendly staff, The Scarlett also offers FREE unlimited broadband internet in each room - so bring your laptop! Accommodation rates in Singapore are exhorbitant and The Scarlet is one of the most affordable option when we booked.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel Always Have Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Hui P
Reviews.Content: There is quite alot of positive online reviews about The Scarlet, however I was quite disappointed when I visited it during my birthday last year. We booked the deluxe room but, there were no open windows and the room was small & in an odd shape. There was no bathtub in the small bathroom as well. However, to their credit, at least the room was clean. Basically, there was just nothing for me to rave about, especially when it costs more then SGD$200.

Reviews.Title: “Below all standards”
Reviews.Author: Ludovic18
Reviews.Content: Noisy cramped windowless room! The Scarlet has some rooms without a decent window, the window is a low non transparant one, cannot be opened and is against the ceiling of the room. In our room the strange not precise rectangular form resulted in the fact that the bed at its footend leaves 10 cms of space between the bed and the wall, very practical if you want to pass between wall and bed. Beware also of the fact that behind the hotel are several bars, they use to make loud music until between 2 and 3 in the morning. Upon our remarks about the noise the staff reported that they were aware of this problem. Nevertheless they rent the rooms to unaware guests! Other very weak point is tha so called breakfastbuffet. Very poor choice. Included yes, but every other item is on order from a menu. For a two star hotel maybe acceptable. For us such a bad experience never again.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting”
Reviews.Author: GrouchoSydney
Reviews.Content: Eight days at the Scarlett was an enchanting experience. Every aspect of the service was superb, the staff were helpful and genuinely interested in us and our day. Helpful advice, always warm and friendly.The location is fantastic. If you don't love the Scarlett check your pulse.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: TheGreatDane13
Reviews.Content: Booked stay and pick up directly with the hotel. After a 15 hours flight trip we arrived very tired at Singapore airport. Unfortunately the taxi wasn't there to pick us up, but after a phone call to the Scarlet hotel, the taxi turned up - 30 minutes later. Because of the short delay, the receptionist had upgraded us to a suite from a standard room. We were very impressed - everything was absolutely perfect. Two big bedrooms, a large sitting room, complementary fruit and drinks - and not a least or own veranda with views of China town. Also try out their roof terrace bar and restaurant - a bit pricy, but well worth when sipping of drink, and enjoying the views of Singapore. Would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the ceiling!”
Reviews.Author: oscarRome
Reviews.Content: Our room in the hotel was without a window as well. We had no idea that we had previously ask for a window. But when we arrived there and we saw the room we immediately asked for it but we did not get it. Anyway, the lack of window was not the worst, since we have been given a room with a strange ceiling, which was made of glass(???) probably and when at night the rain began to fall we woke up in a horror as we thought that we were under attack because of the terrible noise the rain made on the ceiling. the second night we got used to it. The buffet breakfast is very good as well as the room for freshin-up when you have checked out hours before and you have returned to collect the baggage. That room was a great and a very useful surprise!! P.S. I have not understood the criteria for some hotels to be named "boutique"hotels

Reviews.Title: “A nice little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: dancemonkey
Reviews.Content: Hotel Scarlet is full of character. A small, boutique hotel, it has friendly staff who catered for all our needs. Upon check in, we were assigned a room without a window - beware of these if you like some fresh air! We returned to reception and we were immediately swapped into another room. While the rooms are on the small side (I prefer to call them cosy), there is plenty of room for a short stay. The rooms are very well fitted out and come with free internet. The bathroom only has a shower and was starting to show a little wear - a bit of a refurbishment maybe necessary in the not too distant future. The hotel is in a fantastic location and there are some very cool, local restaurants and bars within easy reach. The hotel also has a nice roof top bar for a singapore sling at sunset. Breakfast was included and most food options were available.

Reviews.Title: “Scarlet”
Reviews.Author: CasparLondon
Reviews.Content: Mine was a mall room but clean and luxuriously appointed, however a little disconcerting to not have a window, though not all rooms are like this. Good buffet breakfast included and beautifully presented. Friendly and helpful staff. Ideal for Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Good boutique hotel, nice change form the chains”
Reviews.Author: M4RK_H
Reviews.Content: Good location on the edge of China town, so plenty to see and do within walking distance. Sayed 2 nights on a stopover to NZ.The building used to be a row of shops, which explains the rather small (but adequate) rooms and strange multi level corridoors, but finished to a very high standard. Many rooms don't have windows, so upgrade & request a window if you need natural light during your stay. All the staff we dealt with were very helpful and friendly. No pool to relax in, but they do have a nice outdoor hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Can't swing a cat!!”
Reviews.Author: Oz-Bluey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ultra trendy and the rooms ultra small. In our standard room, the bed had to be placed on a strange angle to the corner of the room or you wouldn't have been able to walk around it. There was also an annoying 25mm step between the bedroom and the bathroom......countless stubbed toes!! The Scarlet is a very smart looking hotel, red and black decor, fashionable wooden antique furniture and only 5 minute walk to Chinatown. More suited to young people (most of the staff young groover types, but very helpful) I think.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but sassy and fun”
Reviews.Author: mridolfo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights on a stopover to New Zealand. We had already read reviews on TripAdvisor, so were aware of the fact that room would be small. What we were not prepared for was how friendly the staff were and how unusual the hotel is, in terms of layout and decor. If you like walking, the hotel is a reasonable walk (approx 20 mins) from the Quays, passing the old Chinese quarter. We didn't eat at the restaurant, but breakfast offered a good choice, with very good service. Just behind the hotel, there is a local food court, with a huge variety. It is true that the rooms are small, but knowing the history of the building (a former bordello), this adds to the charm. Our only minor complaint was that the room smelled quite musty, but we have had that in other Singapore hotels too. Don't choose this hotel if you want a large, non-descript chain-style experience, but if you want something a little more quirky, try the Scarlet. M & H, Bournemouth, UK

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: KiwiMountMaunganui
Reviews.Content: This was a lavish experience worthy of a far greater price. After staying in many hotels in Asia over the past 18 years this has to be the friendliest luxury hotel ever. The interiors design and colours are mood evoking and stunning to be amongst. The breakfast not a vast choice but totally satisfying with service at its best. It is truelly a boutique hotel where every detail has been thought about. To be able to have access to a shower 6 hours after checking out before going to the airport for free is such a great add on. The room was imaculate and roomy enough. The bed was perfect and the quietness hard to believe. Being able to stroll into the character parts of old China town and check out the trendy small night spots and shopping made life easy and exciting. No wonder its an award winning hotel. I will definitely return next year to this same beautiful hotel. Treat yourself to such opulance. You wont regrett. No photos as the online website shows it so well. Its every bit as good as it looks.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok by Singapore standards”
Reviews.Author: hotchr
Reviews.Content: I felt like this hotel was overpriced. But I don't think it's so much the hotel's fault, but Singapore in general. This city-state is getting more and more expensive, and it's a shame but it's true. Anyway the hotel is fine, biggest let down were small rooms. I got upgraded to a deluxe room and all it had for a view was a skylight. The bathrooms need to have a little more attention paid to them, esp. with regards to caulking. Mold was a problem around the shower door hinge on the floor and around the sink. Gross. Bathrobes were a nice touch, as was the blazing Ethernet. Breakfast was not included but who needs it with the Maxwell hawker center close by? I thought this would be all worth it, but lots of vendors are closed for breakfast. And as expensive as taxis are now, I would rather just stay at the Intercontinental and be linked to the MRT at Bugis station...the IC costs more but you get a pool and better access. Here at the Scarlet you have to walk all through Chinatown's touristy stalls to get to the hot and humid MRT at Chinatown station here, an annoying pain making your way through the maze of touts and sweaty tourists. No pool either. Rooftop is pretty nice at night though. I went up there with a friend and no one came over to offer us anything. Which is just as well considering how expensive drinks are. Good thing there is a 7-11 literally steps away, but then there is just about everywhere in Singapore. Stylish to be sure, but the velvet is frayed around the edges so to speak. Not well maintained like it could be. They even turn off the beautiful entrance "water wall" fountains late at night. Why? Anyway this place is ok but not worth more than $100 USD a night IMO.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty has its price!”
Reviews.Author: n3k
Reviews.Content: One of the most beautiful hotels we have ever stayed in. Everyone should at least spent one night in this hotel. Anyone sensible will at most spent one night in this hotel. Beauty in its purest form,every detail artfully crafted, a real showpiece. A pity though that the rooms are tiny. And when I say tiny, i really mean tiny. Perfect for an overnight stay or a person alone. A no go for a multiple days stay. The rooms are so tiny, you don't want to spent any moment not sleeping in them. If you reserve a room, specify you do not want a windowless room, unless you have a fascination for dungeons. Two negative experiences during our stay : - I forgot some personal effects in the room. Called the hotel three times, was promised a call back every time. Call never happened. - Beautiful open air restaurant at the top floor. However, massively overpriced and simply bad service

Reviews.Title: “Good for dinner/drinks but not to stay”
Reviews.Author: MIWSing
Reviews.Content: We live in Singapore but just had a night at The Scarlet Hotel after a friend's birthday there. So what's good and what's bad? The good things are the hotel's dining facilities on the lower level and roof level. Gorgeous boutique hotel (ie pretty "high camp" if you know what I mean, but done pretty well) atmosphere and great food and great service. So the birthday event went really well and I'd book the place for a function if ever I needed to. But the bad things are that we decided to stay the night. We booked a deluxe room and on being shown the room, our first reaction was that we'd cancel the booking and go back home to stay as the thought of staying in a tiny (extremely tiny) room with no windows was not something we had any intention of doing! However we were told if we paid $130 more we could have a better room, so we agreed (in a moment of madness) and were shown a room on the 2nd floor -- exactly the same size as the first but with a deck -- obviously the deck cost $130 a night, which is pretty pricey given the amount of time you would spend on a deck overlooking a little alley and a multi-storey carpark! The room decor was great and in keeping with the rest of the 'over-the-top' high camp decor of the hotel, but it gets hard when there is barely enough room for one person to walk around the bed (which is only a double in size). Like with many of these boutique hotels, they're great when they're new but sometimes maintenance is a bit lacking. Ours had a broken shower nozzle, a soap dish in the shower that was nearly falling off the wall, curtains that needed some readjustment as there were off their tracks and difficult to close, etc. They are small things but when your bill ends up being $480 - for one night, which is what the price of an executive room with balcony is when you include the 10% surcharge, the GST and breakfast for 2, then you feel a little ripped off. I would never stay at the Scarlet again, but I would go back for dinner, drinks or hold a function there. (By the way, our friends stayed in The Swank suite which we also saw -- so instead of one little room they got two little rooms but one was a lounge area and they had a slightly bigger deck, but to be honest for the money, if I could stay anywhere in Singapore (within reason), I'd stay at the Fullerton Hotel -- where we've stayed many times and where everything is always perfect!! ). I hear the Scarlet hotel is a favourite amongst the gay community -- not surprising given the decor

Reviews.Title: “Swank”
Reviews.Author: Tattoosydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Scarlet for two nights as a stopover on our return from Europe. Overall it was a very nice experience, with only a few small issues. The first issue for many people could be the decor. The designer appears to have been allowed to go mad and do whatever he wanted, as long as he stuck to a "Bordello" theme. It is very over the top - lots of lush fabrics, gilding, striking patterns and whimsical statues of naked angels. The pictures on the web site will give you the idea. While I found the decor quite entertaining and well designed, if your taste runs to the minimal or to Laura Ashley chintz, then the Scarlet may not be for you.... and I imagine that if you were staying for more than a couple of days, you might be craving a bit of stark minimalism fairly quickly... We stayed in a Swank Suite, which was quite large by Asian hotel room standards - a small lounge room, separated from the bedroom and bathroom by a windowed corridor lined with heavy curtains, and a balcony which ran the length of the suite. There was not much of a view from the balcony (into the apartments next door) but it had very comfortable chairs and a lounge. It seems from many other reviews, however, that if you aren't prepared to pay for a suite, your room at the Scarlet will be small and windowless. If you're not going to front up the fairly hefty cash for a suite, then you might be disappointed. The suite had wonderful air conditioning, and fans on the balcony. The bed was very comfortable. We were given a lovely fruit basket and free water bottles on arrival. The suite is well appointed with a safe, umbrella and all sorts of other handy extras. Breakfast was ok, and the staff in the dining room were very helpful in making up a breakfast tray for me to take upstairs after my boyfriend decided he wanted to sleep in... The hotel is very handy to Chinatown and a short walk from a Metro station. Problems are only minor ones - the bathroom door is see-through, and so when you turn on the bathroom light during the night, the entire bedroom is lit up like a stadium. Not good if you are a light sleeper. The shower tends to run off into the rest of the bathroom. While the door staff were very helpful and friendly, the desk staff seemed a little out of their depth at times (although they certainly weren't rude, as some reviewers seem to have experienced). I enjoyed the Scarlet a lot, and would quite happily stay here again. However, we are staying in Singapore again in July, and on the strength of just a few little niggles with the Scarlet, we are trying somewhere else, so, all in all, not entirely a rave review despite being very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't live up to my expectation”
Reviews.Author: sundaybrunch
Reviews.Content: I checked-in at 4pm and I was told my room was not ready (given that their website or it is widely acknowledged that the standard checkin time is 2pm). The front desk staff were not helpful. I asked them if they could put me in any rooms so that I can get changed and put down my luggage. I was told that I can use their toilet to do so. The room is small and has no windows if you are not prepare to pay the preimums for the upgrade. I like the free internet access and the amentities that I get, but I prefer not to stay in one of those no window rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Big problem with the staff”
Reviews.Author: ozintokyo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great in a super location in Chinatown. The problem is the staff. Unfriendly, unhelpful and rude. The front office / door people are so unfriendly; they look away when you are approaching and then ignore you. Sooner or later this hotel will go out of vogue and the only thing left will be the staff and atmosphere that has been created. I hope the Scarlet sorts out the staffing issue before it is too late!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HaninNZ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Scarlet Hotel for 3 nights in December and was very pleased with the hotel and its location. The hotel had many useful little extras such as umbrellas and free bottled water. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room felt very luxurious with a unique style. The bathroom was very clean which is something I am very particular about and the shower was extremely powerful – great for soothing those aches and pains from a full day of sightseeing. The complimentary bathroom toiletries were also of a high standard. Some of the reviews see its location in Chinatown as being a disadvantage but personally when I go visiting a country I like to stay in an area which more represents the culture of the country as opposed to the touristy areas which could be anywhere in the world. The hotel is also located a few minute away from the MRT giving easy access to anywhere in Singapore. I had the complimentary breakfast at the hotel which was to a high standard with lots of variety, and also had some drinks at the roof top bar which had a nice outlook across Chinatown. I would definitely recommend this boutique hotel over other more well known chains which have no personality or personal touches.

Reviews.Title: “Really Liked The Scarlet”
Reviews.Author: julesblkjk
Reviews.Content: Only had 2 nights at The Scarlet and loved the room. Great looking hotel with beautiful rooms. Small but comfy and elegant. Cold drinks and dried fruit waiting for me in the room. Liked the Chinatown location. Didn't eat in the hotel due to the cheap eats all around. Upon my return to the US I was emailed and told that $8 would be charged to my credit card for juice and chips that I'd eaten from the minibar. I emailed back and explained that I didn't eat or drink anything and they didn't charge me. Was pleasantly surprised at how easy it was to rectify the situation. Staff was helpful and friendly. Would recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Oh so plush!”
Reviews.Author: Mellie_J
Reviews.Content: Arriving at 1am from a long London- Singapore flight I was exhausted, cranky and in desperate need of some luxury. And The Scarlet was just what I needed! Upon arriving in Erskine Rd, I wasn't entirely sure about the outside - it looked like a row of private homes put together, but all of my fears were relieved when I was welcomed in to the lobby..... Pure luxury! Water fountains mark the entrance to the black marble floors, the plush, velvet red couches, fresh flowers, gold chandeliers, low lighting...all the things that give a boutique hotel that opulent atmosphere. The staff were friendly, helpful and very professional throughout my stay. They helped me find tours, services and great restaurants as well. And the meals were amazing quality! The rooms were perfect too, with great attention to detail. All the way down to the little notes left for you throughout the room, explaining how to use/open/start/purchase things. The bathroom and the bedroom were immaculately clean and had everything you could think of...even torches, umbrellas, slippers and shoe polish for you to use! And the bed was oh so comfortable (although anything would be at 1am in the morning after a 12 hour flight). As for price, $470 SGD for 2 nights, including tax, which is about £75 a night. Really not expensive if you compare it to the bigger chain hotels. You could get hotels closer to Clarke Quay or the Marina, but really, at a 10-15 minute stroll or $5 SGD cab ride, seriously the position doesn't matter. And its right in the heart of Chinatown, so great nightlife, atmosphere and eating at your door. Would recommend this to absolutely anyone and WILL come back to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting and unique”
Reviews.Author: stonecroft
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights with Wife and two teenage daughters. We booked two seperate rooms which included breakfeast. The girls loved having their own room. The price was very reasonable for the two rooms. The hotel is interesting and unique. I would say it is more suited for adults. We did enjoy our stay and it is located within a 5 min. walk to Chinatown. A safe neighborhood. There is a small convenience store several hundred feet from the hotel entrance. We had no problem getting around Singapore from the hotel, taxi, bus or MRT. Smoth check-in and check-out. The bell staff was very helpful and knowlegeable, one man looked like dracula. A good base to explore Singapore. Rooms were very nice and clean. I reccomend the Scarlett.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but Not Impressed with front desk staff at all”
Reviews.Author: icedkachang
