Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel over 6 months ago after reading about it in several travel magazines. I booked for two executive rooms with balcony through the Expedia web page. I paid for and confirmed these bookings with the manager a month later. I arrive in Singapore, and instead of an executive room with balcony, i am shown to a ground floor room. When i point out to the girl that this is not what i had paid for, she asked me to "see the room first before i make any decisions". The room was nice, but obviously not what i had paid for, and I was upset that they would even bother to try this on me especially since i had the confirmation email with me and had shown it to her face. I was then asked to wait in the lobby for about half an hourwhile they look for another room. I was told this would "take some time" as the "hotel was full". I was then shown a second floor room with small balcony, again not an executive suite, and this one smelled like smoke. I was willing to stay in this room except it stunk too much like smoke and having been upset with my first encounter with hotel staff, I complained again, and was finally moved to the type of room i had requested and paid for in the first place. the hotel was not full, and I think the way i was treated was quite unprofessional and inappropriate of a hotel of this calibre. The rooms themselves were lovely, nice bath products, and excellent location in chinatown, very close to night market, a good variety of resturants and bars, hawker stalls, 7-11, wedding dress shops, and the MRT station. Chinatown has beautiful restored shophouses and a beautiful Hindu temple. the hotel itself has a bar (mentioned in several magazines) and has swanky furniture, lots of chandeliers, and even its own CD to set the mood! the hot tub on the 2nd floor is quite small but nice for 4 people at most. the rest of the staff were kind, helpful, and accomadating. no newspapers although they have fancy leather boxes on the doors for this.

Reviews.Title: “stylish but tiny”
Reviews.Author: surferchik
Reviews.Content: This was a stunning hotel with beautifully furnished lobby and rooms. The rooms were quite tiny, but also clean and well furnished and had everything we needed including a safe, flat screen tv, umbrella, and very nice toiletries. There was a balcony which looked onto a parkade. The only downside was the room smelled like smoke even if it was a non-smoking room. The jacuzzi was very nice and we enjoyed relaxing on the patio. The hotel's location is great. We didn't eat at the hotel but had dinner at a well-known singaporean restaurant a few blocks away called Blue Ginger. Fantastic pork satay and chicken curry. We went early so we got a table without a reservation, but you would probably need one after 7. There are some upscale clothes and home decor shops nearby. Nearby attractions including a Hindu temple, Buddhist temple and the Chinatown night market. There is also a Kaya toast restaurant a few blocks away which is a nice place to try the local specialty for breakfast. This hotel is within easy walking distance to an MRT (subway) station from which you could access Clarke Quay, Boat Quay, any of the downtown attractions, Raffles Place, Little India, etc. I had a bad experience getting money exchanged at the Bank of China two blocks from the hotel. Not only did the teller try to short change me, she also refused to exchange some US bills stating they were "too old". I had gotten the money from a Canadian bank a week before and they looked perfectly okay to me! The exchange rates (for buying and selling currency) were posted on the wall so it was fairly obvious that I was not getting the correct amount. After I pointed this out, the amount was corrected. I would advise tourists to be alert for this type of thing.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Tess13
Reviews.Content: The rooms are on the smallish size, but are extremely comfortable and quiet. No windows, but beautifully fitted out and the staff are extremely helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet was really good. Great location for exploring China town.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ErnaButterfly
Reviews.Content: Love the chic and glamourous decor

Reviews.Title: “If I die and go to heaven, I hope it's as nice as the Scarlet!”
Reviews.Author: JSPMadison
Reviews.Content: Wow! We started our three week trip in South East Asia in Singapore and spent 5 nights at the Scarlet. Beautiful, perfectly appointed room, incredible atmosphere throughout the hotel, impeccably trained staff, and ideal location. Plus, for cheap and delicious meals, the Maxwell Hawkers Center is just across the street! (If you don't have breakfast included at the hotel, don't buy the very pricey buffet -- it is delicious, but way too expensive when you can eat wonderfully for $2 across the street)I would absolutely recommend the Scarlet, and hope to get back to Singapore, in large part to get to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: frian
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of August for 4 nights and had a great stay. Yes the rooms are small but they are very clean and we found the service to be excellent. We had a meal in the Breezes Restaurant on the rooftop of the hotel and it was really lovely although expensive. There are so many things to do and see in Singapore we would really like to go back as we feel we have just scratched the surface. The Scarlet for us was a central base to where you can reach most attractions such as Clarke Quay, Raffles, Orchard Road etc very easily.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel room without a window in Scarlet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vechi
Reviews.Content: I got to know this hotel from its beautiful website and stayed there one night recently. According to their homepage, it stated that the standard/Deluxe rooms are windowless so I booked an Executive Room with twin size bed. But I was surprised the room is no window, very small even compare with the same rate hotel in Tokyo. I checked with their manager and was told that some Executive rooms are windowless unless stay in Suite Room.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising Scarlet”
Reviews.Author: simonlazenby
Reviews.Content: My new company put me up in the hotel for the night and I really loved the hotel. It’s extravagant kitch…with over the top froufrou décor - great fun. The staff were extremely hospitable without being intrusive or condescending. Rooms were good size. Very clean bathroom, good quality linen and everything I needed. I took room service for breakfast which was surprisingly good – coffee was excellent! The bar and restaurant areas are cool, cosy and intimate. A touch of Parisian style in the middle of China town, I’d certainly recommend staying here to my friends/family.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: leamingtonlady
Reviews.Content: I stayed for nearly a week and absolutley loved it. It was really good fun: the hotel was gorgeous, the staff were attentive and knowledgable about the local area and they thought of everything before you knew you needed it yourself. I would definitely stay again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good boutique hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: yen-chi
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel with my accrued airmiles for two nights and was surprised at how nice the hotel looked when i arrived. I had read up about this hotel on tripadvisor and was expecting very small rooms with no windows. It was not a good start as room was not ready when I arrived at 3pm. But when i finally got the room, it was small but had a nice little balcony with views of back buildings though. Despite the smallish rooms, they were decorated very nicely and had all the necessary mod coms. The facilities were inconvenient, so luckily the location was great for being out and about. Chinatown was on your doorstep, so very convenient for cheap, good food. Worth taking the tour bus S$23 pppday, which took you around singapore and u could get on/off whenever at the bus stops. The stop on north/south bridge road is the nearest and only 5 mins from hotel. Staff are very friendly and so no complaints there. Can't comment on the breakfast as the beds were so comfy, we missed it every morning! But plenty to choose from in the chinatown food stalls and very cheap!! I would stay in this hotel for the location if nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chinatown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Njhammers
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Boutique hotel located in Chinatown Singapore. My wife & i stayed for Two nights & loved this hotel, decor is wonderful & staff are fantastic. Roof top bar is very romantice & a truely memorable setting. yes the rooms are small but exquistly furnished.Ice service in time for cocktails is a great touch. Location is perfect for club street bars & fine dining & Roti prata breakfast at Maxwells food court is 2 mins away!!! Gym is small & not well equipped, but for a short romantic break in a funky, notyour usual cookie cutter hote then the Scarlet is perfect! We loved this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money...”
Reviews.Author: gamaldeslouches
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Singapore on business for two weeks (from June 23rd - July 7th). Unfortunately, all the major hotels were booked so I really had no choice but to book at the Scarlet. I performed some research and knew ahead of time that the hotel's standard rooms were windowless, so I avoided those rooms and got a pretty decent size room - but my view was really bad - the back end of a dirty food market. My bed sheets were always had stains, regardless of how many times room service came - seems like all their sheets are dirty; It felt a bit unsatinary. The hotel's lounge/bar isn't bad, but the social scene is very weak. What really made my experience at the Scarlet bad was when I wanted to mail my rent (I live in NYC) to the landlord located in NY. I discussed this with hotel patrons and their assured me that the mail will be sent that day (June 26).. Upon my return to NY I found out that the landlord received the check on July 13th, with a posted date of July 7th. The hotel actually kept my mail for over 10days and never informed me of it. Not only did I get a heftly late charge on my rent, but now there is a slight blemish on my tenant's record. A hotel that isn't dependable, clean, and trustworthy - stay away from the Scarlet!

Reviews.Title: “Yuk”
Reviews.Author: BeenDone
Reviews.Content: I will never stay in this hotel again. Given problem with booking, was charged full rack-rate for a shocking room...tiny, mismatched furniture, noisy, useless desk, closet too small to hang trousers, and ordinary service. Could not even find enough space to put my luggage on the floor. Would recommend against this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: scotthumphries
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 4 nights last October on our way back home from Europe. The room was small but beautiful and functional; the bed was very comfortable. Most importantly, given our jet lag, the room was very quiet and we had no problems sleeping in till noon. As you would expect in Singapore, the service was excellent. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. There are many nice little touches - such as delivering a full ice bucket to your room just in time for cocktails each afternoon. We did not eat at the restaurants, choosing instead the very cheap and cheerful Maxwell Road Food Centre just across the road for most of our meals, but the downstairs and especially the rooftop bars are great. The location is perfect - Chinatown is an interesting area and - interesting for the gay travellers - it seems to be a bit of a gay enclave too with several friendly gay bars in the area. There is an MRT stattion just a short walk away which can whisk you downtown and then an easy connection to Orchard Road, and it is a relatively direct and very cheap taxi ride to the airport. We had a great stay at this fine hotel and would happily stay there again. We were very satisfied

Reviews.Title: “Quite a let down”
Reviews.Author: ikax
Reviews.Content: I went to stay at the hotel last week. The exterior of the hotel is great. The furnitures in the lobby are cute and funky (great background for nice pictures), the first impression that you get while waiting to check in is really nice. The front desk staff are generally helpful and polite. But that is all about the things that are nice about the hotel. First the location, though it is right next to Chinatown, it is not exactly very near any train station. You have to walk like 15 mintues in the hot humid weather of Singapore and that is really not quite enjoyable especially if you're out all day and want to get back to the comfort of the hotel as soon as you can. The rooms are small small small and we were told we were already given one of the bigger rooms! There is hardly any space to walk between the bed and the TV. There is only a walk in shower (though the water pressure is good), no tub. The 'jacuzzi' that they had is really really pathetic. Very small and located on one side of the hotel that can only be accessed by a particular lift. So unless you stay on the same side of the hotel, you basically have to walk through the lobby in your bath robe, past a nice fancy restaurant to access the lift. EIther that or you have to wear your street clothes and bring all your gears (swim sutis, towels, bathing things etc) to go there and change. Given the size of the jacuzzi, it's not really a huge draw factor. Also, they posted on the web saying you pay $200 for a usualy $250 room as a 'promtotion'. But it is really just some business tatic. What they did was they took out the 'breakfast' component. What kind of 'promotion' is this when you're not getting everything? Then we have a rude incident. My husband and I were taking pictures OUTSIDE the hotel and got stopped by one of the hotel staff who not only very rudely told us that we cannot take pictures of the hotel (we were happily snapping away INSIDE the hotel and was never stopped!), worse thing is he stayed and make sure we pack our cameras away and keep glancing back while he walked away to make sure we don't 'sneak' out our cameras again! Overall, a very dissappointing experience. From the reviews here, I had high hopes that I would enjoy the stay but sadly to say, I'd rather stay at the nearby Hotel 81 (cheaper and much closer to the train station) though it may not be as 'classy'.

Reviews.Title: “Bad long wait for a room”
Reviews.Author: Blizzyyyy
Reviews.Content: Came here for a weekend getaway on 19th May. The good things: Lovely lobby, friendly doorman, interesting decor. All the good things that have been mentioned. The bad: Arrived at about 12.30pm. The official check-in time is 2pm, but figured, at the most, i'll have to wait a while for my room. Time spent waiting: 2.5 hours.. Yes. 2.5 hours. Checked in at 3pm. They took 2.5hrs to get the room cleaned, after being assigned the room i asked for, a room with windows. I think it is unacceptable, for any hotel, to take their time to clean a room, knowing a guest is already here waiting for his room. Apparently, they will clean the rooms in the usual order, and will not clean your room first, preferring to let you wait 2.5hours. Though, kudos to the doorman, for at least offering me a glass of iced water while waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: Designez
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights at The Scarlet and they were a blast. Yes the standard rooms are small but really nicely decorated. After reading some reviews I decided to ask specifically for a room on the 1st floor with a window. I got that but the window was pretty small and could not be opened (not that you want to anyway). At least I could see the sun and what the weather was like. Every room has a complimentary Internet connection which is great for planning trips and finding places! The in-room safe is big enough to accomodate a standard sized laptop (not the new widescreen Macs). The location is in the middle of Chinatown. A MRT station is very nearby and the taxis are dirt cheap. There are tons of eateries around and a 7-11 just around the corner . The only things that bothered me was the noisy airconditioning and minor brown calcium stains in the bathroom. But overall it's clean. The housekeeping staff can be overzealous at times but you have a "Not to be disturbed" sign for that. The staff was really helpful and laid back. I definitely recommend it for the young-minded and metropolitan traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Design but Small Small Small”
Reviews.Author: WinKz
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Scarlet quite a while ago for a long weekend getaway. First of all, the fact that they took more than 3 hours to check us in was just horrendous. I had informed them we were arriving at a certain hour, but they were totally unprepared. After making us wait forever, they also made little effort to seem apologetic. Room was nice, furniture and decor very well-maintained. But tiny, at best small. And this was the deluxe room.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and Fun”
Reviews.Author: Pesky_Peche
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews on this hotel, I decided to take a chance and book anyway, and never regretted a thing. The hotel is a little out of the way compared to many of the larger hotels, but that adds to it's charm. The decor inside is fabulous, a rich mix of dark colours interspersed with bright red. Check in was simple, with the added touch, that the person who checks you in escorts you to your room, pours you a drink and shows you around. We were staying as part of our honeymoon, and were treated to a big plate of fresh fruit and strawberries dipped in chocolate. The hotel is right on the edge of Chinatown, and within easy reach of 2 MRT stations and easy access to a taxi. The food was exceptional, if a little arty, and the restaurant and staff were brilliant. The concierge (huge bloke) was always on hand to give you directions and advice and tips as to where to visit and how best to get there. A very quirky, very fun and very friendly hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Great Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ThailandBestBuy
Reviews.Content: I Get price around B3500 from octopustravel that is expensive for me. but when i come to room it's very valuealbe money. every piece of furniture is perfect that i ever see before. service is very good police and helpful. but hotel i very small pool and small room standart with now window. breakfast is few choice for you but is yum yum.

Reviews.Title: “Windowless & Claustrophobic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UP95
Reviews.Content: If you have seen the website of this boutique hotel you will be very impressed. So was I but when I arrived their found to my horror that Standard which they 24 of them are all single rooms in basement with no windows whatsoever. The size of the room is 50 Sq. feet. I was there for 2 nights and couldnt sleep at all. It felt i was in kuchi tunnels of HCMC, Vietnam. I advise you to check carefully their website and spot any windows in any rooms photograph - there are none. Also, they dont show the standard room at all. I have blacklisted this hotel...go at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected gem!”
Reviews.Author: London_Lady_78
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a six-day stay at the Scarlet hotel. It was absolutely fantastic. The hotel was a completely unexpected gem. Having seen the website, I thought it might have been slightly on the pretentious side, but the staff were so wonderfully charming, friendly, knowledgable and helpful that I couldn't have enjoyed my stay more and would return at any time. The room was beautiful, if on the small side, with an delightful array of beautifully scented lotions & potions, fluffly robes, slippers, and lots of other touches that made the stay fun (all the stuff that you never get the time to use when travelling with work!). The facilities were also excellent - great bars and restaurant, good gym to work off all the delicious food, outdoor jacuzzi, DVD collection... And, all importantly, the location couldn't have been better: 5 min walk from the Chinatown MRT. This being my first time travelling to Asia, I was apprehensive about spending three days alone before being joined by a friend. Any concerns were dismissed the moment I got there, and I was just as happy wandering the city as I was staying in the hotel. We checked out at noon and returned to pick up our bags at 7pm for the 11pm flight home. We weren't looking forward to spending the 14hr flight all sticky (95% humidity in Singapore during our stay), and the hotel were happy for us to use their hospitality room to shower and change before leaving for the airport. We were two incredibly happpy guests!! I don't normally contibute to these sites, but had such a great holiday that I want others to have the same opportunity. PS The lychee martinis in the hotel's bars are phenomenal...

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: thunderkitty_van
Reviews.Content: I quite enjoyed my stay at the Scarlet. Yes, the room was small, and yes, there was virtually no windows (just a skylight), but this did not bother me; and to be fair, they warned me about this before checking in. The room was beautifully decorated; it felt like you were staying in a very posh friend's guestroom, instead of a generic hotel. The staff was great and very helpfull without being too over the top. And they have the most beautiful scent in the lobby! The location is great: within walking distance to Chinatown underground station and in an hip neighboorood. The lobby bar (Bold) is a bit overpriced though: S$8 for a cranberry juice! The Scarlet is not for everyone, but for those who like hip, boutique hotels, you will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “The Scarlet - Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandGardner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there in January 2007 on the basis of the Luxe Guide and Lonely Planet and booked thru Zuji so our rate was much better than advertised rates ($AUD1200 for 5 days, includ a dinner). Value for money at that price as we travel frequently but we would not pay more. Be aware - the Scarlet appears to be a member of the Luxe Group and so the review in Luxe is a little biased. The breakfasts were excellent, coffee was great and service efficient. Counter staff etc were friendly and helpful. Top bar (Breeze) was disappointing as it wasn't open until 7pm and the view is a bit dull. Location was great, only 10 mins walk from the Chinatown MRT station. The room itself was stylish but small and after a few days we really felt the lack of natural light and started to lose track of time. Also, due to lack of sunlight the walls were starting to get a slight mould. However, the daily service was efficient. Bed was very confortbale. Cable TV fine and free broadband was good. Overall, we enjoyed our stay but feel it would have been ideal for a couple of days but no longer.

Reviews.Title: “Form over function - and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: thmilin
Reviews.Content: I'm a bit torn here. This is certainly a place of quality design - but in the interest of being a boutique hotel it in effect does what, say, South Beach Miami does - charge you for the interior design, not for the quality of your USE of the room and hotel. I decided to get one of the suites - knowing the rooms would be small based on other traveller's input. I wanted a desk to finish working on my novel with, a quiet place to be, a lush and sumptuous experience. Indeed, this is an ultimate place for romance and it works for a very brief (3 days, max) stay. It's around the corner from the beginning of Chinatown (historical), is indeed right next to Maxwell Food Centre (hawker center), about 15 min leisurely walk to the nearest MRT and otherwise not really NEAR the heart of Singapore - Orchard Road. The room itself has sumptuous designs, and a tv with hardly any channels. Couches not really meant for sitting on - more for looking at. A desk with a chair not really meant for sitting at for more than 30 minutes (imagine me trying to work!). A beautiful shophouse verandah with fans - that was pretty awesome, and it had a chaise longue I admittedly never used. Since the Suites are entirely different from the rest of the hotel I have to balance the review - I appreciated the sexy decor, the sleek trappings - but things were so overdone that I'd rather they have made things more practical. At the very least, do NOT make me pay S$440 a night when the bed is hard and there are 5 TV channels, no dvd player, no movies, a limited room service menu, and no phone by the bed! (It was in the bathroom ... and in the living room ... but not by the bed.) There was no simple on/off light switch - instead, a 5-button lighting "range" system. No space for your luggage rack and suitcase. Correct - doormen were almost never at the door. Sometimes - only sometimes - if it rained someone would appear to help you in/out of the hotel with an umbrella. I often had to lug heavy bags of shopping on my own from car to the door and elbow my way in. They behave like a boutique hotel - a phone for the belldesk, which is 10 feet from the front desk. You'd call and have to "be connected" to the belldesk. It would ring endlessly. No one would answer. I'd call down again, ask again, wait again. Then have to *leave a message for the bellman to call me back.* You chalk this lack of ease and amenity to their not being as well staffed as a major hotel. It still isn't acceptable for the price you're paying. I was "accidentally hung up on" multiple times in the course of my stay. Put on hold and forgotten. Etc. When I was nice and easy going, things were slow, didn't really get done, I was left to fend for myself. However, when I got bossy and began to do things like say "I need a taxi right now" or "I need you to fetch a box for me to ship to the USA" - they'd make a limp effort to help. BUT - at the end of the stay I left a tip and guess what? They were all smiles and entreating me to return. I think not. I'd note the women of the hotel are generally lazy. Singaporean women are kind of 50/50 - some are unbelievably sweet, but anyone around 25 or younger has an attitude and acts like she doesn't want to be at the front desk or it's a pain to be doing her job. They generally look like they're sulking. Case in point, I walked into the 7-11 down the block (these are EVERYwhere) and saw two workers and said nothing expecting they didn' t want to be bothered with dealing with a guest (and vice versa). One was female, one was male. The guy made a point to say my name, wave, and greet me, smiling. The girl looked flicked a look at me, rolled her eyes, puffed on her cigarette, and then pointedly ignored me. They were both in uniform, and we were all literally at the end of the hotel block. I assume they were on break. I would buy snacks and bring back dinner from other places, eat them in bed, set the tray on the floor by the bed before sleep. Next day - the staff had cleaned their own dishware and leave the dishes/old food *where it was* - festering, still on the try, by the bed! This happened multiple times. The room service was fine - prompt delivery, nice staff. Restaurant very sexy, food pretty good - you can get more amazing food elsewhere for less, even of high restaurant caliber (try the spanish restaurant on Club street - fab!). But nice staff, sexy ambiance, great for couples. Really great and extensive drink menu. You do get little nibbles in your room on your arrival - little dried fruitbowl, fresh fruit bowl. Everything super pricy, drinks, restaurant, room service. Agreed, furniture takes up a lot of space. It's not necessarily bulky, just more interested, again, in design, not function. You want to be able to move around the room and have space for your suitcases and shopping and not to have to "strategize" your belongings. Bathroom was, as all Singapore hotel bathrooms are, lovely. Black marble, sexy and sleek. New and satisfying, rejuvenating. Lighting in the bathroom dim, however. Not much of a lip between floor and shower, so some leakage. Bath products frequently refilled from Flair, the boutique store next door (with which they also decorate their hotel rooms - the garbage bins, leather dining trays, glassware, etc.). My suite has an entire wall of shophouse window doors so I cannot speak to the darkness/window element, but the hotel is 3 floors tall (they fake the "4th"), and on an incline. Thus, the farthest corner is underground. Also, considering I had a suite - and paid what I paid - it was interesting that the cleaning cart was perpetually - and I mean PERPETUALLY, day and night - parked immediately outside my door and the elevator next to my door. Not very sexy. Sometimes it had a custom cover on it, sometimes not. I was so busy not being in my room that I never checked out anything else in the hotel. Oh, but note that for a place with a gym and jacuzzi, these guys don't have a business center! There is, however, free internet in the rooms. The plug is not necessarily anywhere convenient for you to use (the desk with the uncomfy chair). And the universal power outlet is only by the desk so, if you want to plug in things like cell phones or a travel radio anywhere else in the room - good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Rosamund
Reviews.Content: At first the front desk told me that only premier rooms were available, at S$300+++ per night. I took a premier room, but I was shocked that at this price range, the room is in the basement has no windows! I went back to the front desk and requested for another room with windows, but were told that none were available. Then I asked for a full refund. The staff asked me to wait for a few mins. Then she returned and told me that they have an executive room at S$215+++ with windows. It was quite clear to me that they were trying to sell me a more expensive room in the first place. The executive room was very small, but at least it has large windows and is very bright. But the room is clearly meant for one guest only. There is only one toothbrush, and only one complimentary drink. The bed is too small for 2 person, and very hard. Don't believe the photos you see on their website. The hotel is not as nice as the photos. Don't expect anything close to 5-star, more like 3-star. I feel that the front desk should inform the guest about the premier rooms having no windows, and that the executive room is meant for one guest only. The service seriously needs to be improved. The location is good, right opposite a very famous food centre with lots of cheap food, and near the interesting alleys of Chinatown. But I would not recommend anyone to stay in this hotel, due to the poor service and uncomfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: kateb1977
Reviews.Content: We loved our time at the Scarlet Hotel. We arrived into Singapore at 3am and were greated with smiles at the front desk. Our family in Singapore had dropped off a basket of treats for us which was waiting in our room. The room was beautiful and the bathroom spacious and clean. The staff was always helpful in giving us directions, getting taxis, etc. It's a romantic little hotel in a great location for eating and exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: Chica-linda
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight between flights. It was perfect for us - the Chinatown location was great (around the corner from a food court, cool shops, a neat park). We also walked to the Quays for dinner, and found the Ice Bar to cool off! The room was small, but for a couple was just fine. The bathroom was good sized and had nice featuers. The room was clean! Didn't spend time in the lobby or bar per se, it looked like a scene. We'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Sophisticated Decor”
Reviews.Author: christalee
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the last minute (3am before a 10am flight) with little idea of location or quality. When I arrived for my 3 night stay I was very pleasantly suprised. The hotel was positioned only a short walk from Chinatown which was perfect as my stay coincided with the Chinese Autumn Festival. The room was smallish - but for a single traveller, absolutely perfect. The room "extras", quality toiletries etc, were a welcome suprise. The staff at the hotel were unbelievably friendly and helpful and made my first stay in Singapore truly memorable. The location I felt was ideal. Walking distance to the Chinese market (great place for a lovely, cheap meal) and the rail system, which I found extremely easy to navigate. The thing that set the accommodation apart, however, was the elegant decor of this boutique hotel. The "scartlet" colour in the reception, the cool sophistication of the restaurant....and as for the rooftop bar.....well I'm just glad it took until my last night to discover it or else I doubt I would have seen much of the rest of Singapore! All in all, a great hotel that I will definately recommend and return to.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: bruisyard
Reviews.Content: We loved it.. Staff excellent, and used our names all the time. Room lovely (so what if it's not huge you're not there a lot!), with great bathroom, and smelly stuff, and lovely decor. Breakfast really good, and we loved the rooftop jacuzzi after a day out walking. Location excellent, on the edge of Chinatown, and really easy to get to pretty much anywhere. The food court opposite the hotel is fantastic. We would definitely go back, the Scarlett was so much nicer than the usual 5 star souless chain hotels

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you can.”
Reviews.Author: PeterAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the title "boutique hotel" It sounds better than it is. Hotel is pretentious, over rated and over priced for what they offer. Rooms on ground floor have no windows, it is like sleeping in a bunker, Very noisy, not many TV channel choices. On the first level the rooms are tiny with big heavy furniture. Doormen are never at the door. Anyway, if you can avoid this hotel do so.

Reviews.Title: “Too Much for what it is!”
Reviews.Author: JezandStacy
Reviews.Content: The room was very small, and all the furntiure was very boxxy, only adding to the small feeling. The larger rooms had no windows so no matter what there is a claustrophobic feeling. The room was clean, however the cleaning schedule is erradic. The restaurants in the hotel are far too expensive, and there are no vegetarian options, however the location is good for getting to eating places.

Reviews.Title: “Too bad about the service”
Reviews.Author: mjcSING
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with spouse over New Year's. Romantic design. But service was poor. Doorman who didn't hold open the door. Poor lady at check-in was doing everything. Server at breakfast had to be asked to explain the breakfast choices. 4 star in design and look but 2 star service. A shame.

Reviews.Title: “The Scarlet - a perfect boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Markandlindsey
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Scarlet hotel for 3 night in mid-September. We would have to say that this is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. We had looked on trip advisor before booking the hotel and had been concerned about the size of the rooms but we were more than happy with our room. It was not large (and i wouldn't call it spacious) but it was big enough for the two of us and was bigger than some other boutique hotels we have stayed in in the US. Our room only had a small sky light window which could be claustrophic depending on your disposition but it did not bother us - to be honest we didn't see the point of having a big window when there was no view of any note (the hotel only has two levels) and we spent most of our time our sightseeing anyway. The skylight gave us plenty of light. The rooms are well equipped with thoughtful items such as umbrellas provided which was particularly useful for ourselves as we had forgotten ours. The bar up on the roof is fantastic and the cocktails are a must. The service we received throughout was fantastic - particularly from the concierge (Raymond - if i recall correctly) who booked us dinner tables etc very promptly and efficiently. We didn't try the restaurant but from what we could see it looked very nice. One thoughtful touch was that as our flight was early evening and we had to check out of our room they let us use the jacuzzi changing rooms and shower to freshen up before we departed. Overall we really enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: DLPA
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights and it was fabulous! Specifically requested for a room on a higher floor with a window (most rooms lie below ground) and got a decent sized room on the 3rd floor - only problem with this was the long walk to the lift, but the nice room was worth it. Free broadband internet connection to all rooms was a bonus and the amenities provided (TV, DVD player, bathroom supplies) made it feel like a 4-star hotel, not to mention the stylish comtemporary interior design. Very conveniently located downtown, near Maxwell food market where great local favourites can be found, and Ann Siang Hill and Chinatown are great places for tourists to take a wander around. All in all a great stay and highly recommended for people who enjoy boutique hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly looks, little substance”
Reviews.Author: skydam
Reviews.Content: To start with the positive, the hotel looks great from lobby to rooftop restaurant. However, it looks better than it really is. Checking in was a bit of a hassle with check-in time moved forward several times. The rooms are indeed quite small, and the only natural light in the room came through a very small window high up. The bathroom was simply not very good. Very small shower head, low water pressure, impossible to keep the water temperature stable. The sink was clogged. These are all things (cleaning) staff should have picked up on already. The doorman, although looking the part and very friendly (as most of the staff were), unfortunately didn't offer much help beyond hailing a cab and loading the luggage. The rooftop restaurant has a great view of surrounding Chinatown, but the food was not very good. The large seafood platter was almost entirely frozen and the seafood itself rather poor in quality. With all the great food available in Singapore I wouldn't visit again. Staff seemed inexperienced. Overall one leaves with a feeling of the Scarlet being an ambitious hotel, but nowhere near reaching the level of some of its similarly priced competitors. This could be a good hotel if management would train the hotel staff better in locating problems and fixing them quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong for a stopover hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christopher88
Reviews.Content: Travelling from Australia to Asia or to Europe, Singapore is often a stopover point. Previously we have always ended up at a massive hotel, including some of the ones listed in the top rankings of trip advisor. The pricing of these is a bit silly if staying for less than 24 hours. This time we were looking for something a bit boutique. The Scarlet was perfect for an overnight stop and excellent value. The staff were very acommodating. The food markets across the road are also good to grab a late night snack amongst the locals. The rooms are TINY. However the fittings and finishes are great and the ambiance is pretty cool considering the rest of Singapore (from what we have seen) is a little teflon coated. The only down side was the water pressure in the shower, the simple breakfast and the only window in the room was a skylight. Notwithstanding we would DEFINITELY stay here again for a one night stop.

Reviews.Title: “Scarlet, i love you...”
Reviews.Author: ccrr77fr
Reviews.Content: OK, The Scarlet is maybe not so perfect but so charming i tend to forget the wrong details. We stayed there in March 2006 and we have been very surprised about the difference of this hotel. There is no comparaison in the world with this ultra sophisticated decoration. We have stayed in the Splendour Suite and it was large and comfortable with an adorable terrace perfectly romantic for an evening cocktail. Bathroom is of the best quality with a lot of amenities and there is a very warm atmosphere. About the staff, all of them are trendy, helpful and quite smily and i don't have any complain about them because they really want to make the customer happy of the stay. Breeze and Bold are two nice places for a cool drink with hype people and again this unique atmosphere but the breakfast at the restaurant is simply terrible with very bad food quality and a service not really professionnal. However, once again, congratulations for the decoration. About the other problems of The scarlet, just be careful not to make a reservation for a room without window because there are several rooms like that and not only in the lowest category... Take some ear plugs because the soundproofing is not the best. If not, the other things are really satisfacting and there is a real charm absolutely exquisite and i'll return there often because i love difference.

Reviews.Title: “Swish little hideout”
Reviews.Author: plutzplutz
Reviews.Content: Booked a night at one of the premier rooms for my girlfriend's birthday. Really Chic. Was a tad disappointed at first though coz the premier room that i saw earlier at the ground floor was quite a fair bit bigger than the one that i got. (I was later told that all the rooms are different) Nevertheless, it still looked very nice and had a balcony (which the bigger room did not, though there was'nt much of a view) A few gripes which concurred to some of the other reviews i read though. First of all, the aircon was really rather noisy. Also the soundproofing isn't all that great, so you can generally hear some sounds from the floor above. Despite that, i still think the scarlet's worth staying. The service was great and the decor excellent, from the corridors to the reception desks to the restaurant. There's even a nice rooftop bar which offers pretty nice views. We enjoyed ourselves there.

Reviews.Title: “Happy at the Scarlet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Rooms small but not problematic. We booked an executive room which wasn't that much more expensive but seems to have been worth it, room faced to rear with tiny balcony, very quiet. Service was really good: prompt and friendly. Breakfast was good - lots of choice, if you want somethiing different just ask. Having stayed in the Swissotel Stamford (great views) on a previous visit I wanted a change. I found this location better and atmosphere much less impersonal. Roof top bar is pricey but you get a lovely breeze up there! Maxwell food court opposite has great cheap food, as do all the other food courts. Only problem we had was that taxi drivers seemed to find it hard to find so we stopped using the hotel name and got dropped off on the main road.

Reviews.Title: “For the discriminating tasted”
Reviews.Author: weiwei22
Reviews.Content: After pouring over reviews of singaorean hotels I made the decision to go for the Scarlet, despite warnings of tiny rooms and windowless rooms. I am really happy I made the gamble as it is exactly what I had hoped for, designer chic, dramatic, mysterious, unique... definitely not for traditionalists, as it is indeed much tighter than what we are used to, but I would say the boutique feel and uber hip atmosphere (even the air smells very new age) more than makes up for everything else. I stayed in a delux room, i.e. one level up from the most basic one, and it was comfortable enough. I imagine the executive rooms and suites would be much bigger though much more expensive. Service was always cheerful. Free internet access too! highly recommend to book early for good rates at Ssiabesthotel. They require at least two days in advance so I had to spend more by booking on Asiatravel. all up was about 205 sing dollars per night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice change from the usual chain hotels”
Reviews.Author: Londoner75
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Scarlet for 2 nights in December on our way to Perth. It was the first tim I had flown long distance (from London) and I was exhausted when we arrived. But the Scarlet did not disappoint. The welcome we received was incredibly friendly and attentive. We had booked a deluxe room and were taken to a lovely room on the second floor with a balcony overlooking a side street. Our room was also next to the outdoor spa and so on our first night we ordered a bottle of wine and sat in the spa which was very relaxing. I agree with some of the other comments on here that the rooms are quite small, but ours had enough room to walk around in and the bathroom was lovely. Unlike another reviewer on here our towels were changed and we had no problem with room service etc. We ate at the restaurant on the top floor which has views over Singapore and Chinatown and the food was great. I would highly recommend this Hotel - the staff will look after you in any request you may have and the be, after a 13 hour flight, was the most comfortable ever!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Tiny Rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having heard rave reviews on this "trendy" hotel, I decided to book it for my first trip to Singapore..boy was I wrong! The rooms were TINY, the bed was right next to the door and the bathroom was like a broom closet. There was no where to put luggage, or to walk around, as the hallway outside is also small and dark. The bed was comfortable enough, but like others said, the check in was delayed and there wasn't any real food service that we could easily access. Not comfortable. And the hill walk next to it is a nightmare, plus alot of cab drivers didn't know where it is exactly, so we had to haul that stupid internet map with us everywhere. Should have stayed somewhere else, anywhere.......

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay at the Scarlet”
Reviews.Author: LightWeaver
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review to show my appreciation for the efforts of the Scarlet Hotel’s staff in making our stay a memorable one. My girlfriend and I wanted to find a place where we could spend a night together and celebrate her birthday. We came across the Scarlet Hotel at the ---- website where it was categorized as a boutique hotel. As there aren’t many boutique hotels in Singapore, we were curious to find out more about the Scarlet and decided to stay there. We placed a reservation thru AsiaTravel for a 1-night stay in a Standard Room from 7 Jan 06 to 8 Jan 06. After making the reservation, we came across some reviews on Tripadvisor where guests who have stayed at the hotel complained that the hotel rooms were small and had faulty air-conditioning and water faucets. As I was going to celebrate my girlfriend’s birthday at the Scarlet, I wanted to make sure that the Scarlet was the right choice. As such, I requested (from the hotel) to view a Standard room, 3 days before check-in. The hotel staff obligingly acceded to my request. When I arrived at the hotel, one of the front desk officers told me that all the Standard Rooms were either occupied or were being cleaned. He kindly showed me a Deluxe Room on the first floor, which he said was quite similar to the Standard Room in terms of amenities like the DVD player and the bathrobes, but Deluxe rooms were slightly larger. The moment I entered the Deluxe Room, I was very impressed with the interior décor. The room is small when compared to Deluxe Rooms of the city area hotels like The Oriental and Marina Mandarin. However, the efforts made into making the room plush and elegant outweighs the small room size. I also want to add that the hotel staff who showed me the room was very patient and acted as a good guide when I requested to see the hotel facilities such as the jacuzzi “Soda” and the restaurant “Desire”. After viewing the room, I requested from the hotel that they provide me with the following for my stay: ·I wanted red rose petals to be laid out in the room, bed and bathroom before check-in. ·I wanted a room which is located away from the lifts or noisy areas for privacy ·I wanted a room with a skylight. I understand from the hotel staff and the Tripadvisor reviews that standard rooms either had a skylight or had no windows. The difference was that those with no windows had king beds as opposed to queen beds for those with skylights. ·I wanted to order a cake for my girlfriend’s birthday but the hotel offered a complimentary cake, which I appreciated very much. I must mention that 3 days before I checked-in, I had made some phone calls to check with the hotel on the rose petal arrangements with the florist, etc and the different hotel staff were very patient to help in my queries. If they had promised to call me back to confirm on some of my questions, they would. This is the type of service, which I expect from a fine hospitality establishment. On the day of the check-in, the front desk staff made sure that the check-in was smooth. One of the staff actually accompanied us to the room to open the door for us. She mentioned that the hotel had prepared a lighted candle in the room so she had to make sure that the lights were switched on at the correct time. The location of the room was as I have requested. It was located in a corner away from the main corridor so it was quiet and we could not hear the noises of the people walking past our room. When we entered the room, I was wow-ed. The pictures that I have attached to this review speak for themselves. The strengths of the Scarlet Hotel which I have experienced from my stay, can be summarized as follows: ·Good hospitality service where the staff is attentive to the guests’ needs. It’s the staff who bring out the best in the hotel. I want to highlight that I have reserved a Standard Room with the Scarlet, which is the room with the least cost. Yet, I was offered the service equivalent to that of a guest who might be staying in the suite. I am impressed by this and would like to urge the staff of the Scarlet hotel to continue, if not exceed this level of service. I am sure your guests will choose to stay with you during repeated visits if they feel at home (which I did) at the Scarlet. ·Detailed attention to the décor of the hotel interior and the rooms. The rooms are plush if not lavishly designed. Leather ice cube holders, waste bins, shoe holders and even a leather coat for the chain of the door latch reflect the intricate attention to details by the hotel’s interior designer. Designer bathroom toiletries “Flair” and amenities and the bathrobe make a shower refreshing. Some of these items in the room can be purchased from a specialty shop “Flair” located outside the hotel. The shop’s website can be found here ----. ·A cosy hotel in the midst of Chinatown where shops and food are available. We were at the Scarlet when the light-up in Chinatown for the Chinese New Year took place. There were fireworks and we were lucky enough to catch a good view of the fireworks display. If you are looking for a hotel where room-size, facilities such as a swimming pool are key consideration factors, you might be able to get the room that you require in another hotel for the same price. The downside is that you would be missing out on what I have listed above. If you are interested to find out more about the Scarlet and to make sure that it meets your expectations, you can check out the hotel’s website, where a fact sheet is available. ----. The fact sheet is accurate about what the hotel has and does not have to offer. One of my conversations with the hotel staff touched on the fact that the hotel’s website did not provide sufficient pictures for potential guests to have a better expectation of the accommodation and facilities offered by the Scarlet. As such, one area of improvement that the Scarlet could consider is to provide more pictures of the hotel accommodation and facilities on its website. For locals, I believe if you give the hotel staff some advance notice, they would most likely be willing to show you the rooms before you decide to stay with them. Last of all, I would like to give my most sincere thanks to the staff at the Scarlet hotel for having done an excellent job in making my stay a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Scarlet”
Reviews.Author: spbyrne
Reviews.Content: Why is it that Asian hotels seem to do it so much better than their European and American counterparts? I think it's the attention to detail that always makes one feel that much more special. So the Scarlet, alongside Raffles and the Peninsula in Hong Kong is one of those. My only complaint, like the American, European and English hotels is that the towels are never big enough and always scratchy, so what is with bath towels in hotels? Does anyone have a good bath towel experience?

Reviews.Title: “5 star image ... but ....”
Reviews.Author: BC_traveller154
Reviews.Content: Sorry to say, this hotel does not measure up to its image, as presented on the net and in its public rooms. A plus: Staff service is eager and attentive. However, my room #118 (an executive room, i.e., 2nd of 5 price categories) had serious problems. First, while nicely appointed, especially the bathroom, the main room walls had unsightly spill stains on them. Second, the air conditioner was very noisy, with a vibrating sound produced either by the grill or the fan. Third .. However, one had to leave the air conditioner on, since with it turned off, one could hear clearly the conversation of persons in the room above. (These two persons seemed to be speaking at normal levels, i.e., not a party.) Fourth, the internet connection in this room did not work. The staff person sent had no expertise. While I thought at the time that it might be my computer, subsequent stops on my trip proved otherwise. Finally, I was surprised to find myself in a windowless room. This was not an issue for me, but could be for many other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “These guys have the wow factor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am told by my cab driver that The Scarlet botique hotel in Sinagpore is always booked out. If so, how lucky was I to get a room at this fantastic property. It's located in Chinatown and admittedly there isn't too much in the way of malls or western eateries in the area. Leaving that behind I have to say I was so impressed with the entire stay and I mean literally from the time I stepped out of the cab. My bag was taken from me and I was welcomed into the funkiest lobby I think I've ever seen. It reminded me of what it might be like to be in a jeanies bottle. The guy who showed me to my room also showed me how everything in the room worked and actually spent time making sure I felt comfortable with all the amenities. Remember they're not working for tips in SInagpore so this was REAL service, straight from the heart. I happened to mention that I like a firm pillow and sure enough minutes later there was a knock at the door and a firm pillow arrived. My room was small, plush yet functional and very comfortable. I had a heavenly night's sleep and awoke to take breakfast just down stairs. Again, funky decor, friendly staff who were attentive yet understood I was still waking up. $13 bucks for a teriffic set menu which had a bit of everything on it. Great coffee and comfortable seats. I have to say I am used to staying in the usual consumer brand hotels because of my job (150 nights a year). The Scarlet was out of my regular pattern however it paid off and I loved the personal service and attention to detail. If location isn't everything give this place a go, they are very cool!

Reviews.Title: “Never to return.........”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am never to return to Scarlet. The feedback from tripadvisor, images from ---- all seem very impressive, nevertheless this is not the real case. Rooms are extremely tiny, it fits in a queen size bed, a desk but there is no room for luggages. All you would do is staying in the bed, there is no leg rooms. The bed is right next to the door and you would know exactly any conversation outside your room. As a Hip Hotel, towels are not to go the laundry everyday even they are used and wet. One toothbrush is provided in a twin room, and please don't expect you will have an extra one. Same case for shower cap. The air-condition is lousy, i was told it cannot be fix as all rooms share the same mother air-condition. I wanted to top up and move to a suite, give me the space which I would have it anywhere else but not Scarlet. Nonetheless, the suites are all occupied. I asked for cancellation as soon as I was in the room for 5 mins and realized all these problems, yet they cannot do me this favour all that is because this is their policy. My travel agent has not yet paid Scarlet, and I only occupied the room for 5 mins. Yet Scarlet said there is no cancellation could be done. Shame...........

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Nontoxic
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Scarlet hotel, but I agree with the other reviewers that the rooms are small. Also, the bathroom fixtures were not as luxurious as other hotels, but everything functioned properly. Catching a taxi was easy most of the time, by walking to a nearby busy street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 weeks. This hotel is very good and in a fantastic location (Chinatown, markets, close to downtown - many good restaurants close by). Initially I was put into a noisy room above the bar. I requested to be moved and ended up in a much quieter room. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are small but modern and clean. Highly recommended. I would definitely stay here again. Great value too.

Reviews.Title: “Small but beautiful .....”
Reviews.Author: AntonyM
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5 day stay at this "boutique" hotel - we read in advance that the rooms could be small, and our Deluxe room was indeed small by modern hotel standards but it was very well designed, furnished to a high standard and contrary to some reports we had a proper window (not just a skylight). Best of all the staff were very attentive and helpful throughout our stay - checking in at 9am after a long flight was no problem at all. The rooftop bar restaurant (Breeze) has a great ambience. The hotel is located in Chinatown, only about 5 minutes walk from the MRT through streets lined with shops and foodstalls. Overall - definitely highly recommended for those who don't want to stay in a corporate concrete box hotel (like so many are these days).

Reviews.Title: “A Proper Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a proper boutique hotel that I would definitely recommend to others. From check in to check out the service we received was exemplary. We expected the room size, however, we were impressed that they had utilized the space so well - very luxurious. The breakfast was very well presented and good, both bars worth visiting especially the roof top one. We've been to a lot of good hotels internationally, many of which have been boutique ones and we thought it was as good as the Soho Grand. Thanks to a website called Tablet Hotels, we now know where to go to find some of the most sophisticated boutique hotels in the world, which we plan on going to one by one!
